title: Front Desk Coordinator
description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span data-contrast="auto">Thank you for considering a career with </span><strong><span data-contrast="auto">Revive Med Spa</span></strong><span data-contrast="auto">—a dynamic and rapidly growing leader in aesthetic medicine. As San Diego’s top-rated Med Spa positioned for growth, there’s never been a more exciting time to join our team.</span><span data-ccp-props="{}">&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span data-contrast="auto">With eight locations and a team of expert RNs, PAs, and NPs, we provide a comprehensive range of non-surgical aesthetic treatments, including Botox, fillers, regenerative therapies, and advanced skin rejuvenation.</span><span data-ccp-props="{}">&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span data-contrast="auto">At Revive, we’re proud of the positive, performance-driven culture we’ve cultivated over the last 20 years. Our core values—client obsession, accountability, continuous improvement, open feedback, kindness, and innovation—guide everything we do.</span><span data-ccp-props="{}">&nbsp;</span></p></div><p>Job Title:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>Front Desk Coordinator</strong></p> <p>Department:&nbsp;&nbsp; Store Administration</p> <p>Salary: $20-$23 per hour, depending on experience level</p> <p>Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Maintain front area setup and appearance</li> <li>Check clients in and out for their appointments</li> <li>Describe products and explain their benefits and uses to potential customers</li> <li>Communicate with customers in person, by phone and by email to understand their needs</li> <li>Maintain a working knowledge of the company's various products and services</li> <li>Establish and nurture relationships with clients visiting the store</li> <li>Monitor messaging systems for client communications</li> <li>Complete administrative tasks, such as processing and recording sales, as needed</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Skills:</p> <ul> <li>Interpersonal skills and comfort with meeting new people on a daily basis</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li> <li>Willingness to adapt</li> <li>Good at taking constructive criticism</li> <li>Quick thinking to provide creative solutions that address customers' needs and concerns</li> <li>Time management and prioritization skills to manage multiple appointments happening throughout the day</li> </ul> <p>Organizational Relationships:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Reports to Store Manager</li> </ul> <p>Job Requirements:</p> <ul> <li>Must be able to lift 25 lbs</li> <li>HS Diploma required</li> <li>Please note that our business is subject to the CA Department of Health mandate for healthcare workers to be vaccinated, so vaccination is mandatory for all staff.</li> <li>Bilingual Preferred</li> </ul> <p>Experience, education, and training:</p> <ul> <li>One to two years of experience in a relevant area of aesthetic medicine</li> <li>2-3 years of front desk experience</li> <li>Previous medical spa experience a plus</li> <li>Familiarity with relevant software, including Zenoti, Microsoft Office and Filemaker</li> </ul> <p>Location:</p> <p>Sunnyvale, California</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Revive Med Spa is an <span class="searchHighlight">EEO</span>/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.</p></div>

title: Associate Dentist (Invisalign)
description: <h3><strong>We’re Expanding – Join Our Team!</strong></h3> <p>An exciting opportunity awaits an enthusiastic, confident, and highly skilled Dental Associate / General Dentist (Invisalign Experience) to join our modern, high-end, 100% private dental practice in Bexleyheath, Kent. As we continue to grow, we’re looking for a dedicated clinician to become part of our dynamic and supportive team.</p> <h3>Why Join Us?</h3> <p>This role is perfect for an ambitious associate seeking to thrive in a fully supportive environment, working alongside experienced clinicians treating high-net-worth patients.</p> <h3>About Zental</h3> <p>Zental is a boutique, fully private dental group operating in London and Buckinghamshire. We are committed to providing exceptional patient care in a calm, relaxing, and harmonious setting. Our mission is to help people live longer, healthier, and happier lives through optimal oral health and well-being.</p> <h3>The Practice</h3> <p>Our Bexleyheath practice features:<br>State-of-the-art dental surgeries with the latest technology<br>A contemporary, modern ambience<br>A prime high-street location with excellent transport links<br>A full range of dental services, including cosmetic &amp; restorative dentistry, periodontics, oral surgery, orthodontics, sedation, implants, facial rejuvenation, and digital dentistry</p> <h3>What We’re Looking For</h3> <p>Essential Requirements:<br>✔ GDC Registered<br>✔ 2+ years of private practice experience<br>✔ 5+ years post-graduate experience<br>✔ Invisalign Experience<br>✔ Meticulous attention to detail<br>✔ Ability to build and grow a patient list through pro-active marketing<br>✔ Exceptional communication skills &amp; an energetic personality<br>✔ Commitment to ethical, high-quality dentistry<br>✔ Long-term commitment</p> <p>Preferred Skills:<br>Experience in General &amp; Cosmetic Dentistry<br><br></p> <h3>Key Benefits</h3> <p>✔ Competitive private fees with excellent growth potential<br>✔ Work alongside experienced specialists &amp; a highly skilled team<br>✔ Ongoing support &amp; professional development<br>✔ Access to an in-house study club<br>✔ Career advancement opportunities<br>✔ Modern surgeries &amp; digital dental software<br>✔ Experienced dental nursing support</p> <p>If you're passionate about delivering high-quality dentistry in a forward-thinking, high-end private practice, we’d love to hear from you!</p> <p>Apply today and take the next step in your dental career with Zental!</p> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.</p> <p>Want to know what our teams think about working with us? title: Associate Dentist (Prosthodontics)
description: <h3><strong>Join Our Outstanding Team at Zental – Associate Dentist Opportunity</strong></h3> <p>Are you Dentist with experience in <strong>Prosthodontics </strong>seeking an exciting opportunity in a high-end private dental practice? Zental, located in <strong>Bletchley, Milton Keynes</strong>, is looking for an enthusiastic professional to join our team for <strong>1-2 days a week</strong>, with potential for growth.</p> <h3><strong>Why Zental?</strong></h3> <ul> <li><strong>Modern Luxury</strong>: Our practices feature state-of-the-art dental surgeries with the latest equipment in a sleek, contemporary setting.</li> <li><strong>Prime Location</strong>: Situated on a bustling high street with excellent underground links.</li> <li><strong>Comprehensive Care</strong>: We offer a wide array of services, including cosmetic &amp; restorative dentistry, specialist periodontics, endodontics, implants, facial rejuvenation, digital dentistry, and more.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>What We Offer</strong></h3> <p>At Zental, you’ll work alongside experienced clinicians, supported by a Treatment Coordinator, in an environment designed to help you <strong>flourish and grow</strong>. You’ll treat High Net Worth patients, build lasting relationships, and enjoy the benefits of a fully supportive, patient-focused practice.</p> <h3><strong>About the Role</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Provide General &amp; Cosmetic treatments<strong>.&nbsp;</strong></li> <li>Manage Invisalign and cosmetic leads with precision and care.</li> <li>Build and grow your patient list through proactive marketing strategies.</li> <li>Deliver dentistry of the <strong>highest ethical and clinical standards</strong>.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>What We're Looking For</strong></h3> <p><strong>Essential Requirements</strong>:</p> <ul> <li>GDC Registered with 2+ years private dental practice experience</li> <li>4+ years post grad experience&nbsp;</li> <li>3+ years prosthodontic experience</li> <li>Strong attention to detail and a meticulous approach to care.</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills and an energetic, personable demeanor.</li> <li>A commitment to long-term growth and success.</li> </ul> <h3>Key Benefits</h3> <p>✔ Competitive private fees with excellent growth potential<br>✔ Work alongside experienced specialists &amp; a highly skilled team<br>✔ Ongoing support &amp; professional development<br>✔ Access to an in-house study club<br>✔ Career advancement opportunities<br>✔ Modern surgeries &amp; digital dental software<br>✔ Experienced dental nursing support</p> <p>If you're passionate about delivering high-quality dentistry in a forward-thinking, high-end private practice, we’d love to hear from you!</p> <p>Apply today and take the next step in your dental career with Zental!</p> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.</p> <p>Want to know what our teams think about working with us? Visit our <a href="https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Overview/Working-at-Zental-EI_IE5215464.11,17.htm" target="_blank">Glassdoor Page</a></p>

title: Dental Nurse (Fully Private)

title: Dental Technician / Ceramist
description: <p><strong>We’re Expanding – Join Our Team!</strong></p> <p><strong>Dental Technician / Ceramist (Self-Employed, Part-Time – In-House Lab)</strong><br><strong>Location:</strong> Cricklewood, London<br><strong>Hours:</strong> 15–20 hours per week (Ad Hoc, with potential to increase)<br><strong>Contract:</strong> Self-Employed</p> <p>Are you a skilled&nbsp;<strong>Dental Technician or Ceramist</strong> with a passion for precision and aesthetics? Join our in-house lab at our established&nbsp;<strong>private dental group in London</strong> and become part of a collaborative, high-end clinical environment. We are seeking a self-employed professional to support our in-house lab with ad hoc work, averaging&nbsp;15–20 hours per week, with the potential to expand based on lab demand.</p> <p><strong>About the Role:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Working alongside our experienced clinicians and clinical teams, you will:</p> <ul> <li>Create high-quality ceramic and prosthetic dental restorations</li> <li>Contribute to natural-looking, bespoke results for private patients</li> <li>Work flexibly around clinical schedules and lab needs</li> <li>Be based at our in-house lab within our luxury practice setting</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we are looking for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experienced <strong>Dental Technician or Ceramist</strong>, GDC registered</li> <li>Strong aesthetic and functional understanding of private restorative work</li> <li>Excellent attention to detail and finishing</li> <li>Flexible, reliable and self-motivated</li> <li>Comfortable working independently and collaboratively</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Us:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Zental is a&nbsp;healthcare brand which is a fusion of private dentistry and affordable luxury. We are passionate about creating a relaxing, calm and harmonious environment where we can offer the highest quality of care where patients feel at ease to come to the dentist. Our ethos in about making people live longer, healthier &amp; happier lives through maintaining an optimum level of oral health and well-being.&nbsp; &nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Essential requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Excellent attention to detail</li> <li>Experience working as part of a large team</li> <li>Experience with dealing with patients directly from working in the clinical environment with clinicians and other team members</li> <li>Understands importance of excellent customer service</li> <li>Engaging and a great communicator with the ability to build trust and rapport effectively</li> <li>Willing to continue learning and involve in upskilling where needed</li> <li>Values a good team culture</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits of working with Zental:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Excellent team support working with a highly skilled team</li> <li>In house/training support and opportunities for future growth.</li> <li>All Core/essential CPD paid for.</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities to move into other roles or other parts of our rapidly growing organisation</li> <li>Access to Zental tailored Perks</li> </ul> <p><strong><em>Interested?</em></strong></p> <p>If you have the skills, abilities and enthusiasm to succeed in this role then we would love to hear from you.</p> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.</p> <p>Want to know what our teams think about working with us? Visit our <a href="https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Overview/Working-at-Zental-EI_IE5215464.11,17.htm" target="_blank">Glassdoor Page</a></p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Dental Therapist
description: <p></p> <div><strong data-olk-copy-source="MessageBody">Dental Therapist – Cricklewood</strong></div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <div>We’re looking for a dedicated and motivated&nbsp;Dental Therapist&nbsp;to join our award-winning, fully private clinic in Cricklewood, North London. This is an exciting opportunity to become part of a thriving multidisciplinary team in a modern, patient-focused environment.</div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <div><strong>The Role:</strong></div> <ul data-end="802" data-start="498"> <li> <div>Initially 1–2 days per week, with scope to grow as demand increases</div> </li> <li> <div>Supportive diary with referrals from in-house clinicians</div> </li> <li> <div>Excellent earnings potential with strong clinical support</div> </li> <li> <div>Work closely with dentists, specialists, and treatment coordinators to deliver a seamless patient journey</div> </li> <li> <div>Our therapists, on average, earn over £100K per year full-time pro rata.&nbsp;</div> </li> </ul> <div><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <div>As a Dental Therapist at Zental, you’ll play a key role in delivering preventive and restorative care, including:</div> <ul data-end="1401" data-start="942"> <li> <div>Providing hygiene therapy and periodontal maintenance</div> </li> <li> <div>Delivering preventive advice and oral health education tailored to each patient</div> </li> <li> <div>Performing restorative treatments such as fillings on adults and children</div> </li> <li> <div>Supporting cosmetic and restorative plans by carrying out whitening, polishing, and airflow treatments (within the scope of practice)</div> </li> <li> <div>Working collaboratively with clinicians to ensure continuity of care and excellent treatment outcomes</div> </li> </ul> <div><strong>About Zental Cricklewood:</strong></div> <div><br>Located on a busy high street with excellent transport links, Zental Cricklewood is a calm and contemporary space designed to support high-quality care. Our clinic features state-of-the-art surgeries, fully equipped with the latest digital and clinical technology.</div> <div>We offer a full range of dental and facial aesthetic services - ranging from general and cosmetic dentistry to implants, orthodontics, oral surgery, sedation, and more. You’ll be working alongside a highly experienced, multidisciplinary team dedicated to delivering exceptional outcomes for a high-net-worth patient base.</div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <div><strong>Why Join Zental?</strong></div> <div><br>We are committed to creating an environment where clinicians can thrive. You’ll benefit from:</div> <ul data-end="2454" data-start="2145"> <li> <div>A qualified and experienced dental nurse</div> </li> <li> <div>Modern surgeries with premium equipment and materials</div> </li> <li> <div>Access to a supportive Clinical Peer Group</div> </li> <li> <div>Opportunities for further training and funded education</div> </li> <li> <div>Transparent and rewarding staff referral schemes</div> </li> <li> <div>Ongoing CPD and career development support</div> </li> </ul> <div>If you’re ready to take the next step in your career and want to work in a forward-thinking, supportive environment, we’d love to hear from you.</div> <p></p> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.&nbsp;</p> <p>Want to know what our teams think about working with us? title: Dental Treatment Co-ordinator (Private Dental Group)
description: <div> <p><strong>Join Our Exclusive Team at Zental</strong></p> <p><strong>Location: Cricklewood | Full-time&nbsp;</strong></p> </div> <div><strong>Role Overview</strong></div> <div>The Treatment Co-ordinator (TCO) plays a pivotal role in delivering an exceptional patient experience by guiding individuals through their treatment journey with empathy, clarity, and professionalism. This role requires a deep understanding of clinical offerings, strong interpersonal skills, and the ability to manage both administrative and patient-facing responsibilities efficiently.</div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <div><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></div> <div><strong>Patient Engagement &amp; Communication</strong></div> <ul> <li>Serve as the first point of contact for all new patient enquiries across all treatment types.</li> <li>Provide comprehensive support and guidance throughout the patient journey, ensuring a seamless and reassuring experience.</li> <li>Clearly explain treatment options, procedures, and financial plans, addressing any questions or concerns with empathy and accuracy.</li> <li>Tailor communication styles to suit individual patient needs and psychological profiles, demonstrating high emotional intelligence.</li> <li>Accurately document all patient interactions and updates in the CRM and clinical notes.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Treatment Coordination</strong></div> <ul> <li>Liaise with clinicians to obtain and communicate treatment plans to patients within 24 hours of consultation.</li> <li>Follow up with patients at appropriate intervals to monitor progress and encourage treatment uptake.</li> <li>Manage objections and concerns, working to convert enquiries into confirmed treatment</li> <li>Coordinate imaging appointments and referrals as required, ensuring timely and accurate scheduling.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Administrative &amp; Operational Support</strong></div> <ul> <li>Process finance applications and direct debit forms, ensuring compliance and accuracy.</li> <li>Maintain and update internal trackers for CBCT scans, finance applications, referrals, and other key metrics.</li> <li>Support front-of-house and reception duties as needed, including diary management and appointment scheduling.</li> <li>Facilitate smooth handovers between clinicians for multi-disciplinary treatments.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Customer Service &amp; Quality Assurance</strong></div> <ul> <li>Assist the Practice Manager in resolving patient complaints promptly and professionally.</li> <li>Monitor and uphold high standards of communication across all patient touchpoints.</li> <li>Collect and review patient feedback to identify areas for improvement.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Data &amp; Financial Management</strong></div> <ul> <li>Maintain accurate records on the CRM platform, including treatment progress and financial arrangements.</li> <li>Monitor and report on direct debit pipelines and dental finance applications.</li> <li>Generate and analyse monthly conversion reports for key treatment areas (e.g., implants, orthodontics, TIAD).</li> </ul> <div><strong>Business Development &amp; Strategy</strong></div> <ul> <li>Analyse practice performance data to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for growth.</li> <li>Contribute ideas for improving operational efficiency and patient experience.</li> <li>Support the management team in achieving revenue targets and strategic goals.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Team Collaboration &amp; Change Management</strong></div> <ul> <li>Ensure team members are informed and trained on new systems, procedures, and changes.</li> <li>Identify and recommend improvements to workflows, supported by data and rationale.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Professional Development</strong></div> <ul> <li>Take ownership of personal development goals, particularly in leadership, management, and financial literacy.</li> <li>Attend relevant CPD courses and training sessions to enhance skills and knowledge.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Qualifications &amp; Skills</strong></div> <ul> <li>Strong premium sales background or equivalent</li> <li>Previous experience in a dental or healthcare setting highly desirable.</li> <li>Strong understanding of dental treatments and patient care pathways.</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li> <li>High level of emotional intelligence and patient empathy.</li> <li>Proficiency in CRM systems and Microsoft Office Suite.</li> <li>Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.</li> </ul> <div><strong>Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)&nbsp;</strong>may include:</div> <ul> <li>Patient conversion rates</li> <li>Timeliness of treatment plan delivery</li> <li>Patient satisfaction and feedback scores</li> <li>&nbsp;Accuracy of CRM and financial records</li> <li>&nbsp;Practice revenue targets</li> </ul> <p><strong>What We Offer:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Excellent team support working with&nbsp;numerous specialists and a highly skilled team</li> <li>In-house/training support and opportunities for future growth</li> <li>Where applicable, Professional Indemnity and DBS costs covered by Zental</li> <li>All Core/essential CPD paid for</li> <li>Excellent training opportunities for extended nurse training with full training costs covered by Zental</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities to move into other roles or other parts of our rapidly growing organisation</li> <li>Employee Referral Scheme - earn up to £2950 per referral</li> <li>Access to Zental Tailored Benefits*</li> <li> <p><strong>How to Apply:</strong></p> <p>If you’re ready to elevate your sales career and be part of a company that redefines premium dental care, we’d love to hear from you!</p> <p><strong>Salary:</strong> Competitive and dependent on experience, with performance-based incentives</p> </li> </ul>

title: Field Dental Nurse - Implant and Sedation trained
description: <p></p> <p class="" data-start="109" data-end="368"><strong data-start="109" data-end="136">We're Growing Our Team!</strong></p> <p class="" data-start="109" data-end="368">An exciting opportunity has opened up for an&nbsp;experienced, GDC-registered <strong>Dental Nurse with sedation and implant experience or qualifications</strong> to join our expanding group of state-of-the-art private dental practices.</p> <p class="" data-start="370" data-end="426"><strong data-start="373" data-end="386">Locations</strong>: Knightsbridge, Earls Court, and Barnet</p> <p class="" data-start="428" data-end="656">You'll be working alongside a<strong> </strong>highly skilled, multidisciplinary team that includes general dentists, specialists, implant surgeons, and a facial aesthetics expert&nbsp;in a modern, supportive, and forward-thinking environment.</p> <p class="" data-start="658" data-end="796">This is a fantastic chance to advance your career in a practice that values development, teamwork, and clinical excellence.</p> <p>You will be joining a team that will be supporting you with ongoing professional development and extended duties training. We use state-of-the-art dental software and digital X-ray systems.</p> <p><strong>Our Ethos:</strong></p> <p>We are passionate about creating a relaxing, calm and harmonious environment where we can offer the highest quality of care where patients feel at ease to come to the dentist. We believe in making people live longer, healthier &amp; happier lives through maintaining an optimum level of oral health and well-being.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Essential Requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Applicants must be GDC registered&nbsp;</li> <li>Implant and Sedation experience or post-qualfication</li> <li>3+ years dental nursing experience&nbsp;</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills</li> <li>Can-do attitude with a focus on providing excellent patient care</li> <li>Personable and friendly chair-side manner</li> <li>Experience in working in a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Post Grad Qualifications highly advantageous&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits of working with Zental:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Excellent team support working with numerous specialists and a highly skilled team</li> <li>In house/training support and opportunities for future growth</li> <li>GDC, Professional Indemnity and DBS costs all covered by Zental.</li> <li>All uniforms will be provided.</li> <li>All Core/essential CPD paid for.</li> <li>Excellent training opportunities for extended nurse training with full training costs covered by Zental.</li> <li>Excellent career opportunities to move into other roles or other parts of our rapidly growing organisation.</li> <li>Modern surgeries and dental software systems</li> <li>Access to Zental's tailored perks</li> <li>Employee Referral Scheme - earn up to £2950 per referral</li> </ul> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.</p> <p>This is a regional / field position on a zero hour contract. Applicants would need to commit to a minimum of&nbsp;one working day in every 13-week period.</p> <p>Salary: Negotiable: £12.00 - £16.00+ per hour PLUS travel allowance. The salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to the scope required, unique relevant experience and job related skills. At Zental, cash salary is only one component of our Total Rewards Package. Paid performance incentives are also included for eligible roles.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

title: HR Advisor
description: <p><strong>Join Our Exclusive Team at Zental</strong></p> <p><strong>Location: On-Site, Earls Court | Full-time</strong></p> <p>At Zental, we aim to create a premium and holistic dental experience for all our patients. Our high-end boutique practices offer a perfect blend of quality dental care and patient-centred service. We focus on every small detail and aim to deliver a quality customer service experience. We ensure that each patient is treated with the utmost care and attention in an elegant and serene environment.<br><br>Are you a proactive, people-focused HR professional with a passion for delivering exceptional support in a fast-paced, high-quality environment? We’re looking for an <strong>HR Advisor</strong> to join our premium dental group and play a key role in shaping the employee experience across the group.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Why Join Zental?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work in a sophisticated, state-of-the-art boutique practice prioritising patient comfort and holistic well-being.</li> <li>Be part of a growing brand that offers excellent learning, growth and development opportunities.</li> <li>Receive exclusive discounts on dental treatments for yourself, family, and friends.</li> <li>Access continuous learning programs to enhance your professional growth, including external certifications and training.</li> <li>Join a team dedicated to excellence, collaboration, and innovation.</li> </ul> <p><strong><br>Your Role</strong></p> <p>As our HR Advisor, you’ll work closely with managers, the central People Team and the Executive to support the full employee lifecycle — from recruitment and onboarding to employee relations, engagement, strategy and process improvement. This is a true generalist role, ideal for someone who enjoys variety, autonomy, and direct impact.</p> <p><strong>What You'll Be Doing</strong></p> <ul> <li>Providing confident, practical HR advice to managers and team members</li> <li>Managing ER cases (informal and formal) with care and compliance</li> <li>Supporting end-to-end recruitment and onboarding alongside our People Support Team</li> <li>Coaching managers on people processes, performance, and employee wellbeing</li> <li>Maintaining accurate HR records in our HRIS (HiBob) and supporting data/reporting needs</li> <li>Championing our values, contributing to projects that enhance employee experience, engagement, and retention</li> <li>Helping us embed consistent, compliant HR practices across our practices</li> </ul> <p><strong>What You’ll Bring</strong></p> <ul> <li>CIPD Level 5 (or working towards it)</li> <li>Solid experience (5+ years) in a HR Advisor or strong HR Assistant role — ideally in a fast-paced, customer-facing or healthcare setting</li> <li>Confident knowledge of UK employment law and best practice</li> <li>A practical, problem-solving mindset with great communication skills</li> <li>Strong organisational skills and attention to detail</li> <li>A people-first approach — you care about culture, wellbeing, and delivering service excellence</li> <li>Comfort using HR systems (we use HiBob) and working with data</li> </ul> <p><strong>Growth Opportunities</strong></p> <p>At Zental, we value and invest in the development of our team. As part of our growing practice, you will have opportunities for career advancement and the chance to explore numerous roles in a growing business. You will also be exposed to leading-edge dental technologies and the latest industry advancements, helping you build a long-term career with us.</p> <p><strong>Ready to Join the Premium Holistic Experience?</strong></p> <p>If you’re ready to elevate your career in a prestigious, forward-thinking environment and make a lasting impact, we would love to hear from you.</p>

title: Implant Dentist
description: <p><strong>Dental Implantologist – Premium Private Practice, Bexleyheath<br><br>Location:</strong> Bexleyheath, Kent (High Street)<br><strong>Commitment:</strong> 2–3 days per week | <strong>Private Practice</strong></p> <p>Zental is redefining private dentistry. With an Outstanding CQC rating, a boutique luxury approach, and a reputation for excellence, we are now seeking an experienced Dental Implantologist to join our thriving Bexleyheath practice.</p> <p>This is a rare chance to work in a purpose-built, state-of-the-art environment, delivering the full scope of implant treatments to a growing and loyal patient base, supported by one of the UK’s most skilled multidisciplinary teams.</p> <p><strong>Why Join Zental Bexleyheath?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Modern luxury surgeries - fully digital, with the latest technology &amp; workflows</li> <li>Prime location - high street presence with excellent transport links across Kent &amp; London</li> <li>High implant volume - join a group completing over 1,000 implant cases annually, from single units to advanced reconstructions (All-on-4, sinus lifts, block grafts)</li> <li>TCO support - focus on clinical excellence while a dedicated Treatment Coordinator enhances case acceptance &amp; patient experience</li> <li>Collaborative, specialist-led team - orthodontists, periodontists, restorative dentists &amp; implant surgeons all under one roof</li> <li>Ongoing development - mentorship in advanced implant techniques &amp; sedation, plus peer support through our clinical network</li> <li>Referral growth<strong> </strong>- benefit from our strong brand reputation and growing local referral base</li> </ul> <p><strong>About the Role</strong></p> <p>As an Implantologist at Bexleyheath, you will:</p> <ul> <li>Deliver a full range of implant treatments, from single units to complex rehabilitations</li> <li>Collaborate closely with a TCO to guide patients through their implant journey</li> <li>Work alongside a highly skilled nursing &amp; clinical support team</li> <li>Help expand the clinic’s implant profile through referrals and case excellence</li> </ul> <p><strong><br>Who We’re Looking For</strong></p> <p><strong>Essential:</strong></p> <ul> <li>GDC-registered Dentist with proven implant and oral surgery experience</li> <li>Commitment to precision, excellence, and ethical private dentistry</li> <li>Strong communication skills &amp; ability to inspire patient trust</li> <li>Ability to grow and nurture a referral base</li> <li>Team-focused and collaborative approach</li> </ul> <p><strong>Desirable:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with complex cases (full-arch, cosmetic rehabilitation)</li> <li>5+ years’ post-graduate experience in a private environment</li> </ul> <p><strong>Elevate Your Career in Implant Dentistry</strong></p> <p>This is more than a role - it’s a chance to <strong>build your implant career in one of the most modern, patient-focused practices</strong>.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Implant Dentist
description: <p><strong>Join Our Outstanding Team at Zental – Dental Implantologist Opportunity</strong></p> <p><strong>Location:</strong> Cricklewood / Barnet / Bexleyheath <br><br>Flexible Commitment: 2–3 days per week Type: Private Practice<br><br>Zental is a luxury, high-end private dental group with an Outstanding CQC rating and we are looking for an accomplished Dental Implantologist to join our team. This is a rare opportunity to work in a state-of-the-art environment, delivering exceptional patient care alongside some of the UK’s most experienced clinicians.</p> <p><strong>Why Join Zental?</strong></p> <p>· Modern Luxury: Purpose-built, contemporary surgeries equipped with the latest technology</p> <p>· Prestigious Location: High street, with excellent underground links for easy access.</p> <p>· Comprehensive Care: We offer cosmetic and restorative dentistry, specialist periodontics, endodontics, implants, facial aesthetics, and cutting-edge digital dentistry.</p> <p><strong>About the Role</strong></p> <p>You will join a multidisciplinary team of 10 implant surgeons, seeing both new and existing patients for a full range of implant treatments.</p> <p>We manage over 1,000 implant cases annually, from single units to complex block grafts, sinus lifts, and full-arch rehabilitation (Teeth in a Day / All-on-4).</p> <p>Work closely with a dedicated Treatment Coordinator to ensure smooth patient journeys and support referral growth.</p> <p>Benefit from mentorship opportunities in advanced implant techniques and intravenous sedation.</p> <p><br><strong>Who We are Looking For</strong></p> <p><strong>Essential:</strong></p> <p>· GDC-registered Dentist with experience in oral surgery and dental implant rehabilitation.</p> <p>· Precision, attention to detail, and commitment to clinical excellence.</p> <p>· Strong communication skills and a patient-first mindset.</p> <p>· Ability to build and maintain a growing referral base.</p> <p>· High ethical standards and a collaborative approach.</p> <p><strong>Desirable:</strong></p> <p>· Experience with complex rehabilitations and cosmetic dentistry.</p> <p>· 4+ years’ post-graduate experience in a private setting.</p> <p><strong>How to Apply</strong></p> <p>If you’re ready to take your career to the next level in a practice where innovation meets excellence, we’d love to hear from you.</p> <p>Apply Now: Complete the application form and submit your CV. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the next stage.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Lead Associate Dentist
description: <p>We're expanding our team! Exciting opportunity for an experienced and and highly skilled&nbsp;<strong>Clinical Lead Dental Associate </strong>to join a high-end, beautiful, modern, forward-thinking 100% private dental practice in Bletchley, Milton Keynes. The successful candidate will enjoy a fresh working environment and will become part of an expanding and growing team.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>About us</strong></p> <p><a href="https://www.zental.uk/">Zental</a> is a modern, boutique, fully private group of dental practices based in the London and Buckinghamshire areas providing all aspects of dentistry and facial aesthetics.&nbsp;</p> <p>We are passionate about creating a relaxing, calm and harmonious environment where we can offer the highest quality of care where patients feel at ease to visit the dentist. We believe in making people live longer, healthier &amp; happier lives through maintaining an optimum level of oral health and well-being.&nbsp; &nbsp;</p> <p><strong>The Practice</strong></p> <p>The practice has a contemporary ambience comprising state-of-the-art dental surgeries equipped with all the latest equipment and is located on a busy high street with close public transport links. The practice offers a full array of dental services ranging from simple to complex cosmetic &amp; restorative dentistry, periodontics, maxillo-facial services, orthodontics, sedation, implants, facial rejuvenation, digital dentistry and more.</p> <p><strong>The Role:</strong></p> <p>As a Clinical Lead, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and efficiency of dental services at your primary Practice. You will act as a bridge between the dentists, the practice manager, and the operations team, and provide feedback and support to all parties. In addition to your leadership duties, you will work clinical days, providing hands-on patient care and maintaining your clinical skills. You will also participate in regular meetings, audits, and hiring processes, and keep up to date with the latest developments in dentistry.</p> <p><strong>Essential requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>GDC Registered</li> <li>2+ years Private Practice Experience&nbsp;</li> <li>6+ years Post-Grad experience&nbsp;</li> <li>2+ years Management experience (corporate / hospital environments)&nbsp;</li> <li>Meticulous attention to detail</li> <li>Ability to build own list through pro-active marketing</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills</li> <li>Energetic personality</li> <li>Ability to perform the highest quality of dentistry in the most ethical manner</li> <li>Long-term commitment is essential&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Preferable requirements:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Post Grad Qualification</li> <li>Experience in cosmetic dentistry&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience in dental education&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Key Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive private fees with the possibility to grow quickly</li> <li>Excellent opportunity to work with numerous specialists and a highly skilled team</li> <li>On-going support and the opportunity for personal and professional development</li> <li>Career development and opportunities are available for those wishing to grow</li> <li>Modern surgeries and dental software systems</li> </ul> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.</p> <p>Want to know what our teams think about working with us? Visit our <a href="https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Overview/Working-at-Zental-EI_IE5215464.11,17.htm" target="_blank">Glassdoor Page</a></p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Lead Dental Nurse (Private Dental Group)
description: <p data-start="228" data-end="327"><strong data-start="228" data-end="263">Lead Dental Nurse – Cricklewood</strong><br data-start="263" data-end="266">Full-time | Private Practice&nbsp;</p> <p data-start="119" data-end="341">Zental is a state-of-the-art private dental group that blends clinical excellence with a calm, harmonious environment. We are seeking a full-time Lead Dental Nurse to join our team in Cricklewood, London.</p> <h3 data-start="1059" data-end="1082"><strong data-start="1063" data-end="1082">The role</strong></h3> <p data-start="343" data-end="546">You will be part of a multidisciplinary team working alongside General Dentists, Specialists, Implant Surgeons, and Facial Aesthetics experts — all dedicated to delivering exceptional patient care.</p> <p data-start="548" data-end="735">This role is predominantly clinical, with additional lead responsibilities including rota management, stock and ordering title: Qualified Dental Nurse (Fully Private Group)
description: <h2>Dental Nurse Opportunity at Zental – Premium Boutique Practice!</h2> <h2><strong>Join Zental – Where Excellence Meets Innovation</strong></h2> <p><strong>Location: Cricklewood | Full-time&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Are you a qualified dental nurse, implant and sedation-trained, looking to take your career to the next level? Zental is a fully private, boutique dental group dedicated to delivering world-class patient care in a modern, high-tech, and serene environment. We are seeking a skilled and passionate Dental Nurse to join our multi-disciplinary team of General Dentists, Specialists, and Implant Surgeons at our state-of-the-art practice in London.</p> <p>At Zental, your professional growth is a priority. We offer comprehensive training opportunities, career development, and exposure to cutting-edge dentistry, ensuring you thrive in a premier private practice setting.</p> <h2><strong>Why Join Us?</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Work alongside leading specialists in a progressive, high-end private practice.</li> <li>Access to bespoke in-house training and development in extended duties.</li> <li>Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.</li> <li>Fully funded GDC registration, professional indemnity, and DBS checks.</li> <li>Modern digital workflows with state-of-the-art equipment and software.</li> <li>Full support for core CPD training, plus opportunities in Sedation, Radiography, and more.</li> <li>Employee perks, including financial wellbeing tools, shopping discounts, and significant savings on dental treatments.</li> <li>Generous referral scheme – earn up to £2,950 for successful referrals.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>What We’re Looking For</strong></h2> <ul> <li style="font-weight: bold;"><strong>GDC Registered Dental Nurse with Implant and Sedation (highly desirable)</strong></li> <li>Private practice experience preferred.</li> <li>A proactive and positive team player with strong communication skills.</li> <li>Passionate about delivering exceptional patient care.</li> <li>Confident working in a fast-paced, multi-speciality environment.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>About Our Practice</strong></h2> <p>Zental’s clinics are designed to<strong> </strong>enhance patient well-being while offering top-tier dental and facial aesthetic treatments. Our multi-disciplinary services include cosmetic and restorative dentistry, periodontics, maxillofacial treatments, orthodontics, sedation, implants, and digital dentistry. Located on bustling high streets with excellent transport links, our practices are designed for both patient comfort and professional excellence.</p> <h2><strong>Job Details</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Full-time role (40 hours per week)&nbsp;</li> <li>Highly competitive salary.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Ready to Elevate Your Career?</strong></h2> <p><strong>Ready to Elevate Your Career? Apply today and become part of the Zental experience!<br></strong></p> <h4>Explore all our career opportunities on our&nbsp;<a href="#">Careers Page</a>. Curious about what our team thinks? Check out our <a href="https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Overview/Working-at-Zental-EI_IE5215464.11,17.htm" target="_blank">Glassdoor Page</a> reviews!</h4>

title: Regional Clinical Director
description: <p>Zental is expanding its elite team! We seek an exceptional and experienced Regional Clinical Director (Dentistry) to lead and uphold the highest standards of excellence across our state-of-the-art, luxury private dental practices in London.<br><br>As the Regional Clinical Director (Dental) at Zental, you will play a vital role in ensuring the delivery of exceptional dental care across multiple dental practices. You will oversee clinical operations, quality assurance, and clinical staff development in your designated region.</p> <p><strong>About us</strong></p> <p><a href="https://www.zental.uk/">Zental</a> is a modern, boutique, fully private group of dental practices based in the London and Buckinghamshire areas providing all aspects of dentistry and facial aesthetics.&nbsp;</p> <p>We are passionate about creating a relaxing, calm and harmonious environment where we can offer the highest quality of care where patients feel at ease to come to the dentist. We believe in making people live longer, healthier &amp; happier lives through maintaining an optimum level of oral health and well-being.&nbsp; &nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Clinical Leadership: Provide leadership and guidance to dental professionals within the region, fostering a culture of excellence, empathy, and patient-centered care.</li> <li>Quality Assurance: Monitor and maintain clinical quality standards, ensuring adherence to industry best practices and regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Staff Development: Identify training and development needs of clinical staff, facilitate training programs, and mentor dental teams to enhance their clinical skills.</li> <li>Clinical Protocols: Develop and implement standardized clinical protocols, policies, and procedures to ensure consistency in patient care.</li> <li>Performance Evaluation: Conduct performance evaluations for clinical staff and provide constructive feedback to support professional growth.</li> <li>Clinical Oversight: Collaborate with practice managers to ensure efficient clinic operations, optimal patient flow, and effective resource utilization.</li> <li>Compliance: Stay updated on dental industry regulations and ensure all practices within your region adhere to legal and regulatory requirements.</li> <li>Patient Experience: Ensure patients receive the highest level of care, resolve patient concerns, and implement improvements based on patient feedback</li> <li>Clinical Recruitment: Ensure appropriately trained dentists are hired with the appropriate skills and experience for their success and growth.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Essential requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li style="font-weight: bold;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>GDC Registered Dentist / Specialist&nbsp;</strong></span></li> <li>10+ years of experience in general dentistry with a diverse patient population is required.</li> <li>Proven experience in clinical leadership role within the dental field.</li> <li>Proficiency in different technology platforms</li> <li>Strong knowledge of dental industry standards, best practices, and regulations.</li> <li>Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.</li> <li>Ability to motivate and mentor dental professionals.</li> <li>Commitment to maintaining the highest level of patient care and satisfaction.&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience providing mentoring or training&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Key Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive private fees with the possibility to grow quickly</li> <li>Excellent opportunity to work with numerous specialists and a highly skilled team</li> <li>On-going support and the opportunity for personal and professional development</li> <li>Career development and opportunities are available for those wishing to grow</li> <li>Modern surgeries and dental software systems</li> </ul> <p>If you would like to find out about all our career opportunities, please visit our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/partner/careers">careers section</a> on our <a href="https://www.zental.uk/">website</a>.</p> <p>Job Type: Part Time<br>Renumeration: <em>Highly competitive (based on experience)&nbsp;</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Customer Service Representative
description: <p><strong>About the Role</strong></p> <p>We're looking for a <strong>Customer Service Representative</strong> to join our team! Your job is to help us keep our customers happy by providing top-notch service. You'll work directly with customers to meet their insurance carriers’ requirements, all while collaborating with our agents and advocating for everyone involved."</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Be Doing</strong></p> <ul> <li>Providing expert service and guidance to our customers over phone, email, and text</li> <li>Ensure correct documents are sent to customers based on their situation</li> <li>Completing tasks with organized notes with consistent processes</li> <li>Clearly articulating our Matic value proposition to the customer</li> <li>Achieving team goals for productivity, quality, client satisfaction and policy retention</li> <li>Offering other insurance products to our customers where applicable</li> </ul> <p><strong>Our Expectations of a CSR:</strong></p> <p><strong><em>Save Attempt EVERY TIME</em>- We require a save attempt to be made on every cancellation request</strong><strong><em>Customer Holds-</em> Inform customers they are being placed on hold. Check-in every minute at minimum to update</strong><strong><em>We Champion Our Customers</em>- Every call and every interaction. Be proactive and if something is not right, own it. Be their advocate.</strong><strong><em>Good, Better, Best</em>- Don’t settle. Look for ways to improve daily. Can’t stop, won’t stop attitude</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong><em>Feedback First</em></strong>- Welcome feedback with curiosity, not defensiveness. It is our responsibility to help each other grow</li> <li><strong><em>One CST</em></strong>- Regardless of role, we are one team working together</li> <li><strong><em>Professionalism-</em></strong> Be calm, professional and empathetic. We are Matic, represent the company as you would want your company represented.</li> <li><strong><em>One Call Resolution</em></strong>- Do everything you can to solve before ending the call. Don’t pass it off if you can finish it. If it is not done, it is not resolved&nbsp;</li> <li><strong><em>Accountability</em></strong>- Own every call - see it through to completion. You own the outcome.</li> </ul> <p><strong>&nbsp;What You Offer</strong></p> <ul> <li>1+ year of customer service experience</li> <li>Effective communication skills especially over the phone.&nbsp;</li> <li>Ability to understand a customer’s situation and provide options towards resolution</li> <li>Tenacity and persuasiveness when it comes to doing what’s right</li> <li>Self-motivated, willing to learn, and able to adapt quickly to change</li> <li>Ability to multitask as demonstrated by listening and responding to the customer while using a computer to research and enter information</li> <li>Passion that can convey the value of our Matic message clearly</li> </ul> <p><strong>What We Offer</strong>&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Career advancement - we have a culture that focuses on internal promotion and career growth.&nbsp;</li> <li>You have an ownership stake - all Maticians receive Matic stock options.</li> <li>Unlimited Paid Time Off.</li> <li>Company covered Health, Dental &amp; Vision insurance for each Matician ($0 out of your paycheck for benefits), plus HSA with employer contribution.</li> <li>401(k) Retirement Plan.</li> <li>Continuing education, licensing and professional development paid for by Matic.</li> <li>A TRUE team culture -&nbsp; One team, one dream is our company motto and while we are working hard to simplify the world of insurance, we never forget to play hard as well - we pride ourselves on frequent team events like happy hours, game nights, volleyball/kickball teams, etc!&nbsp;</li> <li>Modern office environment (that’s CDC compliant!) - we have a trendy HQ in the heart of German Village in downtown Columbus with awesome amenities including ping pong tables, coffee/espresso bar, flavored water bar (sparkling or still, your choice!).&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Matic</strong></p> <p>Matic is a startup with ample opportunities for growth. Since 2014, Matic has changed the landscape of the insurtech industry by integrating insurance within the home and auto ownership experience. Today, Matic’s digital insurance marketplace has over 50 A-rated home and auto carriers, as well as distribution partners in industries ranging from mortgage origination and servicing to banking, auto financing, and much more.</p> <p>We hire rock stars who are passionate about owning their work and are obsessed with finding a better way. Working at Matic means working collaboratively towards one common goal; we are one team with one dream. We have a fast-paced culture that is driven by quality, transparency, and of course fun.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. This position does not offer sponsorship.</p>

title: Head of Customer Service
description: <p><strong>About the Role</strong></p> <p>We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced operational leader to play a critical role in the refinement, design and integration of Customer Service strategies and programs. Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Sales and Service, this person will direct and oversee the customer service operation at Matic.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Create and communicate an overall vision for service and retention within the Agency, setting goals and recommending improvement plans based on trends</li> <li>Evaluate, refine and develop processes and procedures to drive maximum performance of the Customer Service and Retention teams</li> <li>Manage medium to large projects and initiatives that drive efficiency and effectiveness</li> <li>Work directly with our Agency Operations, Workforce Management, and Sales teams to effectively implement cross-functional programs</li> <li>Develop service level standards focused on issue resolution and response times</li> <li>Implement systems that capture and report on service metrics including customer feedback</li> <li>Be involved with potential E&amp;O customer escalations</li> <li>Provide feedback to Training, QA and Sales</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in a business or finance related field is preferred</li> <li>A minimum of five years of related experience required, with prior management experience in insurance sales, service or underwriting with increasing levels of responsibility preferred</li> <li>Proven track record of leading highly effective teams and driving results</li> <li>Strong analytical skills, service and contact center technology acumen, and ability to synthesize large amounts of data to determine and direct meaningful change in the business</li> <li>Ability to work well under pressure, to prioritize and deliver business results</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal skills; strong verbal &amp; written communicator w/an ability to be effective in a business-to-business setting and to all levels of executive leadership</li> <li>Must be able to travel up to 15% of the time</li> </ul> <p><strong>How Matic Stands Out</strong></p> <ul> <li>Career advancement - we have a culture that focuses on internal promotion and career growth.</li> <li>You have an ownership stake - all Maticians receive Matic stock options</li> <li>Unlimited Paid Time Off</li> <li>Company covered Health, Dental &amp; Vision insurance for each Matician ($0 out of your paycheck for benefits), plus HSA with employer contribution</li> <li>401(k) Retirement Plan</li> <li>Continuing education, licensing and professional development paid for by Matic</li> <li>A TRUE team culture -&nbsp; One team, one dream is our company motto and while we are working hard to simplify the world of insurance, we never forget to play hard as well - we pride ourselves on frequent team events like happy hours, game nights, volleyball/kickball teams</li> <li>Modern office environment (that’s CDC compliant!) - we have a trendy HQ in the heart of German Village in downtown Columbus with awesome amenities including ping pong tables, coffee/espresso bar, flavored water bar</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Matic</strong></p> <p>Matic is a startup with ample opportunities for growth. Since 2014, Matic has changed the landscape of the insurtech industry by integrating insurance within the home and auto ownership experience. Today, Matic’s digital insurance marketplace has over 50 A-rated home and auto carriers, as well as distribution partners in industries ranging from mortgage origination and servicing to banking, auto financing, and much more.</p> <p>We hire rock stars who are passionate about owning their work and are obsessed with finding a better way. Working at Matic means working collaboratively towards one common goal; we are one team with one dream. We have a fast-paced culture that is driven by quality, transparency, and of course fun.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. This position does not offer sponsorship.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Inside Sales Representative
description: <p><strong>Importance of the Role</strong></p> <p>We are looking for an <strong>Inside Sales Representative</strong> to increase insurance policy sales from our largest partners. You will be tasked with making connections with prospective customers to generate qualified opportunities for our insurance agents. Reporting to our insurance agency sales manager, this position offers quick upward mobility with the goal of being promoted from this role within 6-8 months. This position is held in Columbus, Ohio.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You'll Do</strong></p> <ul> <li>Conduct outbound calls to prospective clients, overcome objections, and transfer qualified prospects to insurance agents.</li> <li>Ability to quickly build rapport with clients over phone, email, and text</li> <li>Run sales process effectively with organized notes and tasks for follow-ups</li> <li>Clearly articulate Matic value proposition to the consumer</li> <li>Achieve sales targets for calls, transfers, conversion, and quality</li> <li>Working with sales manager and trainer on licensing to become an agent</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You Offer</strong></p> <ul> <li>Ability to overcome objections and handle adversity</li> <li>Strong work ethic and drive</li> <li>Must be a passionate individual that can convey the value of our message clearly</li> <li>Strong written skills to craft creative emails.</li> <li>Self starter mentality</li> <li>Ability to handle multiple priorities and demands in a fast-paced environment</li> <li>No college degree necessary</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What We Offer</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></p> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Career advancement - we have a culture that prioritizes internal promotion and career growth&nbsp;</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Matic Stock Options - all employees have ownership in Matic</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;Monthly Sales Bonus Plan</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Flexible Paid Time Off - take off as much time as you need - we support work / life balance</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Medical, Dental &amp; title: Product Manager - Customer Experience Platform
description: <h3><strong>Product Manager, Customer Experience Platform</strong></h3> <p>We<strong> </strong>are looking for a talented and driven Product Manager to own the customer experience platform. This is a critical role that directly impacts our company's growth by shaping the online experience for our customers. You'll be responsible for the user journey from start to finish, from getting an initial quote and purchasing a policy to managing their account online.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Own the product backlog for the <strong>customer-facing online platform</strong> and deliver on a clear, prioritized roadmap.</li> <li>Partner with a dedicated engineering team, designers, and key stakeholders to ship features that improve the customer journey, increase conversion rates, and drive revenue.</li> <li>Write detailed product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide the development process.</li> <li>Execute A/B tests and analyze data to validate product decisions and measure the impact of new features.</li> <li>Collaborate with marketing, sales, and operations teams to ensure a cohesive and effective customer experience across all touchpoints.</li> <li>Continuously monitor product performance, identify bugs and issues, and drive quick resolutions.</li> <li>Stay up-to-date on industry trends and the competitive landscape to inform day-to-day decisions and keep Matic's products relevant.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>English Language Proficiency</li> <li>Ukrainian Language Proficiency</li> <li>You have 3-5 years of experience in product management, with a proven track record of shipping successful consumer-facing products.</li> <li>You are a detail-oriented individual with a strong bias for action and a focus on execution.</li> <li>You have a deep understanding of user experience principles and a passion for creating intuitive, delightful products.</li> <li>You're highly analytical and comfortable with using data to inform your decisions.</li> <li>You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.</li> <li>Experience in the insurance or fintech industries is a plus, but not required.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>How Matic Stands Out</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Collaborative environment with colleagues based in our Lviv office, working alongside United States, Ukrainian, Colombian and Philippines teams.</li> <li>You'll have a significant impact on the company's success and work on a product that's central to our business.</li> <li>We have a collaborative, supportive, and fun company culture.</li> <li>You'll have the opportunity to grow your career and develop your skills in a fast-paced and innovative environment.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>About Matic</strong></h3> <p>Matic is a startup with ample opportunities for growth. Since 2014, Matic has changed the landscape of the insurtech industry by integrating insurance within the home and auto ownership experience. Today, Matic’s digital insurance marketplace has over 50 A-rated home and auto carriers, as well as distribution partners in industries ranging from mortgage origination and servicing to banking, auto financing, and much more.</p> <p>We hire rock stars who are passionate about owning their work and are obsessed with finding a better way. Working at Matic means working collaboratively towards one common goal; we are one team with one dream. We have a fast-paced culture that is driven by quality, transparency, and of course fun.</p> <h3 style="text-align: center;"><br><br></h3>

<ul> <li>Own the product backlog for the <strong>customer-facing online platform</strong> and deliver on a clear, prioritized roadmap.</li> <li>Partner with a dedicated engineering team, designers, and key stakeholders to ship features that improve the customer journey, increase conversion rates, and drive revenue.</li> <li>Write detailed product requirements, user stories, and acceptance criteria to guide the development process.</li> <li>Execute A/B tests and analyze data to validate product decisions and measure the impact of new features.</li> <li>Collaborate with marketing, sales, and operations teams to ensure a cohesive and effective customer experience across all touchpoints.</li> <li>Continuously monitor product performance, identify bugs and issues, and drive quick resolutions.</li> <li>Stay up-to-date on industry trends and the competitive landscape to inform day-to-day decisions and keep Matic's products relevant.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>English Language Proficiency</li> <li>Ukrainian Language Proficiency</li> <li>You have 3-5 years of experience in product management, with a proven track record of shipping successful consumer-facing products.</li> <li>You are a detail-oriented individual with a strong bias for action and a focus on execution.</li> <li>You have a deep understanding of user experience principles and a passion for creating intuitive, delightful products.</li> <li>You're highly analytical and comfortable with using data to inform your decisions.</li> <li>You have excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.</li> <li>Experience in the insurance or fintech industries is a plus, but not required.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>How Matic Stands Out</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Collaborative environment with colleagues based in our Lviv office, working alongside United States, Ukrainian, Colombian and Philippines teams.</li> <li>You'll have a significant impact on the company's success and work on a product that's central to our business.</li> <li>We have a collaborative, supportive, and fun company culture.</li> <li>You'll have the opportunity to grow your career and develop your skills in a fast-paced and innovative environment.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>About Matic</strong></h3> <p>Matic is a startup with ample opportunities for growth. Since 2014, Matic has changed the landscape of the insurtech industry by integrating insurance within the home and auto ownership experience. Today, Matic’s digital insurance marketplace has over 50 A-rated home and auto carriers, as well as distribution partners in industries ranging from mortgage origination and servicing to banking, auto financing, and much more.</p> <p>We hire rock stars who are passionate about owning their work and are obsessed with finding a better way. Working at Matic means working collaboratively towards one common goal; we are one team with one dream. We have a fast-paced culture that is driven by quality, transparency, and of course fun.</p>

title: Product Manager - Telephony and AI
description: <h3 style="text-align: center;"><strong>Product Manager - Telephony and AI</strong></h3> <p>We’re looking for a strategic and execution-focused Product Manager to own and evolve our communications and AI toolset. This is a high-impact role responsible for delivering seamless, efficient, and intelligent communication experiences for both our customers and our internal teams. You’ll partner closely with engineering, sales and service, operations, and compliance to continuously improve how we connect with customers and streamline our call center operations.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Support the product vision and roadmap, and guide cross-functional teams to execute projects that align with that strategic direction.</li> <li>Lead cross-functional teams through discovery, delivery, and iteration of features that improve call routing, agent efficiency, and customer engagement.</li> <li>Define, build, and deploy interactive AI bots and conversational interfaces to automate customer self-service and triage requests.</li> <li>Identify opportunities to use AI and machine learning for operational automations, such as sentiment analysis, call transcription, and intelligent summarization.</li> <li>Create product requirements and work with engineering to drive technical execution on key platforms and integrations.</li> <li>Define and track success metrics for agent efficiency, customer satisfaction, and the performance of our AI-driven automations.</li> <li>A strong systems thinker with a technical background comfortable working closely with engineers on complex system architecture and backend-heavy products.</li> <li>Serve as the product expert on our communication stack and drive continuous innovation in how we connect with our users.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>English language proficiency&nbsp;</li> <li>Ukrainian language proficiency</li> <li>3+ years of product management experience.</li> <li>Ability to lead a Scrum team with remote engineering, product and design members.</li> <li>A track record of delivering successful products and features.</li> <li>Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to independently mine data, surface key insights, and use them to drive product decisions and growth.</li> <li>Proven ability to work cross-functionally in fast-paced environments.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills — clear, concise, and collaborative.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Nice to have skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Contact Center and Start Up experience.</li> <li>Experience with telephony and omnichannel communications platforms (e.g., Twilio, Genesys, Five9, RingCentral, etc.).</li> <li>Experience building and deploying interactive bots (voice or chat) or other conversational AI products.</li> <li>SQL skills: comfortable independently querying large datasets to support product decisions.</li> title: Administrative Coordinator
description: <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><u>ADMINISTRATIVE COORDINATOR</u></strong>&nbsp;</p> <p>Have you been feeling unappreciated or overworked? Is the thought of your upcoming work week making you anxious? Are you resourceful and understand the importance of being proactive?&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>If you are ready to explore new opportunities, we would love to meet you!&nbsp;</p> <p>Working at Bath Fitter, you'll be at the heart of all operations including dealing with customers, employees, and management.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What's in it for you?</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Full-time work,&nbsp;competitive hourly pay.</li> <li>Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance,<strong> </strong>401K Profit Sharing<strong>,</strong> Paid Holidays, Paid Time off.</li> <li>We promote from within, with additional training programs available, your positive attitude and ability to communicate well with customers and colleagues will contribute to your success.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>As an <strong>Administrative Coordinator</strong> in this role, your organizational skills will be tested as you collaborate with many moving parts in our business. title: Installer
description: <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Installer Opportunity at Bath Fitter </strong></p> <p><strong>Does this sound like you?</strong><br>You value stability, appreciate being part of a growing and reputable company, and enjoy delivering exceptional work that leaves customers smiling. If you're looking to move beyond contract work and join a supportive team, <strong>Bath Fitter</strong> wants to hear from you!</p> <p><strong>Why Join Us?</strong><br><strong>Job Security</strong>: Year-round work with full-time benefits and training.<br><strong>Tools for Success</strong>: We provide a company vehicle, gas card, cell phone, tools, PPE, and branded uniforms.<br><strong>Work-Life Balance</strong>: Paid holidays, Vacation Days, and no selling required—all materials are provided!<br><strong>Career Growth</strong>: We promote from within and offer continuous training programs to help you succeed.<br><strong>Comprehensive Benefits</strong>: <span class="TextRun SCXW74728575 BCX0" lang="EN-US" data-contrast="auto"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW74728575 BCX0">Health/Dental/Life Insurance; Retirement Plan; Paid Holidays; Paid Time Off</span></span></p> <p><strong>Compensation: </strong>At Bath Fitter, we believe in rewarding your skills and growth! Here’s what to expect:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Training Pay</strong>: Paid training while you learn to be a Certified Bath Fitter Installer!</li> <li><strong>Performance-Based Pay</strong>: Once certified, your compensation will be a % of the value of the jobs you install, increasing % as you advance through certification levels.</li> <li><strong>Additional Productivity Pay</strong>: Earn extra % based on hours worked.</li> <li><strong>Service Work</strong>: You will earn hourly pay for any additional service-related tasks.</li> </ul> <p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>What You'll Do</strong><br>As an Installer, you will:</p> <ul> <li>Install premium Bath Fitter products in just one day.</li> <li>Deliver accurate and professional installation services to ensure customer satisfaction.</li> <li>Educate customers on care and maintenance of their new installation.</li> <li>Keep your work area clean, respect customer property, and adhere to Bath Fitter’s standards.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Skills &amp; Experience You Bring</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Carpentry Expertise</strong>: 2+ years in carpentry, trim carpentry, construction, or in-home renovations.</li> <li><strong>Precision &amp; Tools</strong>: Skilled in using tape measures, levels, power tools, and basic plumbing knowledge is a bonus.</li> <li><strong>Reliability</strong>: Valid driver’s license and a clean driving record.</li> <li><strong>Team Player</strong>: Ability to collaborate effectively, demonstrate professionalism, and commit to safety standards.</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Us</strong><br>Bath Fitter has been transforming bathrooms since 1984, proudly serving customers across the U.S., Canada, and Europe. Certified as a Great Place to Work®, we’re celebrating 40 years of excellence and still growing!</p> <p><strong>Ready to Transform Your Career?</strong><br>Step into a role where your skills are celebrated, your ambitions rewarded, and your potential is unlimited. <strong>Apply today to join the Bath Fitter family!</strong></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><em>At Bath Fitter’s corporate locations, we are dedicated to cultivating an inclusive environment for everyone. We uphold a strong commitment to providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all current and potential employees. Should you require accommodations during the application process, they can be arranged by request.</em></p> <p><em>Bath Fitter thanks all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted in person.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><em>#Lima<br>#LI-JL1<br>$60000 - $100000 / year</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Installer
description: <p><strong>Does this sound like you?</strong><br>You value stability, appreciate being part of a growing and reputable company, and enjoy delivering exceptional work that leaves customers smiling. If you're looking to move beyond contract work and join a supportive team, <strong>Bath Fitter</strong> wants to hear from you!</p> <p><strong>Why Join Us?</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Job Security</strong>: Year-round work with full-time benefits and training.</li> <li><strong>Tools for Success</strong>: We provide a company vehicle, gas card, cell phone, tools, PPE, and branded uniforms.</li> <li><strong>Work-Life Balance</strong>: Paid holidays, PTO, and no selling required—all materials are provided!</li> <li><strong>Career Growth</strong>: We promote from within and offer continuous training programs to help you succeed.</li> <li><strong>Comprehensive Benefits</strong>: Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), and profit sharing.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Compensation:&nbsp;</strong>At Bath Fitter, we believe in rewarding your skills and growth! Here’s what to expect:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Training Pay</strong>: Paid training while you learn to be a Certified Bath Fitter Installer!</li> <li><strong>Performance-Based Pay</strong>: Once certified, your compensation will be a % of the value of the jobs you install, increasing % as you advance through certification levels.</li> <li><strong>Additional Productivity Pay</strong>: Earn extra % based on hours worked.</li> <li><strong>Service Work</strong>: You will earn hourly pay for any additional service-related tasks.</li> </ul> <p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>What You'll Do</strong><br>As an Installer, you will:</p> <ul> <li>Install premium Bath Fitter products in just one day.</li> <li>Deliver accurate and professional installation services to ensure customer satisfaction.</li> <li>Educate customers on care and maintenance of their new installation.</li> <li>Keep your work area clean, respect customer property, and adhere to Bath Fitter’s standards.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Skills &amp; Experience You Bring</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Carpentry Expertise</strong>: 2+ years in carpentry, trim carpentry, construction, or in-home renovations.</li> <li><strong>Precision &amp; Tools</strong>: Skilled in using tape measures, levels, power tools, and basic plumbing knowledge is a bonus.</li> <li><strong>Reliability</strong>: Valid driver’s license and a clean driving record. <span data-teams="true">Ability to travel for training is required. Employees must maintain valid government-issued identification for travel purposes (e.g., Real ID or passport)</span></li> <li><strong>Team Player</strong>: Ability to collaborate effectively, demonstrate professionalism, and commit to safety standards.</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Us</strong><br>Bath Fitter has been transforming bathrooms since 1984, proudly serving customers across the U.S., Canada, and Europe. Certified as a Great Place to Work®, we’re celebrating 40 years of excellence and still growing!</p> <p><strong>Ready to Transform Your Career?</strong><br>Step into a role where your skills are celebrated, your ambitions rewarded, and your potential is unlimited. <strong>Apply today to join the Bath Fitter family!</strong></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><em>At Bath Fitter’s corporate locations, we are dedicated to cultivating an inclusive environment for everyone. We uphold a strong commitment to providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all current and potential employees. Should you require accommodations during the application process, they can be arranged by request.</em></p> <p><em>Bath Fitter thanks all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted in person.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><em>#Lima<br>#LI-JL1<br>$60000 - $100000 / year</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>
