title: Licensed Plumber
description: <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Ready to put your skills to work in a role where craftsmanship meets customer satisfaction? At Bath Fitter, we’re looking for a licensed Journeyman Plumber who takes pride in delivering high-quality plumbing installations as part of beautiful bathroom transformations for our customers. Join our team and bring your expertise to a certified Great Place to Work® company.</p> <p><strong>Why join the Bath Fitter team?</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Competitive hourly pay based on experience and licensing</li> <li>Company vehicle, tools, and PPE provided</li> <li>Stable, full-time work with a well-established, industry-leading company</li> <li>Opportunities for skill development and growth</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits:</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Medical, dental and vision insurance</li> <li>Paid time off and holidays</li> <li>401(k) with profit sharing</li> <li>Employee discounts and recognition programs</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>As a Plumber, what will your responsibilities be?</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>&nbsp;Install valves, diverters, and other plumbing fixtures in tubs and showers</li> <li>Reroute pipes, make connections, install new drains, or repair existing ones</li> <li>Maintain tools and supplies to ensure readiness for each project</li> <li>Provide technical support to sales and installation teams</li> <li>Follow all safety policies and Bath Fitter procedures</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What is the ideal profile for this position?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Journeyman’s plumbing license (or equivalent)</li> <li>5–7 years of plumbing experience</li> <li>Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail</li> <li>Valid driver’s license and clean driving record</li> <li>Ability to lift up to 75 lbs and perform physically demanding tasks</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>About Us:</strong> Bath Fitter is the first choice, industry leader in bathroom renovations, and has been manufacturing and installing premium quality acrylic bathtubs and seamless bath wall systems since 1984, with locations in US, CAN and EU. Proud to be certified as a Great place to work®.&nbsp;</p> <p style="text-align: center;"><em>Celebrating 40 years in business and STILL GROWING</em></p> <p>Join the Bath Fitter team and embark on a journey where your skills will be celebrated, your ambition rewarded, and your potential unleashed.&nbsp;<br><br><br>#LI-JL1<br>#Lima</p> <p><em>$38 - $45 / hour</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><em>At Bath Fitter’s corporate locations, we are dedicated to cultivating an inclusive environment for everyone. We uphold a strong commitment to providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all current and potential employees. Should you require accommodations during the application process, they can be arranged by request.</em></p> <p><em>Bath Fitter thanks all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted in person.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Media Producer
description: <p><strong>Who are we?</strong></p> <p>For over 40 years, Bath Fitter has been perfecting its process to deliver durable, elegant, and functional bathtub solutions. Our mission: to enhance everyday life through comfort, design, and quality. We offer an engaged culture and a collaborative environment focused on support, autonomy, and innovation. We are a growing organization that prioritizes its employees and their quality of life. That’s why we’re proud to be recognized as a <strong>Great Place to Work®</strong> and one of Canada’s <strong>Most Admired Corporate Cultures</strong>.</p> <p><strong>In summary, what is the role about?</strong></p> <p>We are looking for a Media Content Producer to lead the creation and execution of our in-house productions, including paid advertising, organic content, and photography. This is a hands-on, creative role designed for someone who understands both the storytelling power of visuals and their tangible impact on performance and business results.</p> <p><strong>Why join the Bath Fitter team?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible schedule and hybrid work environment</li> <li>Group insurance starting on day one</li> <li>Retirement plan with employer contributions</li> <li>Paid vacation, personal days, and additional holidays during the festive season</li> <li>Employee &amp; corporate discounts</li> <li>High-impact projects across North America</li> <li>Creative autonomy in a collaborative environment</li> <li>A key position within the team</li> <li>On-site gym at our Saint-Eustache headquarters</li> <li>Bistro that will make you want to come to the office (varied, delicious meals subsidized by Bath Fitter)</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Social club</li> <li>And many more benefits to discover by joining Bath Fitter!</li> </ul> <p><strong>Ideal profile</strong></p> <ul> <li>3–5 years of experience in media production, with a portfolio showcasing commercial shoots and branded content;</li> <li>Proficient in video/photo production workflows (lighting, camera operations, post-production) and Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere Pro, After Effects, Photoshop) or equivalent tools, with the ability to oversee technical teams;</li> <li>Strong understanding of marketing objectives, paid media performance metrics, and how creative content drives conversion;</li> <li>Proven ability to translate a creative vision into actionable production plans while respecting budgets, timelines, and brand standards;</li> <li>Collaborative leadership style, strong visual intuition, pragmatic creativity — familiarity or network within Montreal’s film/photo community is a strong asset;</li> <li>Advanced verbal and written communication skills in both English and French.<strong><br><br></strong></li> </ul> <p><strong>Your responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Produce and execute in-house media content (video, photo, digital assets) for both paid and organic channels;</li> <li>Manage the full production process from ideation to delivery, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, coordination, and on-set supervision;</li> <li>Collaborate with the Creative Director, designers, and media/marketing strategists to ensure each deliverable aligns with brand identity and performance objectives;</li> <li>Lead or support studio and on-location shoots, overseeing directors of photography/shoots, technical crews, and talent;</li> <li>Coordinate set design, prop sourcing, and visual styling to match campaign direction;</li> <li>Organize and maintain the internal media library to ensure efficient access and reuse of assets;</li> <li>Develop and nurture a network of external collaborators (directors, DPs, editors, photographers) within Montreal’s production community;</li> <li>Analyze creative performance and optimize future productions for stronger visual impact and better campaign results.</li> </ul> <p><strong>This is your moment. Join us to create, innovate, and make a real impact. </strong><strong>Apply now!</strong></p> <hr> <p><em>At Bath Fitter corporate locations, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all. We are dedicated to providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all current and prospective employees. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, they can be arranged upon request.</em></p> <p><br>#LI-MG1<br>#Goudreau</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Multi Unit Operations Leader
description: <p><strong>Chicago | Bath Fitter</strong></p> <p>Are you a results-driven leader with a passion for developing talent and driving business growth? Bath Fitter, the industry leader in custom bath remodeling, is seeking an&nbsp;<strong>Area Development Leader (ADL)</strong>, as we call it,<strong> </strong>to oversee multiple retail locations, mentor Branch Leaders, and build strategies that accelerate sales, profitability, and operational excellence.</p> <p>This is a high-impact, visible leadership role where you will shape performance, strengthen culture, and ensure success across multiple markets.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Why Join Us?</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Competitive Compensation</strong>: Base salary + performance bonus</li> <li><strong>Full Benefits Package</strong>: 100% employer-paid medical &amp; vision for you and your family, dental and other coverage options, 401(k) with profit sharing, paid holidays, and paid time off</li> <li><strong>Tools to Succeed</strong>: Company vehicle, gas card, laptop, and cell phone provided</li> <li><strong>Career Growth</strong>: Be part of a company certified as a&nbsp;<em>Great Place to Work®</em>, with 40 years of success and expansion across the U.S., Canada, and Europe</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Region You’ll Lead</strong></p> <p>This role supports Bath Fitter retail branches in&nbsp;<strong>Lombard and Mokena.</strong></p> <ul> <li>Travel expected 3 weeks each month within the region</li> <li>1 week per month based at your home branch (must reside within the region)</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong></p> <p><strong>Sales Growth &amp; Profitability</strong></p> <ul> <li>Drive performance against budgets and KPIs (Closing %, Install Budget, Lead-to-Estimate, P&amp;L)</li> <li>Develop targeted action plans with Branch Leaders&nbsp;</li> <li>Partner on local strategies to accelerate revenue and profitability</li> </ul> <p><strong>Leadership &amp; Coaching</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build high-performing teams by coaching Branch Leaders</li> <li>Identify training and development opportunities; champion a performance culture of accountability, growth, and recognition</li> <li>Share best practices across the region to elevate overall business performance</li> </ul> <p><strong>Talent &amp; Team Development</strong></p> <ul> <li>Support hiring and succession planning for Branch Leaders&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Participate in interviews and onboarding to ensure talent alignment</li> <li>Model Bath Fitter’s values and HR best practices</li> </ul> <p><strong>Operational Excellence</strong></p> <ul> <li>Conduct regular one-on-one and group meetings with Branch Leaders</li> <li>Lead monthly regional performance calls to drive accountability and collaboration</li> <li>Ensure adherence to Bath Fitter standards for customer experience, operations, and safety</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What We’re Looking For</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>5+ years of multi-unit leadership experience</strong>&nbsp;(sales, operations, or related field)</li> <li><strong>Bachelor’s degree in business or related field</strong>&nbsp;preferred</li> <li>Proven ability to manage budgets, coach leaders, and drive measurable results</li> <li>Strong conflict resolution, communication, and motivational skills</li> <li>Proficiency with technology platforms (Teams, Excel, etc.)</li> <li>Valid driver’s license, clean driving record, and ability to obtain a U.S. passport</li> <li>Willingness to travel weekly across the region</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>About Bath Fitter</strong></p> <p>Since 1984, Bath Fitter has been the #1 name in custom bathroom renovations, manufacturing and installing premium acrylic bathtubs and seamless wall systems across the U.S., Canada, and Europe. With&nbsp;<strong>40 years of growth and innovation</strong>, we remain committed to quality, service, and creating exceptional customer experiences. Proudly recognized as a&nbsp;<em>Great Place to Work®</em>.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>✨&nbsp;<strong>Ready to lead, coach, and grow with us? Apply today and shape the future success of Bath Fitter in the Chicago region.</strong></p> <p><strong>#Taylor</strong></p> <p><strong>#LI-BT1</strong></p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Shipper (evening)
description: <p>&nbsp;</p> <p data-start="96" data-end="291"><strong data-start="96" data-end="159">Do you want to contribute to the growth of a local company?</strong><br data-start="159" data-end="162">Are you looking to join a great team where your contribution will directly impact the success of both the team and the company?</p> <p data-start="293" data-end="431">If so, we want to hear from you! We are currently looking for an <strong data-start="358" data-end="377">Evening Shipper</strong> (2:55 pm to 11:25 pm) at a rate of <strong data-start="413" data-end="428">$26.09/hour</strong>.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <h4 data-start="438" data-end="474"><strong>Why join the Bath Fitter team?</strong></h4> <ul> <li data-start="477" data-end="502">Stable, guaranteed work</li> <li data-start="505" data-end="544">$23.09/hour + $3/hour evening premium</li> <li data-start="547" data-end="564">Group insurance</li> <li data-start="567" data-end="605">Employer-contributed retirement plan</li> <li data-start="608" data-end="636">Vacation and personal days</li> <li data-start="639" data-end="681">Extra holidays during the holiday season</li> <li data-start="684" data-end="704">Overtime available</li> <li data-start="707" data-end="734">Generous referral program</li> <li data-start="737" data-end="769">Employee &amp; corporate discounts</li> <li data-start="772" data-end="817">On-site gym at our St-Eustache headquarters</li> <li data-start="820" data-end="883">Bistro (variety of delicious meals subsidized by Bath Fitter)</li> <li data-start="886" data-end="915">Employee Assistance Program</li> <li data-start="918" data-end="931">Social club</li> <li data-start="934" data-end="968">Career advancement opportunities</li> <li data-start="971" data-end="1034">And many more benefits to discover when you join Bath Fitter!</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <h3 data-start="1041" data-end="1074">What does the role involve?</h3> <p data-start="1075" data-end="1208">The Shipper prepares goods for shipment and loads trailers according to the established route plan and standard loading procedures.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <h3 data-start="1215" data-end="1241">Key Responsibilities</h3> <ul> <li data-start="1244" data-end="1283">Verify and weigh outgoing merchandise</li> <li data-start="1286" data-end="1338">Prepare orders (pack, label, and scan merchandise)</li> <li data-start="1341" data-end="1389">Load merchandise into trailers or onto pallets</li> <li data-start="1392" data-end="1448">Organize items neatly and accessibly in the department</li> <li data-start="1451" data-end="1503">Notify the team leader of errors or missing orders</li> <li data-start="1506" data-end="1547">Participate in monthly inventory counts</li> <li data-start="1550" data-end="1588">Refill packaging material containers</li> <li data-start="1591" data-end="1635">Maintain a clean and safe work environment</li> <li data-start="1638" data-end="1682">Follow company health and safety standards</li> <li data-start="1685" data-end="1727">Perform other related duties as required</li> </ul> <h3 data-start="1734" data-end="1762">What we’re looking for</h3> <ul> <li data-start="1765" data-end="1813">Experience in a shipping department</li> <li data-start="1816" data-end="1867">Valid license to operate an electric pallet truck</li> <li data-start="1870" data-end="1927">Basic knowledge of inventory items and computer systems</li> <li data-start="1930" data-end="1996">Familiarity with metric and imperial measurements and basic math</li> <li data-start="1999" data-end="2045">Responsible, detail-oriented, and autonomous</li> <li data-start="2048" data-end="2072">Strong teamwork skills</li> <li data-start="2075" data-end="2106">Good organizational abilities</li> <li data-start="2109" data-end="2140">Ability to work independently</li> <li data-start="2143" data-end="2175">Continuous improvement mindset</li> <li data-start="2178" data-end="2249">Ability to lift up to 50 lbs and handle heavier loads with assistance</li> </ul> <h3 data-start="2256" data-end="2272">Who we are</h3> <p data-start="2273" data-end="2588">For over 40 years, Bath Fitter has been perfecting its process to meet customer needs and deliver the very best bathtubs. Our acrylic bathtubs and showers are durable, easy to clean, and installed in just one day—convenient! Every day, Bath Fitter employees strive to improve products and enrich customers’ lives.</p> <p data-start="2590" data-end="2669">Our vision is to be both an excellent employer and a valued business partner.</p> <p data-start="2671" data-end="2999">At Bath Fitter, we foster an engaged culture and a collaborative environment built on teamwork, autonomy, and innovation. We are a growing organization that puts people and their quality of life first. That’s why we are proud to be certified as one of the <strong data-start="2927" data-end="2946">Best Workplaces</strong> and <strong data-start="2951" data-end="2996">Most Admired Corporate Cultures in Canada</strong>.</p> <p data-start="3001" data-end="3113">We believe life is too short not to be passionate about what you do every day. We look forward to meeting you!</p> <hr> <p data-start="3115" data-end="3136">#LI-MG1<br data-start="3122" data-end="3125">#Goudreau</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Social Media Manager
description: <p><strong>Who are we?</strong></p> <p>For over 40 years, Bath Fitter has been perfecting its process to deliver durable, elegant, and functional bathtub solutions. Our mission: to enhance everyday life through comfort, design, and quality. We offer an engaged culture and a collaborative environment focused on support, autonomy, and innovation. We are a growing organization that prioritizes its employees and their quality of life. That’s why we’re proud to be recognized as a <strong>Great Place to Work®</strong> and one of Canada’s <strong>Most Admired Corporate Cultures</strong>.</p> <p><strong>In summary, what is the role about?</strong></p> <p>You will elevate the Bath Fitter/Bain Magique brand across all social platforms by creating engaging and authentic content. You’ll lead the organic strategy, drive community engagement, and evolve our brand voice to boost awareness and connection. Embedded within a creative, cross-functional marketing team, you’ll turn every idea into a high-impact social experience.</p> <p><strong>Why join the Bath Fitter team?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible schedule and hybrid work environment</li> <li>Group insurance starting on day one</li> <li>Retirement plan with employer contributions</li> <li>Paid vacation, personal days, and additional holidays during the festive season</li> <li>Employee &amp; corporate discounts</li> <li>High-impact projects across North America</li> <li>Creative autonomy in a collaborative environment</li> <li>A key position within the team</li> <li>On-site gym at our Saint-Eustache headquarters</li> <li>Bistro that will make you want to come to the office (varied, delicious meals subsidized by Bath Fitter)</li> <li>Employee assistance program</li> <li>Social club</li> <li>And many more benefits to discover by joining Bath Fitter!</li> </ul> <p><strong>Ideal profile</strong></p> <ul> <li>3–5 years of experience managing brand social media accounts, including creating or supervising photo and video content;</li> <li>Proven track record of driving audience growth and improving social media performance;</li> <li>Strong understanding of social media trends, algorithms, and cross-platform storytelling;</li> <li>Ability to turn creative ideas into measurable strategies, with strong organizational and prioritization skills;</li> <li>Creative, curious, outgoing, and solution-oriented mindset, everything is content;</li> <li>Advanced verbal and written communication skills in both English and French.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Your responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and execute the organic social media strategy (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.) for Bath Fitter/Bain Magique;</li> <li>Create or oversee the production of engaging content (short-form videos, stories, photos, social campaigns) in collaboration with the creative team;</li> <li>Manage the social content calendar aligned with product launches, marketing initiatives, and key brand moments;</li> <li>Drive community engagement and conversation in an authentic tone aligned with the brand voice;</li> <li>Analyze content performance using analytics tools (Meta Business Suite, Sprout Social, etc.) and provide recommendations for optimization;</li> <li>Collaborate with paid media, CX, retail network, creative, and PR teams to ensure cross-platform cohesion;</li> <li>Support influencer partnerships and user-generated content initiatives in alignment with the influencer strategy;</li> <li>Stay ahead of trends, emerging formats, and best practices to keep the brand culturally relevant.</li> </ul> <p><strong>This is your moment. Join us to create, innovate, and make a real impact. </strong><strong>Apply now!</strong></p> <hr> <p><em>At Bath Fitter corporate locations, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment for all. We are dedicated to providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all current and prospective employees. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, they can be arranged upon request.</em></p> <p><br>#LI-MG1<br>#Goudreau</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Talent Development Coordinator
description: <p></p> <p><strong>(Maternity leave contract)</strong></p> <p><strong>Who are we?</strong></p> <p>For nearly 40 years, Bath Fitter has been perfecting its process to meet the needs and provide the best bathtubs for everyone. Our showers and bathtubs are made of shiny acrylic that is easy to clean and can be installed in just one day. Convenient! Every day, the people at Bath Fitter strive to do better; to improve products and customers' lives. Our vision is to be an excellent employer and business partner.</p> <p>At Bath Fitter, we offer an engaged culture, a collaborative environment focused on mutual support, autonomy, and innovation. We are a growing organization that prioritizes employees and their quality of life. That's why we're proud to be certified as " Great Place to Work" &amp; "Most Admired Corporate Cultures in Canada".</p> <p><strong>In summary, what does the role entail?</strong></p> <p>The Talent Development Coordinator actively supports training and development initiatives at Bath Fitter. This role involves planning, implementing, and monitoring talent development programs, along with handling administrative operations. The ideal candidate will be proactive, agile, and eager to advance within the organization, ensuring smooth and efficient processes while maintaining high standards of policy and procedure.</p> <p><strong>Why become a part of the Bath Fitter Team?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible schedule and telecommuting policy.</li> <li>Maternity leave contract.</li> <li>Develop expertise in Canadian and American markets.</li> <li>Hold a key position within the team.</li> <li>Gym at the St-Eustache headquarters.</li> <li>Bistro that will make you want to come to the office (varied, delicious meals subsidized by Bath Fitter).</li> <li>Employee assistance program.</li> <li>Many other benefits to discover by joining Bath Fitter!</li> </ul> <p><strong>What is the ideal profile for this position?</strong></p> <ul> <li>College or professional diploma in office administration, human resources, or related field, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>Minimum of 3 years of administrative work experience, preferably in human resources, learning, or talent management.</li> <li>Customer service experience.</li> <li>Detail-oriented, proactive, results-oriented, with the ability to multitask in a dynamic environment.</li> <li>Autonomy, initiative-taking ability, excellent time management, and effective prioritization skills.</li> <li>Excellent proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and familiarity with learning management systems (LMS) and virtual meeting platforms (e.g., Microsoft Teams), an asset.</li> <li>Excellent bilingual communication skills (French and English), both verbal and written. <ul> <li>Proficiency in French and English is required as the employee will be working with employees and clients in Canada and the United States.</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <p><strong>As a Talent Development Coordinator, what will your responsibilities be?</strong></p> <ul> <li>Maintain comprehensive training records, including attendance, assessment results, and certifications.</li> <li>Assist in creating and maintaining standard operating procedures for training and talent processes.</li> <li>Input and update training data in the Learning Management System (LMS) or other databases.</li> <li>Generate and distribute regular reports on training activities, participation, and outcomes.</li> <li>Analyze training and talent metrics, utilizing data to identify trends and areas for improvement.</li> <li>Prepare and maintain talent documents, including development plans and performance reviews.</li> <li>Assist in planning and executing talent management initiatives such as succession planning, leadership development, and performance management, while facilitating effective communication within the team and across departments to ensure alignment and clarity.</li> <li>Coordinate logistics for training events, including venue readiness, equipment, and material management.</li> </ul> <p>We believe life is too short to not be passionate about what we do every day. Note that we are first and foremost looking for an authentic person to help us achieve our mission.</p> <p>We look forward to meeting you!</p> <hr> <p>#LI-MG1<br>#Goudreau</p> <p></p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><a href="https://careers.bathfitter.com/en/privacy-policy" target="_PARENT">You can view our full Privacy Policy here</a></p></div>

title: Senior Sales Director, Media
description: <p>Brightcove is revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video experiences. We’re offering an opportunity for a Senior Sales Director to partner with some of the world’s most iconic brands, helping them achieve their marketing goals through our cutting-edge products and services.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Position Overview:</strong></p> <p>We’re seeking a highly accomplished and well-connected sales leader to take on a senior role in driving our growth. This individual will bring a deep passion for technology and a proven ability to build and manage relationships with large-scale Media customers.</p> <p>The ideal candidate has a strong track record of consistently meeting or exceeding revenue targets, preferably within the enterprise SaaS platform space, and specifically selling into the media vertical. We’re looking for someone who is motivated, disciplined, collaborative, and creative—an exceptional communicator and negotiator who thrives in fast-moving environments.</p> <p>This role is responsible for accelerating revenue, increasing adoption, and expanding market penetration within your segment. Please note: candidates with a background primarily in advertising sales will not be a fit for this position.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build, implement, and own a robust sales pipeline to manage lead intake, outbound activity, prioritization, and performance metrics.</li> <li>Develop and maintain strong executive-level relationships (C-suite, VP, Director) across organizations and industry sectors.</li> <li>Craft and deliver compelling value propositions that demonstrate the advantages of the Brightcove platform.</li> <li>Leverage a virtual territory team to execute sales objectives.</li> <li>Prepare deal overviews and contract summaries for stakeholders.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Qualifications/Experience Required:</strong></p> <ul> <li>8–10 years of sales/business development experience in enterprise software, with strong media vertical expertise.</li> <li>Proven ability to engage at C-suite, technical, and developer levels.</li> <li>Track record of driving growth through up-selling, cross-selling, and closing six-figure deals.</li> <li>Deep knowledge of ad-supported media and video use cases.</li> <li>Strong deal-making skills and consistent record of exceeding revenue targets.</li> <li>Ability to assess client needs and align them with product and service solutions.</li> <li>Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Special Conditions:</strong></p> <ul> <li>This is a quota-carrying role</li> <li>This role does involve domestic travel, up to 30%</li> <li>Hybrid or Remote</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>WORKING AT BRIGHTCOVE&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to provide our employees with an environment where they can do their best work and be their best selves. This includes a focus on our employees’ work experience, actively creating a culture where inclusion and growth are at the center, and hiring, recognizing, promoting employees who are committed to living and breathing these same ideals. We value collaboration, creativity, work/life balance, professional growth and creating an empowering space for open communication. Whether you’re in one of our offices around the world or working remotely you have plenty of opportunities to meet colleagues and</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!</span></p> <p><em>We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Brightcove embraces diversity and seeks candidates who support persons of all identities and backgrounds. We strongly encourage individuals from underrepresented and/or marginalized identities to apply. If you need any accommodations for your interview, please email&nbsp;<a href="mailto:recruiting@brightcove.com">recruiting@brightcove.com</a>.&nbsp;</em></p> <p><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">The Brightcove<a href="https://www.brightcove.com/en/legal/privacy/"> Privacy Policy</a> explains the processing and purposes of any personal information.</span></em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">At Brightcove, we believe that providing comprehensive and competitive compensation and benefits packages across the globe are essential to our employees. Base salary is just one component of Brightcove’s total rewards program. We offer a wide range of benefits and perks that may include bonus or commission, Brightcove stock, unlimited paid time off, 401(K) matching, health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), generous employer Health Savings Account (HSA) contributions, tuition reimbursement, 100% paid parental leave and more.<br></span></p></div><div class="title">USA Brightcove Base Salary Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$150,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$165,000 USD</span></div></div></div>

title: Contracts Manager
description: <p>We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Contracts Manager to oversee the full lifecycle of contracts with the Department of Defense (DoD) and other U.S. Government agencies. The ideal candidate has a strong background in federal contracting, excellent knowledge of FAR/DFARS, and proven experience managing complex government and commercial agreements. This role is critical to our growth strategy and requires a detail-oriented professional who can ensure compliance, mitigate risk, and support business objectives through sound contract management and negotiation practices.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li>Manage the full contract lifecycle, from pre-award planning, proposal support, and contract negotiation through execution, modifications, and closeout.</li> <li>Serve as the primary point of contact for all contractual matters between Auterion and U.S. Government contracting officers, prime contractors, and subcontractors.</li> <li>Review and interpret RFPs, RFIs, and solicitations to identify contractual requirements, risks, and flow-down clauses.</li> <li>Draft, review, and negotiate a variety of contractual documents, including NDAs, teaming agreements, subcontracts, purchase orders, and government contracts.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and company policies, including FAR, DFARS, ITAR/EAR export controls, NIST SP 800-171/CMMC cybersecurity, supply-chain and small business subcontracting requirements, and other DoD/IC mandates. Maintain readiness for DCMA, DCAA, or Inspector General audits and advise leadership on evolving regulatory impacts.</li> <li>Coordinate with cross-functional teams (Business Development, Capture, Program Management, Engineering, Finance, and Legal) to align contract terms with program and pricing strategies.</li> <li>Monitor contract performance and deliverables, track modifications, and maintain accurate contract records and correspondence.</li> <li>Identify and mitigate contractual risks, providing proactive guidance to management and stakeholders.</li> <li>Develop and maintain standard contract templates, policies, and procedures to drive efficiency and consistency across the organization.</li> <li>Lead or support internal audits, external government audits (e.g., DCMA, IG), vendor performance evaluations (e.g., CPARS) and contract close-out activities: funds release, deliverables acceptance, lessons-learned.</li> <li>Drive contract management process improvements, including implementation/use of contract lifecycle management (CLM) tools, dashboards and analytics to provide visibility and track key performance indicators (KPIs).</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in business, law, finance, or a related field; advanced degree or relevant certifications (e.g., CPCM, NCMA, PMP) preferred.</li> <li>Minimum of 5 years of experience in U.S. Government contracting (preferably DoD/IC) with demonstrated success managing contracts of varying complexity.</li> <li>Deep understanding of the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS); familiarity with NIST cyber requirements, ITAR/EAR, supply chain flow-down, small business rules, and audit/contract close-out procedures</li> <li>Experience with various contract types, including FFP, T&amp;M, CPFF, OTA, IDIQ, GSA, and subcontracts.</li> <li>Strong negotiation and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex terms and propose creative solutions.</li> <li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across functions and with government/industry partners.</li> <li>Highly organized and detail-oriented, capable of managing multiple priorities under tight deadlines.</li> <li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint); experience with contract management systems and CRM tools (e.g., HubSpot) is a plus.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to balance compliance and business goals in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.</li> <li>US Citizenship required. Active Secret Clearance preferred.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Unlimited PTO</li> <li>Health Insurance (includes dental &amp; vision)</li> <li>Medical flex spending</li> <li>Life Insurance</li> <li>Retirement Plan - 401k</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Corporate Attorney
description: <p>We are seeking a dynamic Corporate Attorney to support our legal and corporate strategy as we scale. This role will report directly to the VP, Corporate Counsel and will collaborate closely with our executive and business teams. Offering significant exposure to high-level strategy and a wide range of legal challenges, this position is an excellent opportunity for a motivated individual aspiring to become a General Counsel.</p> <p>We are looking for an individual who demonstrates flexibility, responsiveness, and a proven ability to learn quickly and navigate ambiguity in a fast-paced, high-growth environment. The ideal candidate will be a strategic partner, offering actionable legal guidance as we tackle complex corporate transactions and navigate regulatory and compliance requirements (including government/defense).</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Government Contracting</strong>: Manage legal support and oversee guidance on matters related to U.S. government and defense contracts. This includes working with outside counsel to ensure compliance with the FAR/DFARS, support bid processes, and assist with contract negotiation and administration. Partner with internal stakeholders and outside counsel to manage risk and ensure adherence to regulatory and contractual requirements.</li> <li><strong>Investment Transactions &amp; Due Diligence</strong>: Oversee and manage the legal aspects of fundraising efforts and M&amp;A transactions, including venture capital and private equity investments. Coordinate and manage due diligence processes for transactions and investments. Work with outside counsel to draft, review, and negotiate documents for financing transactions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams and external counsel to ensure all risks and opportunities are identified and appropriately managed.</li> <li><strong>Risk and Compliance Management</strong>: Partner with outside counsel to advise on corporate governance, compliance, and regulatory matters impacting investment and acquisition activities, including securities laws and industry-specific regulations.</li> <li><strong>Stakeholder Management</strong>: Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including investors, partners, outside counsel, and consultants, to align legal strategy with business goals. Act as a strategic business partner, offering actionable legal guidance to our executive and business development teams.</li> <li><strong>Document Management</strong>: Ensure the secure and organized management of transaction-related documents, filings, and agreements. Maintain detailed transaction records to facilitate efficient access for audit, reporting, and compliance purposes.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>4+ years of experience working with or within technology-focused companies, with prior law-firm experience</li> <li>Juris Doctor or equivalent law degree from an accredited institution; admission to the bar in at least one state is required</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to learn quickly and adapt to new, complex legal areas, including corporate transactions, governance , and regulatory compliance (such as U.S. government contracting).</li> <li>A flexible and responsive problem-solver with a high tolerance for ambiguity, capable of assessing risks and opportunities in high-stakes transactions.</li> <li>Excellent analytical skills and strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex legal concepts into clear, actionable advice for stakeholders.</li> <li>Highly organized, able to prioritize effectively and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally and communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Unlimited PTO</li> <li>Health Insurance (includes dental &amp; vision)</li> <li>Medical flex spending</li> <li>Life Insurance</li> <li>Retirement Plan - 401k</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Flight Test Engineer
description: <p>As a Flight Test Engineer at Auterion, you will work closely with developers and product teams to identify hardware and software issues, and test new features across the Auterion technology stack. You will assist with integration and testing of robotic systems from partner companies, as well as build and maintain internal flight test assets. This role also has a customer-facing component, as you will represent Auterion at flight-ops events like training classes and demonstrations.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flight testing multiple platforms including multicopters, fixed-wings and VTOLs: fly, capture logs, submit bug reports, and provide feedback on new features.&nbsp;</li> <li>Assemble and maintain an internal fleet of test assets, and become an expert on robotic systems from our partner OEMs.</li> <li>Electrical and mechanical integration, modification, and prototyping. Mechanical design, 3D printing, soldering, assembly, mounting and wiring of electronic subassemblies.</li> <li>Become deeply knowledgeable on Auterion hardware and software, including Skynode, PX4, AuterionOS, Auterion Mission Control, and Auterion Suite.</li> <li>Assist with writing technical documentation, to include operators manuals and test procedures.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>BS in a relevant engineering field (robotics, computer science, systems engineering, mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, or similar).&nbsp;</li> <li>Solid knowledge of PX4, Linux, and computer networking. The ability to contribute code is nice to have but not required.</li> <li>Experience working on unmanned systems and have a sharp eye for good user experiences. Be vocal and correct about “what right looks like” when it comes to UX and workflows.</li> <li>Experience designing, building, testing, and tuning drones.</li> <li>Working understanding of electronics and wiring, soldering, and mechanical integration to include 3D printing.</li> <li>FAA Part-107 license required.&nbsp;</li> <li>US Citizenship and ability to obtain Secret Clearance required.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Unlimited PTO</li> <li>Health Insurance (includes dental &amp; vision)</li> <li>Medical flex spending</li> <li>Life Insurance</li> <li>Retirement Plan - 401k</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Global Recruiter
description: <p><strong>Overview</strong><strong><br></strong>We’re looking for a Global Recruiter who will play a pivotal role in the future of our company. Our Global Recruiter will be responsible for overseeing all recruitment efforts across our locations in Zurich, Germany, USA and more! You’ll be collaborating closely with the wider people and finance team, as well as providing the overall recruiting support to the entire organization.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and execute comprehensive recruitment strategies to attract top talent globally, utilizing various channels such as online job boards, social media, networking events, and industry partnerships</li> <li>Proactively source, screen, and qualify candidates for technical and non-technical roles across multiple disciplines, including robotics engineering, software development, computer vision, product management, and more</li> <li>Ensure a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, from initial contact to onboarding, by providing timely communication, valuable feedback, and personalized support</li> <li>Partner closely with hiring managers and department heads to understand their hiring needs, define job requirements, and establish recruitment priorities aligned with business objectives</li> <li>Stay informed on industry trends and talent market dynamics to inform recruitment strategies, identify emerging skill sets, and make data-driven decisions</li> <li>Continuously evaluate and optimize recruitment processes to streamline efficiency, improve candidate quality, and enhance the overall recruitment experience for both candidates and hiring teams</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proven experience as a recruiter in a fast-paced, technology-driven environment, with a focus on technical recruitment</li> <li>Strong understanding of autonomous robotics, and related technologies</li> <li>3+ years experience recruiting in multiple locations, ideally in Switzerland and Germany &amp; the United States</li> <li>Excellent communication &amp; interpersonal skills</li> <li>Ability to build relationships and collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders</li> <li>Demonstrated proficiency in sourcing techniques, candidate assessment, and recruitment tools</li> <li>Strategic mindset with a proactive and results-oriented approach</li> <li>Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and HR software</li> <li>Ability to thrive in a dynamic, rapidly evolving startup environment</li> <li>CH/EU citizenship required</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours &amp; hybrid workplace</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Generous holiday allowance</li> <li>Pension plan&nbsp;</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Mental health and wellbeing support</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> <li>Regular team social</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Program Manager, Autonomous Robotic Systems EMEA
description: <p>To drive our growth strategy in the dynamic market of autonomous robotic systems in defense we’re looking for a Program Manager who will be responsible for the delivery of customer proposals and projects. In this position you will have a significant contribution to the growth of the company. You will manage a portfolio of projects and will be accountable for delivering winning proposals and customer projects in-time, in-cost and to full customer satisfaction. This requires a holistic approach to project management covering all major disciplines tailored to the respective project sizes. In this role you will be customer facing and lead internal bid-/project teams across the Auterion organization.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li>Manage a portfolio of medium to large customer programs focused on autonomous robotic systems, from contract award through delivery and sustainment.</li> <li>Lead cross-functional teams across engineering, integration, manufacturing, and testing to deliver complex HW/SW systems on time and within budget.</li> <li>Develop and maintain detailed project plans, schedules, budgets, and risk registers using agile and traditional PM methodologies.</li> <li>Coordinate with internal teams, OEM partners, and customers to align program goals, resolve issues, and ensure high-quality outcomes.</li> <li>Oversee program financials including cost estimation, budgeting, forecasting, and tracking of financial performance.</li> <li>Prepare and lead responses to customer RFIs and RFPs, ensuring technical accuracy, strategic alignment, and competitive positioning.</li> <li>Ensure compliance with defense and aerospace standards, including export controls and cybersecurity requirements.</li> <li>Drive continuous improvement and contribute to the product and technology roadmap with feedback from program execution.</li> <li>Support logistics planning for hardware deliveries, field trials, and system deployment.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>MSc, MEng or MBA with strong technical background in autonomous robotic systems</li> <li>5+ years experience in defense, aerospace or related industries</li> <li>Experience and/or willing to work in a start-up environment</li> <li>Experience in managing portfolios of medium to large sized projects consisting of solution engineering, HW-/SW delivery, customization and integration content</li> <li>Competence in methodologies and tools for (agile) project planning and scheduling contract- and risk management</li> <li>Experience in RFI / RFP processes and respective customer offer and proposal elaboration</li> <li>Strong leadership and communication skills</li> <li>Strongly customer orientated and performance driven</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Generous holiday allowance</li> <li>Pension plan&nbsp;</li> <li>Extended social security package&nbsp;</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Senior Computer Vision Engineer
description: <p>We are seeking a highly skilled Computer Vision Engineer for vision based navigation systems with a proven track record of implementing and deploying vision based navigation systems on resource constrained devices, such as unmanned aerial vehicles. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in open-source visual inertial-based localization, visual SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), and expertise in the underlying optimization frameworks. In this position, the candidate will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing state-of-the-art visual inertial navigation algorithms and techniques, enabling drones to navigate autonomously and accurately in a variety of real-world applications.&nbsp;</p> <p>This is a product facing role where you would be taking the lead on all aspects of development, from providing input into hardware selection to evaluations and performance optimizations to ensure a smooth operation of our products. You will work closely with stakeholders from multiple departments and teams in order to see projects through from the ideation phase to the hands of our customers.</p> <p>If you love solving challenging real world problems and delivering high-quality experiences by applying your specialized knowledge, we want to talk with you!</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and optimize visual inertial navigation algorithms for drones, focusing on open-source visual inertial-based localization and visual SLAM techniques.</li> <li>Implement and customize visual inertial navigation frameworks, ensuring seamless integration with existing drone systems and hardware.</li> <li>Conduct extensive testing and validation of navigation algorithms in real-world scenarios, fine-tuning parameters and optimizing performance for robust and accurate navigation.</li> <li>Evaluate and select appropriate sensors, cameras, IMUs, and other hardware components for visual inertial navigation systems.</li> <li>Develop and maintain calibration and synchronization procedures for visual inertial sensor setups, ensuring accurate data fusion and pose estimation.</li> <li>Develop repeatable testing methods to evaluate the performance and accuracy of the system for each iteration.</li> <li>Collaborate with computer vision and robotics experts to leverage the latest advancements in the field and integrate them into visual inertial navigation systems.</li> <li>Take full ownership of computer vision deliverables, leading across and providing technical guidance to disambiguate requirements, driving alignment, keeping stakeholders in the loop and ensuring strategic goals are met.</li> <li>Provide mentorship and coaching to other engineers, enabling career growth and acting as a bar raiser for product quality.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Master or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, or a related field.</li> <li>Strong hands-on experience in developing and implementing visual inertial navigation systems for drones, with a focus on open-source visual inertial-based localization and visual SLAM frameworks.</li> <li>Deep understanding of computer vision techniques, including feature detection and tracking/matching, bundle adjustment, optical flow, depth estimation and camera calibration.</li> <li>Excellent knowledge of sensor fusion techniques, including integrating visual and inertial data for accurate pose estimation and localization.</li> <li>Expertise in optimization frameworks for visual inertial navigation systems.</li> <li>Proficiency in programming languages such as C++, Python, or MATLAB, and thorough experience with ROS2 and OpenCV.</li> <li>Track record of having implemented and deployed visual inertial navigation systems on robotic platforms in real applications.</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to design and evaluate complex algorithms in real-world scenarios.</li> <li>Demonstrated track record of owning computer vision deliverables end to end and the ability to deploy them to real world applications.</li> <li>Ability to effectively navigate ambiguity and lead across in a fast paced environment.</li> <li>Demonstrated leadership skills, providing direction and mentorship to elevate product quality and team effectiveness.</li> <li>Effective communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in multidisciplinary teams, interacting with researchers, engineers, and external stakeholders.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Generous holiday allowance</li> <li>Company pension plan&nbsp;</li> <li>Car parking&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Mental health and wellbeing support</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Senior Electronics Engineer (Test Engineering)
description: <p>As a Senior Electronics / Hardware Engineer, you will play a key role within our Test Engineering team, designing and building test equipment to scale production of our next-generation drone platforms. In this position, you will take ownership of verification and production test equipment, from defining test concepts to designing automated test solutions, jigs and needle-bed adapters that help us improve yield and reliability. You’ll collaborate closely with our software engineers and OEM partners to enhance test coverage and reduce testing time, driving efficiency across our manufacturing process.</p> <p>This is a hands-on role in a fast-paced, agile environment, offering the opportunity to design creative, practical test solutions from concept through to mass production. This involves balancing the transition from our existing test setups to more scalable and complete solutions in a pragmatic and iterative way for a number of different projects.</p> <p>Beyond test engineering, you’ll apply your DFM and verification expertise across the broader hardware team by supporting the design of drone-specific PCBs and improving the manufacturability and robustness of our products. Your experience in PCB manufacturing, validation, and testing will be a valuable asset in guiding the team toward more reliable and cost-optimized designs.</p> <h4><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></h4> <ul> <li>Design and build manufacturing test solutions, including test equipment, jigs, and needle-bed adapters to enable high-volume PCB production (millions of units).</li> <li>Develop electromechanical systems for automated testing of connector interfaces and RF circuits.</li> <li>Support our engineering team by providing the test environment needed to verify their PCBs, e.g. by building test setups for climatic or interference testing.</li> <li>Plan and execute product verification, covering test case definition, execution, analysis, and comprehensive documentation, also for repair guidance.</li> <li>Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams by offering technical guidance and hands-on support for design-for-manufacturing (DFM) and validation of advanced avionics PCBs and modular systems.</li> <li>Generate technical documentation, including test concepts, CAD drawings, bills of materials (BOMs), and assembly or setup instructions and repair manuals.</li> <li>Act as the Subject Matter Expert on DFM aspects of PCB designs, driving improvements in yield, reliability, and production cost efficiency.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related technical field.</li> <li>5+ years of experience in designing and implementing test equipment for large-scale manufacturing.</li> <li>Practical experience with test automation for connectors and interfaces.</li> <li>Proficiency in ECAD tools (Altium Designer) and mechanical CAD (preferably SolidWorks).</li> <li>Practical experience in building test equipment for design verification and production testing, including cabling, 3D printing, and related prototyping tools.</li> <li>Pragmatic, solution-oriented mindset.</li> <li>Good verbal and written English communication skills.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Generous holiday allowance</li> <li>Company pension plan&nbsp;</li> <li>Car parking&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Mental health and wellbeing support</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software and electronics platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer
description: <p>We are looking for a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer to support the development of advanced mechanical systems for our autonomous drones and robotics platforms. This role is ideal for a mechanical engineer who is passionate about robotics and wants to make a real-world impact. You’ll be involved from concept through production, collaborating on the mechanical architecture and ensuring high-performance, reliable, and manufacturable hardware solutions. The challenges that you will be involved in range from designing enclosures for our avionics devices to designing entire drone prototypes.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li>Collaborate on&nbsp; the design, development, and optimization of mechanical systems for aerial, ground and maritime robotic platforms</li> <li>Own mechanical designs from early-stage concept development through large scale manufacturing</li> <li>Generate and review detailed CAD models, 2D drawings, tolerance analyses, and mechanical simulations (thermal, structural, vibration)</li> <li>Select and integrate components with multidisciplinary teams (electrical, software, systems)</li> <li>Validate mechanical designs under real-world and lab environments</li> <li>Work with manufacturing teams and suppliers to ensure design for manufacturability (DFM), cost-efficiency, and production scalability</li> <li>Document and communicate technical findings, test results, and project updates across internal and external stakeholders</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or a closely related field</li> <li>5+ years of industry experience in mechanical design, preferably in robotics, drones, aerospace, or high-performance mechatronic systems</li> <li>Proficiency with CAD tools and PDM/PLM systems, preferably Onshape or Solidworks</li> <li>Strong experience in mechanical design fundamentals: materials, manufacturing processes, thermal management, structural analysis, and kinematics</li> <li>Hands-on experience with prototyping, assembly, and mechanical testing</li> <li>Familiarity with design for environmental constraints (IP rating, vibration, temperature, etc.) typical in drone and aerospace environments</li> <li>Experience collaborating in cross-functional hardware/software teams</li> <li>Excellent problem-solving, communication (English), and project management skills</li> <li>EU/CH citizenship or existing right to work in the EU required</li> <li>The ability to fly a drone is a plus</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Generous holiday allowance</li> <li>Company pension plan&nbsp;</li> <li>Car parking&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Mental health and wellbeing support</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform title: Senior Software Engineer, Edge & Cloud Integration
description: <p>As a Senior Software Engineer – Edge &amp; Cloud Integration, you will design, implement, and optimize software that runs on the “edge” — onboard companion computers and embedded systems — and connects seamlessly to our cloud services. You’ll play a key role in building the next generation of intelligent, connected drone applications that power Auterion’s ecosystem, enabling real-time communication, mission planning, and data-driven insights across edge and cloud environments.</p> <p>In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to bridge the gap between onboard systems and cloud-based infrastructure, ensuring robust data flow, efficient processing, and secure integration between autonomous platforms and distributed services.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design, develop, and maintain software that runs on edge devices (e.g., Jetson based companion computers and Auterion Skynode devices) and integrates with cloud-based systems.</li> <li>Implement reliable, low-latency communication between edge and cloud using REST, gRPC, MQTT, or WebSockets.</li> <li>Develop and deploy edge applications using C++ and Python on Linux environments.</li> <li>Build and maintain containerized edge services using Docker and related orchestration tools.</li> <li>Integrate with cloud APIs and services for device management, telemetry, and data ingestion.</li> <li>Design and implement real-time or near-real-time data processing pipelines.</li> <li>Contribute to CI/CD pipelines to automate testing, integration, and deployment of edge and cloud software.</li> <li>Troubleshoot and optimize low-level Linux services (systemd, networking, process management).</li> <li>Collaborate with firmware, cloud, and UI teams to deliver a seamless end-to-end experience for Auterion-powered drones.</li> <li>Maintain strong engineering and cybersecurity best practices across all phases of development.</li> <li>Write clear, maintainable, and well-documented code with strong version control discipline.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent technical field.</li> <li>5+ years of experience developing software in C++ and Python on Linux systems.</li> <li>Experience building and deploying edge applications for embedded or companion platforms (e.g Jetson, Raspberry, companion computers or IoT hardware).</li> <li>Proficiency with network protocols and APIs (REST, gRPC, MQTT, WebSockets).</li> <li>Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and distributed systems.</li> <li>Experience integrating with cloud platforms and IoT services (AWS IoT, Azure IoT, or GCP IoT or custom backends).</li> <li>Understanding of real-time or near-real-time data processing techniques.</li> <li>Experience maintaining CI/CD pipelines for edge or distributed deployments.</li> <li>Proven ability to debug and optimize performance on Linux systems.</li> <li>Strong collaboration and communication skills; ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary environment.</li> <li>Experience working with PX4 is preferred.&nbsp;</li> <li>US Citizenship required. Eligibility for Secret Clearance preferred.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Unlimited PTO</li> <li>Health Insurance (includes dental &amp; vision)</li> <li>Medical flex spending</li> <li>Life Insurance</li> <li>Retirement Plan - 401k</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>

title: Solutions Engineer
description: <p>As a Solutions Engineer, you will work closely with Auterion’s customers and partners to deploy our technology into their stacks and to support them during their integration journey. This role combines hands-on implementation of cutting-edge technology, with effective client &amp; project management skills. You will solve quests ranging from hardware systems and sensor integration questions to flight control problems where you will interact with our teams to help our client bring their drones safely to the sky. You will be our interface to the customer's engineering team.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities and Duties</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Solutions Adoption:</strong> Manage and support the end-to-end implementation of Auterion’s technology into the applications &amp; tech stack of our customers.</li> <li><strong>Deal Support:</strong> Provide sales support by coordinating and managing sales-related activities, such as preparing and processing quotes, orders, and invoices.</li> <li><strong>Technical Design:</strong> Work with the product engineering team on designing and implementing features (on an embedded linux and microcontroller/RTOS environment).</li> <li><strong>Customer Engagement:</strong> Respond to customer inquiries and resolve issues in a timely and professional manner, ensuring customer satisfaction and loyalty.</li> <li><strong>Technical Documentation and Enablement:</strong> Closely work with Auterion’s product engineering and support teams to further build &amp; grow our product offerings and documentation.</li> <li><strong>Cross-functional Collaboration:</strong> work with internal departments, such as finance, marketing, and operations, to ensure seamless communication and coordination of sales-related activities.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications and Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>3+ years experience in a solutions or sales engineering role, ideally within startups, scale-ups with experience in robotics technologies an added bonus.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.</li> <li>Proficiency in customer facing aspects of engineering, working and interfacing directly with customers.</li> <li>UAV piloting experience, with knowledge of drone flight control systems such as PX4 being a nice to have.</li> <li>Experience with Zendesk and/or other ticketing systems.</li> <li>Experience in software engineering (C++).</li> <li>Experience with Electrical and mechanical integration, modification, and prototyping.&nbsp;</li> <li>Mechanical design expertise; 3D printing, soldering, assembly, mounting and wiring of electronic subassemblies.</li> <li>Willingness to work flexible hours and travel internationally.</li> <li>Willingness to work with contested countries.</li> <li>US Citizenship required, with eligibility to obtain clearances.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible working hours</li> <li>Stock Options</li> <li>Unlimited PTO</li> <li>Health Insurance (includes dental &amp; vision)</li> <li>Medical flex spending</li> <li>Life Insurance</li> <li>Retirement Plan - 401k</li> <li>Enhanced maternity &amp; paternity leave</li> <li>Learning and development opportunities</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Auterion</strong></p> <p>We are building the leading software platform for AI-powered autonomous systems for enterprise and government customers. Our team is supporting the most important missions and solving the most challenging problems.</p> <p>At Auterion, we bring together the sharpest minds who love to solve the hardest problems. Join a vibrant team built on innovation, openness, and excellence, where you’ll be empowered to develop ideas, collaborate across all levels, and make an impact that matters.</p>
