title: Associate General Counsel
description: <p>We are a technology-driven specialty pharmacy startup focused on making specialty medications more accessible and affordable for patients while helping keep specialty practices independent. We combine clinical expertise with digital innovation to deliver a better specialty pharmacy experience. As we continue to scale, we are looking for a highly skilled <strong>Associate General Counsel</strong> to help lead both the strategic and day-to-day execution of our legal and regulatory efforts.</p> <h3><strong>Position Summary</strong></h3> <p>The <strong>Associate General Counsel </strong>will work closely with the executive team to manage a wide range of legal, regulatory, and compliance matters. This role will be hands-on, supporting operations, pharmacy compliance, commercial contracts, licensing, and data privacy, with a focus on ensuring the company operates within all applicable laws and industry standards.</p> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li><strong>Regulatory &amp; Pharmacy Compliance</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Provide guidance on all aspects of our operating model. Understand federal and state regulations related to pharmacy or physician dispensing</li> <li>Assist with monitoring and implementing compliance with laws and regulations from relevant agencies, including CMS, DEA, FDA, and state Boards of Pharmacy and Medicine</li> <li>Understand and advise on compliance with payor contracts</li> </ul> </ul> <ul> <li><strong>Legal Counsel &amp; Commercial Support</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Draft, review, and negotiate a broad range of agreements including service contracts, MSAs, vendor agreements, distribution and payer contracts, and NDAs.</li> <li>Support the legal review of new business models, patient support programs, and partnerships to ensure alignment with healthcare laws.</li> <li>Advise on data privacy and HIPAA compliance across platforms and services.<br><br></li> </ul> <li><strong>Corporate &amp; Operational Legal Support</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Assist with corporate governance, internal policies, and entity management.</li> <li>Support fundraising efforts by reviewing legal documents and conducting diligence.</li> <li>Advise on employment, vendor, and contractor matters as needed.<br><br></li> </ul> <li><strong>Risk Management &amp; Internal Processes</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Help build and manage internal legal and compliance workflows, processes, and documentation.</li> <li>Conduct legal research and stay current with evolving healthcare regulations and digital health law.</li> <li>Participate in internal training and policy development on compliance and legal best practices.</li> </ul> </ul> <h3><strong>Qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>JD from an accredited law school; licensed to practice in at least one U.S. jurisdiction.</li> <li>10 years of legal experience, with at least 3–5 years focused on healthcare &amp;/or pharmacy-related law.</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of HIPAA, pharmacy regulations, and healthcare compliance requirements.</li> <li>Experience in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts.</li> <li>Previous in-house legal experience or support of healthcare startups preferred.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred Traits</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Familiarity with specialty pharmacy operations, PBMs, and drug distribution models.</li> <li>Comfortable working cross-functionally with pharmacy operations, product, and clinical teams.</li> <li>Highly organized, responsive, and solution-oriented.</li> <li>Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment.<br><br></li> </ul> <p>Excited about the opportunity, but worried you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyway, and give us both the chance to find out.</p> <p>Expected Full-Time Base Salary:&nbsp; $185,000 - $225,000+</p> <p><em>This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <p><strong><br>Why You Should Join Our Team</strong></p> <p>A career at House Rx offers the chance to work with a talented group of entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology builders who are passionate about improving specialty care and making it easier for patients to access the medication that they need.<br><br>At House Rx, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected and have the opportunity to succeed. You'll find a culture that supports open communication, embracing failure as a learning opportunity, and always being open to new ideas—no matter how radical. We’re committed to creating a positive and collaborative culture to achieve our mission, all while supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between.</p> <p>We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, LRV Health, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician, Specialty Pharmacy - Rockville, MD
description: <p>We're looking for an On-Site Certified Pharmacy Technician in Rockville, MD to help us make specialty medications more accessible and affordable for patients. Keep reading to learn more about the role, our team and why House Rx is the right next step in your career.&nbsp;</p> <h3>About the Role</h3> <p>As a pivotal member of the House Rx team, you will work closely with specialty care clinics and the House Rx team to improve the specialty pharmacy experience for patients and their caregivers. <span style="text-decoration: underline;">This is an on-site role at a specialty clinic in Rockville.&nbsp;</span></p> <h4>What You’ll Do</h4> <ul> <li>Complete prior authorizations</li> <li>Source financial assistance on behalf of patients</li> <li>Process pharmacy claims</li> <li>Coordinate medication dispensing and shipping</li> <li>Improve the patient experience by answering questions and requests</li> <li>Act as a liaison between the patient, their provider and the pharmacist</li> </ul> <h3>About You</h3> <ul> <li>You have mastered all the core pharmacy technician skills, such as processing claims and dispensing medications, and are ready to expand your career</li> <li>You are comfortable engaging with patients, providers, and all members of the care team both in-person and over the phone</li> <li>You have experience navigating specialty medication benefits investigation, prior authorization, and financial assistance</li> <li>You are excited about working in a start-up environment and helping to build workflows and processes from the ground up</li> <li>You enjoy learning new technologies and are proficient in some common pharmacy software systems (QS1, ComputerRx, PioneerRx, WAM, etc). Bonus points if you have worked in EMR systems (EPIC, Cerner, NextGen, etc) or specialty pharmacy systems (Therigy, Asembia1, ScriptMed, etc)</li> <li>You are familiar with specialty medications, including medications used in autoimmune, endocrinology, and oncology. Willingness to learn therapeutic areas you are not familiar with is great</li> <li>You are a creative problem solver interested in positively impacting each patient’s pharmacy experience</li> <li>You are an initiative taking individual contributor who can also promote teamwork and collaboration amongst colleagues</li> <li>Pharmacy technician, licensed practical nurse or similar licensure as may be required in the applicable state</li> <li>Technician registration or licensure in state of employment, national certification as CPhT is required</li> <li>You may have the opportunity to travel to our client sites 10-15% of the time&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Excited about the opportunity, but worried you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyway, and give us both the chance to find out.</span></p> <h3>&nbsp;</h3> <p>Expected Hourly Rate:&nbsp; $25/hr - $32/hr</p> <p><em>This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <h3><br>Why You Should Join Our Team</h3> <p>A career at House Rx offers the chance to work with a talented group of entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology builders who are passionate about improving specialty care and making it easier for patients to access the medication that they need.</p> <p>At House Rx, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected and have the opportunity to succeed. You'll find a culture that supports open communication, embracing failure as a learning opportunity, and always being open to new ideas—no matter how radical. We are a remote-first company, however some pharmacy operations roles require onsite clinic presence. We’re committed to creating a positive and collaborative culture to achieve our mission, all while supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between.</p> <p>In particular, we offer:</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Paid time off</li> <li>Generous parental leave&nbsp;</li> <li>Comprehensive healthcare, vision and dental benefits</li> <li>Competitive salary and equity stake</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character.</p>

title: Financial Navigator - Pittsburgh, PA
description: <p>We're looking for an On-Site Financial Navigator in Pittsburgh, PA to help us make specialty medications more accessible and affordable for patients. Keep reading to learn more about the role, our team and why House Rx is the right next step in your career.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>About the Role</strong></p> <p>As a pivotal member of the House Rx team, you will work closely with specialty care clinics and the House Rx team to improve the specialty pharmacy experience for specialty patients and their caregivers.&nbsp; This is an onsite role at an office location in Pittsburgh, PA.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong></p> <p>The Financial Navigator, Specialty Pharmacy is a critical member of the patient care team, responsible for ensuring that patients have access to the financial resources necessary to afford their specialty medications. This role acts as a liaison between patients, prescribers, pharmaceutical manufacturers, and insurance companies to identify and resolve financial barriers to treatment and coordinate financial support. The Financial Navigator will be an expert in the complex landscape of specialty pharmacy funding, including insurance benefits, patient assistance programs, grants, and co-pay foundations.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <p><strong>Patient Financial Advocacy:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Partner with patients and caregivers to understand financial needs and reduce barriers to treatment</li> <li>Conduct comprehensive financial needs assessments for new and existing specialty pharmacy patients.</li> <li>Assess insurance benefits, out-of-pocket costs, and eligibility for patient assistance programs, copay foundations, and grants</li> <li>Educate patients on their insurance benefits, including co-pays, deductibles, and out-of-pocket maximums.</li> <li>Assist patients in enrolling in appropriate financial assistance programs (e.g., manufacturer co-pay cards, foundation grants, patient assistance programs) and maintain timely follow-up to ensure continuity of care</li> </ul> <ul> <li><strong>Insurance and Prior Authorization:</strong></li> <ul> <li>Work closely with the prior authorization team to understand insurance denials and develop strategies for appeal.</li> <li>Verify patient insurance coverage and benefits for specialty drugs, identifying potential gaps in coverage.</li> <li>Collaborate with prescribers and their staff to gather necessary documentation for prior authorizations and appeals.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Program Management and Coordination:</strong></li> <ul> <li>Maintain an up-to-date knowledge base of all available manufacturer and non-profit patient assistance programs.</li> <li>Manage patient enrollment and re-enrollment in assistance programs, ensuring all paperwork and deadlines are met.</li> <li>Track and report on the status of patient assistance applications and financial support.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Operational and Administrative:</strong></li> <ul> <li>Document all patient interactions and financial information accurately in the pharmacy management system and/or electronic health record.</li> <li>Collaborate closely with House Rx operational and clinic teams to ensure patients start and stay on therapy with minimal disruption</li> <li>Generate reports on financial assistance outcomes, patient savings, and program utilization.</li> <li>Adhere to all HIPAA regulations and maintain patient confidentiality.</li> <li>Collaborate with the pharmacy team, billing department, and clinical staff to ensure a seamless patient experience.</li> </ul> </ul> <p><strong>About You</strong></p> <ul> <li>You are comfortable engaging with patients, providers, and all members of the care team both in-person and over the phone</li> <li>You have experience navigating specialty medication benefits investigation, prior authorization, and financial assistance</li> <li>You are excited about working in a start-up environment and helping to build workflows and processes from the ground up</li> <li>You enjoy learning new technologies and are proficient in some common pharmacy software systems (QS1, ComputerRx, PioneerRx, WAM, etc). Bonus points if you have worked in EMR systems (EPIC, Cerner, NextGen, etc) or specialty pharmacy systems (Therigy, Asembia1, ScriptMed, etc)</li> <li>You are familiar with specialty medications, including medications used in autoimmune, endocrinology, and oncology. Willingness to learn therapeutic areas you are not familiar with is great</li> <li>You are highly organized, detail-oriented, and a proactive problem solver interested in positively impacting each patient’s pharmacy experience</li> <li>You are an initiative taking individual contributor who can also promote teamwork and collaboration amongst colleagues&nbsp;</li> <li>You have experience in healthcare, pharmacy, patient access, or financial assistance navigation (specialty pharmacy experience strongly preferred)</li> <li>You have a strong understanding of health insurance, copay assistance, grants, and patient support programs</li> <li>You demonstrate empathy and communicate with excellence when working with patients and caregivers</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Education:</strong> Bachelor's degree preferred, preferably in a healthcare, finance, or business-related field. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.</li> <li><strong>Experience:</strong></li> <ul> <li>Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in a healthcare setting, with a strong preference for experience in a specialty pharmacy, hospital, or clinic.</li> <li>Proven experience in patient financial advocacy, medical billing, or insurance authorization.</li> <li>Demonstrated knowledge of the complex landscape of specialty drug funding, including manufacturer co-pay programs and non-profit foundations.</li> </ul> </ul> <p>Excited about the opportunity, but worried you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyway, and give us both the chance to find out.</p> <p>Expected Hourly Rate:&nbsp; $25/hr - $32/hr</p> <p><em>This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <p><strong>Why You Should Join Our Team</strong></p> <p>A career at House Rx offers the chance to work with a talented group of entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology builders who are passionate about improving specialty care and making it easier for patients to access the medication that they need.</p> <p>At House Rx, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected and have the opportunity to succeed. title: General Counsel
description: <p>We are a technology-driven specialty pharmacy startup focused on making specialty medications more accessible and affordable for patients while helping keep specialty practices independent. We combine clinical expertise with digital innovation to deliver a better specialty pharmacy experience. As we continue to scale, we are looking for a highly skilled&nbsp;<strong>General Counsel</strong> to help lead both the strategic and day-to-day execution of our legal and regulatory efforts.</p> <h3><strong>Position Summary</strong></h3> <p>The <strong>General Counsel </strong>will work closely with the executive team to manage a wide range of legal, regulatory, and compliance matters. This role will be hands-on, supporting operations, pharmacy compliance, commercial contracts, licensing, and data privacy, with a focus on ensuring the company operates within all applicable laws and industry standards.</p> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li><strong>Regulatory &amp; Pharmacy Compliance</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Provide guidance on all aspects of our operating model. Understand federal and state regulations related to pharmacy or physician dispensing</li> <li>Assist with monitoring and implementing compliance with laws and regulations from relevant agencies, including CMS, DEA, FDA, and state Boards of Pharmacy and Medicine</li> <li>Understand and advise on compliance with payor contracts</li> </ul> </ul> <ul> <li><strong>Legal Counsel &amp; Commercial Support</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Draft, review, and negotiate a broad range of agreements including service contracts, MSAs, vendor agreements, distribution and payer contracts, and NDAs.</li> <li>Support the legal review of new business models, patient support programs, and partnerships to ensure alignment with healthcare laws.</li> <li>Advise on data privacy and HIPAA compliance across platforms and services.<br><br></li> </ul> <li><strong>Corporate &amp; Operational Legal Support</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Assist with corporate governance, internal policies, and entity management.</li> <li>Support fundraising efforts by reviewing legal documents and conducting diligence.</li> <li>Advise on employment, vendor, and contractor matters as needed.<br><br></li> </ul> <li><strong>Risk Management &amp; Internal Processes</strong><strong><br></strong></li> <ul> <li>Help build and manage internal legal and compliance workflows, processes, and documentation.</li> <li>Conduct legal research and stay current with evolving healthcare regulations and digital health law.</li> <li>Participate in internal training and policy development on compliance and legal best practices.</li> </ul> </ul> <h3><strong>Qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>JD from an accredited law school; licensed to practice in at least one U.S. jurisdiction.</li> <li>12+ years of legal experience, with at least 3–5 years focused on healthcare &amp;/or pharmacy-related law.</li> <li>Strong working knowledge of HIPAA, pharmacy regulations, and healthcare compliance requirements.</li> <li>Experience in drafting and negotiating commercial contracts.</li> <li>Previous in-house legal experience in an Associate GC or GC capacity.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred Traits</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Familiarity with specialty pharmacy operations, PBMs, and drug distribution models.</li> <li>Comfortable working cross-functionally with pharmacy operations, product, and clinical teams.</li> <li>Highly organized, responsive, and solution-oriented.</li> <li>Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving startup environment. Support of healthcare startups preferred.</li> <li>West coast preferred.</li> </ul> <p>Excited about the opportunity, but worried you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyway, and give us both the chance to find out.</p> <p>Expected Full-Time Base Salary:&nbsp; $250,000+</p> <p><em>The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements including equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <p><strong><br>Why You Should Join Our Team</strong></p> <p>A career at House Rx offers the chance to work with a talented group of entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology builders who are passionate about improving specialty care and making it easier for patients to access the medication that they need.<br><br>At House Rx, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected and have the opportunity to succeed. You'll find a culture that supports open communication, embracing failure as a learning opportunity, and always being open to new ideas—no matter how radical. We’re committed to creating a positive and collaborative culture to achieve our mission, all while supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between.</p> <p>We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, LRV Health, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Senior Product Manager
description: <h2><strong>About us</strong></h2> <p>House Rx is on a mission to make specialty medications more affordable and accessible for patients suffering from chronic illnesses like cancer and autoimmune disorders. We provide clinics with specialized technology and support from pharmacists and care coordinators to dispense medication directly to their patients, known as medically integrated dispensing (MID). We are expanding our product team to help fuel our next phase of growth — keep reading to learn more about the role, our team, and why House Rx is the right next step in your career!</p> <h2><strong>About the role</strong></h2> <p>Built from the ground up by specialty pharmacists, physicians<strong>,</strong> and technologists, the House Rx platform enables all aspects of medically integrated dispensing — from prior authorization and financial counseling to fulfillment tools, scalable patient outreach, and real-time analytics. Integration with multiple EHR systems allows collaboration between physicians, pharmacists, and on the ground care teams to provide better, more efficient patient care.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager to contribute to the ongoing development, optimization and growth of this platform. We enable the care of thousands of patients every single day, and are growing exponentially - and we’re looking for an individual who is excited to support the rapid scaling and growth of our platform across multiple specialty areas and workflows.&nbsp;</p> <p>A PM in this role will collaborate most closely with our clinical operations, design, and engineering teams, though they will also work with stakeholders across the company as well as engage directly with our customers and our users. They will be responsible for identifying key problems within the platform that deserve our attention and investment, defining product solutions for these problems, and be accountable for meeting our customer &amp; end user needs, improving operational efficiencies, and driving business growth.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>We believe that our product managers are bastions of culture, engaging with empathy across the entire organization, with a focus on creative problem solving, not being bound by old playbooks, and a relentless focus on constantly iterating and improving themselves, their products, their teams, and the company as a whole. If this sounds like you, read on.</p> <h2><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Identify problems that deserve our investment and effectively articulate the problem, the impact on the business, and the level of investment this problem deserves. Collaborate with the rest of the Product, Engineering &amp; Design teams to develop the best roadmap for the business.&nbsp;</li> <li>Facilitate and drive action throughout the entire product development process:&nbsp; identifying a problem, collaborating with others to develop the simplest solution possible, documenting requirements, and driving clarity and context for the engineering team, culminating in a successful product launch.&nbsp;</li> <li>Empower your team to move fast and iterate quickly. Ensure that the engineering &amp; design teams you work with have the context they need to make quick decisions about the project as they go. Empower the team, fostering a culture of collaboration, continuous learning, and healthy debate and discussion.&nbsp;</li> <li>Be willing to go above and beyond. Our team is at the nexus of bringing together ideas and making them a reality, and that involves a relentless focus on quality and a personality that thrives on creating community, delivering value, and improving oneself.</li> <li>Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for ongoing innovation &amp; improvement. Our favorite podcasts are: <a href="https://www.outofpocket.health/podcasts">Out of Pocket</a>,&nbsp; <a href="https://relentlesshealthvalue.com/">Relentless Health Value</a> and <a href="https://www.acquired.fm/">Acquired</a>.&nbsp; We would love to hear yours!</li> <ul> <li>You can listen to our team talk a little bit about how we build product on the <a href="https://www.outofpocket.health/podcasts/how-house-rx-builds-product-denali-cahoon-mina-iskarous">Out of Pocket podcast here</a>.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> </ul> </ul> <h2><strong>About you</strong></h2> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in Product Management, working closely with engineering and design teams and managing cross functional stakeholders</li> <li>Experience working on pharmacy management systems, electronic health records (EHRs), or related healthcare software strongly preferred</li> <li>Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills</li> <li>An interest and willingness to bring together opposing viewpoints to facilitate healthy discussion and disagreements and work towards the most effective outcome</li> <li>Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills accessible and affordable for patients. Keep reading to learn more about the role, our team, and why House Rx is the right next step in your career.</li> </ul> <p>In particular, we offer:</p> <ul> <li>Flexible work hours and flexible paid time off</li> <li>Generous parental leave</li> <li>Comprehensive healthcare, vision and dental benefits</li> <li>Competitive salary and equity stake</li> </ul> <p>We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, LRV Health, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character.</p> <p>While a cover letter is optional, a note sharing your enthusiasm for House Rx and this role is highly insightful.</p> <p>Expected Full-Time Base Salary:&nbsp; $165,000-$190,000</p> <p><em>This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <p><strong>More About House Rx: Our Team, Work, and Culture</strong></p> <p>Here's our amazing PDE team that builds healthcare technology that matters:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Software Engineering:</strong> 10 engineers+ from early career to staff/architect level</li> <li><strong>Product &amp; Design:</strong> 3 product managers, 2 designers</li> <li><strong>Infrastructure:</strong> 2 IT specialists, 2 security engineers, 3 SREs</li> <li><strong>Quality &amp; Support:</strong> 3 QA engineers, 2 support specialists</li> </ul> <p>Together, we build and maintain impactful solutions through our pharmacy management system and data insights platform. These tools enable our internal teams, pharmacists, care coordinators, and clinical operations, to streamline medication access, while helping external healthcare providers and clinics deliver better patient care.</p> <p>💻 Our engineering work presents exciting technical challenges as we balance user-facing features with robust internal systems. We release updates daily, requiring thoughtful prioritization and technical excellence while maintaining high quality. This iterative approach means we're constantly innovating to deliver meaningful improvements to our healthcare platform.</p> <p>🎉 Our culture brings thoughtfulness to our daily work. You'll find us expressing ourselves through our extensive Slack emoji and GIF collection (seriously, it's impressive!), sharing gratitude circles on birthdays, and having conversations that range from foodie recommendations to discussions about AI tooling, developer experience, and architecture. While we take our mission seriously, we believe enjoying what you do and technical excellence go hand in hand.</p> <p>We're a fun, thoughtful, supportive, talented, and down-to-earth group focused on doing some of the best work of our lives. At the end of the day, we know software is built by people – and we're committed to taking care of both the people we work with and the patients whose lives we touch through our technology. We’re growing our team. There's no one else in the world like you, and hope you can join us for this ride! 🚀</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <h4>&nbsp;</h4> <p>&nbsp;</p>

description: <p>House Rx is on a mission to make specialty medications more accessible and affordable for patients. You'll find a culture that supports open communication, embracing failure as a learning opportunity, and always being open to new ideas—no matter how radical. We are a remote-first company, however some pharmacy operations roles require onsite clinic presence. We’re committed to creating a positive and collaborative culture to achieve our mission, all while supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between.</p> <p>In particular, we offer:</p> <ul> <li>15 days of PTO plus paid holidays&nbsp;</li> <li>Generous parental leave&nbsp;</li> <li>Comprehensive healthcare, vision and dental benefits</li> <li>401k match</li> <li>Competitive salary and equity stake</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Expected Full-Time Base Salary: $130,000 - $140,000</p> <p><em>This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements, equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p>

title: Sr. Pharmacy Program Manager (Remote, US)
description: <p>House Rx is on a mission to make specialty medications more affordable and accessible for patients suffering from chronic illnesses like cancer and autoimmune disorders. We provide clinics with specialized technology and support from pharmacists and care coordinators to dispense medication directly to their patients, known as medically integrated dispensing (MID). <br><br>This work will directly contribute to the company’s mission of making specialty medications affordable and accessible for patients— keep reading to learn more about the role, our team, and why House Rx is the right next step in your career! Applicants must be based in the United States.</p> <p><strong>About the role</strong><strong><br></strong><strong><br></strong>We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Sr. Program Manager to lead our customer initiatives by balancing three key responsibilities: Customer Success, Pharmacy Operational Management, and Financial Growth. This role requires expertise in building relationships, overseeing operations, and driving financial performance to ensure the success of our customer programs. This role will require travel to customer sites at least 50% of the time.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ol> <li><strong>Customer Success:</strong></li> <ul> <li><strong>Relationship Building:</strong> Establish and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with key stakeholders, including dispensers, clinic staff, financial personnel, providers, and executives. Your ability to connect with stakeholders at all levels is essential.</li> <li><strong>Effective Communication:</strong> Tailor communication to suit various audiences, ensuring clarity and alignment. From engaging with prior authorization staff on operational details to delivering strategic insights during Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs), your communication should be both clear and impactful.</li> <li><strong>Objection Handling:</strong> Proactively address concerns and objections raised by stakeholders. Utilize reassuring and confident communication techniques to advocate for our program and ensure satisfaction across all organizational levels.</li> <li><strong>Presentation Skills:</strong> Master the use of House Rx template decks, customizing them to meet specific customer needs. Ensure a polished presentation, adhering to professional standards both onsite and virtually.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Operational Management:</strong></li> <ul> <li><strong>Customer Advocacy:</strong> Serve as the voice of the customer in all internal discussions, effectively communicating their needs and expectations. Your insights should drive internal strategies and decisions.</li> <li><strong>Proactive Monitoring:</strong> Regularly monitor communication channels, task queues, and documentation to identify potential operational gaps before they impact customers. Aim for zero emergent escalations.</li> <li><strong>Issue Resolution:</strong> Distinguish between program-related and operational issues, addressing customer expectations independently when possible, and escalating Clin Ops-related concerns as needed. Take ownership of investigations and ensure swift resolutions.</li> <li><strong>Operational Alignment:</strong> Conduct bi-weekly operational reviews with internal teams, maintaining a high alignment score based on cross-functional feedback regarding clarity and execution.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Financial Growth:</strong></li> <ul> <li><strong>P&amp;L Management:</strong> Oversee the program’s Profit &amp; Loss statements, ensuring budgeted profitability targets are met or exceeded. Aim for a minimum of 5% above budgeted net profit margin across all live sites.</li> <li><strong>Revenue Generation:</strong> Identify and implement new growth initiatives, maintaining or launching at least two initiatives per customer each quarter to contribute to a 10% increase in program revenue year-over-year.</li> <li><strong>Customer Request Evaluation:</strong> Assess the financial and operational implications of customer requests, completing ROI analyses and presenting findings to stakeholders within three business days.</li> </ul> </ol> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Experience:</strong> 8+ years of experience with a minimum of 3-5 years in program management or a similar role, with a demonstrated track record of success in customer relations, operational management, and financial oversight.&nbsp; <strong>Experience/knowledge of the pharmacy space is required;</strong> specialty pharmacy experience preferred</li> <li><strong>Skills:</strong> Strong relationship-building and communication skills, with the ability to adapt communication styles to various audiences.</li> <li><strong>Analytical Abilities:</strong> Proficient in analyzing financial data and driving program growth through data-driven decision-making.</li> <li><strong>Operational Proficiency:</strong> Experience in operational oversight, with a focus on issue resolution and process improvement.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><em>Salary Range:&nbsp; $145,000 - $180,000</em></strong><strong><em><br></em></strong><em>This range represents the low and high end of the anticipated base salary/wage. The actual base salary/wage will depend on several factors, including experience, knowledge, and skills. Actual compensation packages may include other elements equity, paid time off and benefits.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Why You Should Join Our Team</strong></p> <p>A career at House Rx offers the chance to work with a talented group of entrepreneurs, healthcare professionals, and technology builders who are passionate about improving specialty care and making it easier for patients to access the medication that they need.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>At House Rx, we strive to build and maintain an environment where employees from all backgrounds are valued, respected and have the opportunity to succeed. You'll find a culture that supports open communication, embracing failure as a learning opportunity, and always being open to new ideas—no matter how radical. We are a remote-first company, however, some pharmacy operations roles require onsite clinic presence. We’re committed to creating a positive and collaborative culture to achieve our mission, all while supporting our team members in all aspects of their lives—at home, at work and everywhere in between.</p> <p>In particular, we offer:</p> <ul> <li>Flexible work hours and flexible paid time off</li> <li>Work remotely</li> <li>Generous parental leave</li> <li>Comprehensive healthcare, vision and dental benefits</li> <li>Competitive salary and equity stake</li> <li>We’re backed by forward-thinking investors committed to transforming healthcare, including Bessemer Venture Partners, First Round Capital, LRV Health, Khosla Ventures, Maverick Ventures, 1984.vc, and Character</li> </ul> <p><br><br></p>

title: Campaign Operations Manager
description: <p><strong>About PebblePost</strong></p> <p>PebblePost is a leading performance marketing company specializing in programmatic direct mail and CTV. Our proprietary technology leverages online and offline data to drive measurable, incremental outcomes at scale for the world’s top brands. With the ability to identify and reach nearly every U.S. household, and exclusive access to $100B+ in annual transactions and hundreds of billions of real-time intent signals, PebblePost delivers unparalleled precision, scale, and performance for marketing campaigns.</p> <p><strong>About the role&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>As a Campaign Operations Manager at PebblePost, you’ll own the end‑to‑end campaign lifecycle from building, launching, and optimizing campaigns while driving weekly pacing to deliver budgets in full. You’ll turn performance into clear insights and next steps, guide creative timelines/QA, and partner with a cross‑functional pod to hit goals and scale what works.</p> <p>You will report to the Senior Director of Customer Operations.</p> <p><strong>You will:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Own the end-to-end campaign operations lifecycle for Programmatic Direct Mail campaigns, providing platform guidance to brands and internal teams.</li> <li>Build and launch campaigns in the PebblePost Platform with Technical Account Managers, ensuring accurate setup, data hygiene, and QA prior to go-live.</li> <li>Serve as the platform SME, collaborating within a cross-functional pod (Brand Partnerships, Technical Account Management, Campaign Ops/Analytics) to align goals, define testing/measurement plans, optimize performance, and manage stakeholder communications</li> <li>Monitor campaign pacing so we deliver each brand’s budget in full.</li> <li>Deliver data-driven reporting and actionable recommendations to brand teams and the pod.</li> <li>Advise brands on creative timelines (proofing/approvals) and manage the creative workflow and QA so assets meet specs, are approved on time in full, and align with planned in‑home windows.</li> </ul> <p><strong>You have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>3+ years of ad operations or digital marketing experience supporting large mid-market and enterprise B2C brands</li> <li>Managed multiple enterprise campaigns at once with total deal values of at least $20M annually</li> <li>Set up campaigns on ad servers, managed creative assets, and configured targeting parameters</li> <li>Used analytics tools to monitor metrics like impressions, clicks, and conversions, making data-driven decisions to improve campaign performance and ROAS.&nbsp;</li> <li>Taken raw data from performance and other reports, communicated strategy and told a story to brands</li> <li>Scheduled ads according to campaign objectives and target audience, ensuring proper ad format and delivery</li> <li>Experience with Google Suite, Confluence, Monday.com and Salesforce</li> <li>Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university or equivalent experience</li> </ul> <p><strong>Our benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Remote-friendly team</li> <li>Unlimited PTO policy</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans</li> <li>Cell phone reimbursement program</li> <li>Flexible spending (FSA), health savings (HSA), and pre-tax commuter accounts</li> <li>Employee-based 401(k) program</li> <li>Additional voluntary benefit programs available such as life, critical illness, disability, employee assistance and additional buy-up options</li> </ul> <p><em>The salary range is a reasonable estimate based on aggregate data for all US locations. Any offered salary is determined by a wide range of factors including but not limited to; candidate location, cost of labor, market data/ranges, internal equity, internal salary ranges, applicant’s skills, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications (e.g. JD/technology, for example).</em></p> <p><em>Salary range: Low: $110,000 - High: $130,000</em></p> <p><em>PebblePost is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, religion, citizenship, national origin/ancestry, physical/mental disabilities, military status or any other basis prohibited by law.</em></p>

title: Director, Product Platform
description: <p><strong>About PebblePost</strong></p> <p>PebblePost is a leading performance marketing company specializing in programmatic direct mail and CTV. Our proprietary technology leverages online and offline data to drive measurable, incremental outcomes at scale for the world’s top brands. With the ability to identify and reach nearly every U.S. household, and exclusive access to $100B+ in annual transactions and hundreds of billions of real-time intent signals, PebblePost delivers unparalleled precision, scale, and performance for marketing campaigns.</p> <p><strong>About the role</strong></p> <p>The Director of Platform at PebblePost ensures our platform and channel extensions products build upon, remain innovative, effective, and responsive to market needs.&nbsp;</p> <p>You will own the automation strategy roadmap, and explore approaches to bring the value of PebblePost’s performance to all of our channels using GenAI and Large Language Models (LLM). You will help optimize a more intuitive, AI-curated platform that can scale to any target persona, bringing hyper-personalized audiences to sophisticated brands. This requires scaling agentic workflows and MCP servers that drive an API-first approach into an Agent-first methodology.</p> <p>This position reports to the SVP of Product.</p> <p><strong>You will:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead the construction of the PebblePost platform with focus on workflow automation to deliver performance to our Brands</li> <li>Discover “the why” in the marketplace that leads us to impactful, in-demand solutions&nbsp;</li> <li>Monitor and analyze product performance such as usage and user adoption, user feedback, and performance against market expectations</li> <li>Infuse AI into the PebblePost platform unlocking unique insights and driving value for our internal and external customers</li> <li>Identify areas for improvement and optimize existing products</li> <li>Help drive increased modularization of a legacy codebase to scale enhanced A/B testing</li> <li>Partner with Sales, Customer Operations, Marketing, Engineering and Data Science teams to gather input and communicate product updates&nbsp;</li> <li>Share the product vision and strategy to ensure alignment across the organization</li> <li>Manage the entire product lifecycle, from concept to end-of-life, ensuring our products continue to evolve</li> </ul> <p><strong>You have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>8+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a platform, infrastructure, or automation-focused role</li> <li>Worked at a SaaS, AdTech, MarTech, or data platform company</li> <li>Experience in building agentic workflows or supporting MCP server tooling projects</li> <li>Balanced technical depth with business strategy, meaning you can speak both “API” and “ROI.”</li> <li>Have design experience and led UX/UI best practices during implementation</li> <li>A proven track record of leading platform or API-based products that support multiple internal and external customers.</li> <li>Strong understanding of data pipelines, integrations, and automation technologies.</li> <li>Demonstrated experience building tooling, integrations and workflows in a platform to support performance products, prior experience with data platform integrations a plus (e.g. Salesforce, LiveIntent, Shopify, etc.)</li> <li>Used data to drive your decisions on product construction as well as product effectiveness, and have&nbsp; constructed data dashboards to continuously monitor performance and understand user behavior</li> <li>Communicated complex business cases for product expansion including market sizing, SWOT, and right-to-win to an audience spanning junior resources, non-technical teams and the C-Suite</li> </ul> <p><strong>Our benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Remote-friendly team</li> <li>Unlimited PTO policy</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans</li> <li>Cell phone reimbursement program</li> <li>Flexible spending (FSA), health savings (HSA), and pre-tax commuter accounts</li> <li>Employee-based 401(k) program</li> <li>Additional voluntary benefit programs available such as life, critical illness, disability, employee assistance and additional buy-up options</li> </ul> <p><em>The salary range is a reasonable estimate based on aggregate data for all US locations. title: Product Manager
description: <p><strong>About PebblePost</strong></p> <p>PebblePost is a leading performance marketing company specializing in programmatic direct mail and CTV. Our proprietary technology leverages online and offline data to drive measurable, incremental outcomes at scale for the world’s top brands. With the ability to identify and reach nearly every U.S. household, and exclusive access to $100B+ in annual transactions and hundreds of billions of real-time intent signals, PebblePost delivers unparalleled precision, scale, and performance for marketing campaigns.</p> <p><strong>About the role</strong></p> <p>The Product Manager for Performance Products is a hands-on, individual-contributor role focused on discovering customer problems, defining solutions, and shipping impactful features that drive measurable performance for brands. Focus areas include Retargeting, Lookalike Audiences, and Data Products, with close partnership across Sales, Engineering, Data Science, and Operations to align on priorities and deliver outcomes.</p> <p>You will contribute to and evolve PebblePost’s core data assets (including the PebblePost data graph) by translating market needs and customer insights into clear product requirements, collaborating internally, and iterating based on performance data and user feedback.</p> <p>This position reports to the Director of Product Management.</p> <p><strong>You will:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Help create and communicate a product roadmap that ensures the product vision aligns with PebblePost's mission and resonates with our brands</li> <li>Lead discovery for problem areas and features (user interviews, data deep-dives, and competitive analysis) to validate opportunities and define success metrics</li> <li>Write product requirements documents (PRDs), user stories, acceptability criteria, and partner with Engineering to translate requirements into JIRA tickets</li> <li>Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Customer Operations, and Finance to ensure go-to-market readiness, positioning, pricing inputs, and measurement plans.</li> <li>Track product performance and health (usage, feedback, KPIs), run experiments where appropriate, and iterate quickly based on learnings.</li> <li>Manage the backlog, drive sprint planning and scoping, and communicate release readiness and timelines to stakeholders.</li> <li>Contribute to go-to-market assets (enablement briefs, release notes, demos) and support internal readiness for launches.</li> <li>Uphold high standards of quality, documentation, and cross-functional communication throughout the product lifecycle.</li> </ul> <p><strong>You have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>3+ years of product management experience at a B2B SaaS or AdTech/MarTech company</li> <li>Owned end-to-end features from discovery through launch.</li> <li>Defined product strategy and success metrics to address user pain points, launching features that increased adoption and customer satisfaction while improving performance KPIs.</li> <li>Used product analytics and experimentation (A/B tests, funnel analysis) to prioritize roadmap investments, improving key performance metrics.&nbsp;</li> <li>Partnered with Engineering, Design, Sales, and Operations to define and deliver product priorities, aligning diverse stakeholders around shared goals without formal authority.</li> <li>Experience explaining complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders and translating insights into clear requirements.</li> <li>Familiarity with performance marketing concepts and data products (e.g., audiences, retargeting, lookalikes, measurement).</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Our benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Remote-friendly team</li> <li>Unlimited PTO policy</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans</li> <li>Cell phone reimbursement program</li> <li>Flexible spending (FSA), health savings (HSA), and pre-tax commuter accounts</li> <li>Employee-based 401(k) program</li> <li>Additional voluntary benefit programs available such as life, critical illness, disability, employee assistance and additional buy-up options</li> </ul> <p><em>The salary range is a reasonable estimate based on aggregate data for all US locations. Any offered salary is determined by a wide range of factors including but not limited to; candidate location, cost of labor, market data/ranges, internal equity, internal salary ranges, applicant’s skills, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications (e.g. JD/technology, for example).</em></p> <p><em>Salary range: Low: $140,000 - High: $170,000</em></p> <p><em>PebblePost is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, religion, citizenship, national origin/ancestry, physical/mental disabilities, military status or any other basis prohibited by law.</em></p>

title: Director of MSP Distribution
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet.&nbsp; In a world where our lives are increasingly online, Aura's category-defining suite of intelligent digital safety products help millions of customers protect themselves against digital threats, and that number is growing rapidly.&nbsp; This is an exciting phase at Aura, and our team of over 400 people worldwide is guided by a leadership slate that's successfully grown startups into multi-billion dollar organizations.&nbsp;</p> <p>Come build with us!</p></div><p><strong><strong>About the Role:</strong></strong></p> <p>We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Director of MSP Distribution to lead our channel partnerships and drive market growth. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of identifying, recruiting, and onboarding new Managed Service Provider (MSP) distribution partners. This role is crucial for expanding our market reach and successfully bringing new products to market through our distribution channels.</p> <p><strong><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></strong></p> <ul> <li> <p><strong>Partner Acquisition and Management:</strong> Identify, prospect, and sign new MSP distribution partners.</p> </li> <li> <p><strong>Go-to-Market Strategy:</strong> Develop and execute comprehensive go-to-market plans for new product launches, specifically tailored for the MSP channel.</p> </li> <li> <p><strong>Relationship Management:</strong> Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key stakeholders at distribution partners.</p> </li> <li> <p><strong>Performance Analysis:</strong> Track and analyze partner performance, providing regular reports to senior management on key metrics such as revenue, partner recruitment, and product adoption.</p> </li> <li> <p><strong>Sales and Marketing Collaboration:</strong><strong> </strong>Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to create and implement effective channel enablement programs, including training, marketing materials, and sales incentives.</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong><strong>Qualifications:</strong></strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (or equivalent experience).</p> </li> <li> <p>Minimum of 10+ years of experience in channel sales, business development, or a similar role within the technology or software industry.</p> </li> <li> <p>Demonstrable experience in signing up and managing MSP distribution partners.</p> </li> <li> <p>Proven ability to bring new products to market through indirect channels.</p> </li> <li> <p>Strong understanding of the MSP landscape, including their business models, pain points, and technology needs.</p> </li> <li> <p>Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills</p> </li> <li> <p>A passion for creating a safer internet and empowering families.</p> </li> </ul> <p>Aura offers a generous package to support our employees’ personal and professional lives. Our packages include competitive pay, health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave, and more! Pay for this role includes a competitive base rate plus commission; total compensation (base + commission) is estimated to be $250,000-$290,000, but may vary depending upon job related knowledge, skills, experience, location, and meeting sales metrics while in the role.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Aura is proud to be an equal employment workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, veteran status, or any protected category. Beyond equal employment opportunity, Aura is committed to being an inclusive community where all feel welcome.</p> <p>Aura is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. If you need accessibility assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please let your Talent Acquisition Partner know.</p> <p>Important privacy information for United States based job applicants can be found <a href="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/607724b2ae76e535db9552ff/665e1927dc08a53ebc12cc86_Privacy%20Policy%20-%20Aura%205_24.docx.pdf">here</a>.</p></div>

title: Regulatory and Product Compliance Specialist
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet.&nbsp; In a world where our lives are increasingly online, Aura's category-defining suite of intelligent digital safety products help millions of customers protect themselves against digital threats, and that number is growing rapidly.&nbsp; This is an exciting phase at Aura, and our team of over 400 people worldwide is guided by a leadership slate that's successfully grown startups into multi-billion dollar organizations.&nbsp;</p> <p>Come build with us!</p></div><p><strong>About the Role:</strong></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>As part of the medical team reporting to the Manager of Clinical Projects, with visibility to the Chief Medical Officer and General Counsel, this role serves 2 important functions: 1) to maintain strong regulatory and GCP compliance for all ongoing research initiatives within Aura; and 2) to coordinate and oversee the broader medical-legal-regulatory (MLR) review process for product development, marketing, and communications. As part of the research support function, the team member will manage all aspects of ongoing and new IRB submissions and correspondence. As part of the MLR coordination process, the team member will work cross-functionally to ensure that new materials (product messaging, marketing campaigns, scientific communications, press releases, etc.) are reviewed through the proper software systems and maintained in accordance with good practice. This part of the role will also help to conduct periodic internal reviews/audits to ensure all materials are up to date and compliant with guiding regulations. This is a unique opportunity to develop and implement processes to ensure ongoing research compliance and data quality/integrity that directly influences product development! If you are passionate about translating research discovery into practical application with broad reach, we hope to hear from you!</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>About the Team</strong></p> <p>You will join a mission-driven medical team focused on building best-in-class products to help parents and kids navigate the digital world safely. Partnering closely with cross-functional teams, you will play a critical role in setting clinical safety standards, ensuring health information quality, and maintaining compliance with all relevant regulations and guidance.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><strong>Responsibilities</strong></strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Manage all aspects of IRB, including ongoing reviews/amendments for existing protocols and preparation and submission of new protocols. Maintain correspondence with IRB in a timely fashion and communicate clearly with the rest of the study team.</p> </li> <li> <p>Develop and implement processes to monitor compliance with approved protocols; and to maintain and improve data quality and integrity</p> </li> <li> <p>Conduct internal audits to identify areas of non-compliance and develop corrective action plans. Create or update standard operating procedures (SOPs) to reflect regulatory changes.</p> </li> <li> <p>Develop and implement SOPs to govern the MLR process and ensure compliance across the organization; to ensure all claims and information are compliant with regulations</p> </li> <li> <p>Serve as a subject matter expert on regulatory requirements, providing strategic guidance to senior management and product development teams on regulatory requirements, helping to navigate the path from research and development to market entry.</p> </li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Psychology, Life Sciences, Chemistry, Biology, Pharmacy, Biomedical Engineering); Master’s degree in Regulatory Affairs, Public Health, or a related scientific discipline preferred.</p> </li> <li> <p>4–6 years of professional experience in a regulatory or related role within an academic or industry setting.</p> </li> <li> <p>Strong understanding of regulatory frameworks and guidance for health-related products and clinical research (e.g., FDA, FTC Health Products Compliance Guidance).</p> </li> <li> <p>Experience with product lifecycle management and quality systems (e.g., QMS).</p> </li> <li> <p>Exceptional attention to detail, organization, and documentation skills; proficiency with document management systems.</p> </li> <li> <p>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to interpret and apply complex regulations.</p> </li> <li> <p>Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving capabilities; able to effectively escalate issues and resolve conflicts.</p> </li> <li> <p>Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.</p> </li> <li> <p>Curious, adaptable, and innovative — with an interest in the intersection of technology use and well-being in children and adolescents.</p> </li> <li> <p>Willingness to travel 2–4 weeks per year for team meetings or collaboration.</p> </li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Aura is committed to offering a generous package to support our employees in all aspects of their life in and out of work. Our packages offer competitive pay, generous health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave and much more! Pay range for this position is $85,000-115,000, but may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>#LI-Remote</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Aura is proud to be an equal employment workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, veteran status, or any protected category. Beyond equal employment opportunity, Aura is committed to being an inclusive community where all feel welcome.</p> <p>Aura is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. If you need accessibility assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please let your Talent Acquisition Partner know.</p> <p>Important privacy information for United States based job applicants can be found <a href="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/607724b2ae76e535db9552ff/665e1927dc08a53ebc12cc86_Privacy%20Policy%20-%20Aura%205_24.docx.pdf">here</a>.</p></div>

title: Senior Software Engineer (AI Backend)
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet.&nbsp; In a world where our lives are increasingly online, Aura's category-defining suite of intelligent digital safety products help millions of customers protect themselves against digital threats, and that number is growing rapidly.&nbsp; This is an exciting phase at Aura, and our team of over 400 people worldwide is guided by a leadership slate that's successfully grown startups into multi-billion dollar organizations.&nbsp;</p> <p>Come build with us!</p></div><p><strong>About the Role:</strong></p> <p>We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer (AI Backend) to join our Apollo team. This role will focus on building and maintaining high-performance backend systems, integrating with AI-driven components, and managing infrastructure with infrastructure-as-code. The ideal candidate is a strong Python developer with experience working in cloud environments and a passion for building scalable, efficient systems.</p> <p><strong>Day to Day:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and enhance backend features, ensuring system reliability and scalability.</li> <li>Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and improve system performance.</li> <li>Manage infrastructure using Terraform and other infrastructure-as-code tools.</li> <li>Work closely with Git-based workflows, including code reviews and contributions.</li> <li><strong>Key Projects:</strong></li> <ul> <li>Integrating with<strong> LLM Agents</strong> and building features around them.</li> <li>Hosting and optimizing <strong>ML models</strong> to serve millions of requests per day.</li> <li>Processing and managing large-scale data efficiently, ensuring low-latency client access.</li> </ul> </ul> <p><strong>What you bring to the table:</strong></p> <ul> <li>4+ years of experience in software engineering or product engineering.</li> <li>Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Engineering or a related quantitative field</li> <li>Strong proficiency in Python for backend development.</li> <li>Experience with creating and evaluating AI Agents, using LLMs</li> <li>Background in Machine Learning and deploying ML models in production.</li> <li>Knowledge of AWS cloud services.</li> <li>Git-based workflows for development, including pull requests and code reviews.</li> </ul> <p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>It would be great if you also had:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with Databricks for large-scale data processing.</li> <li>Hands-on experience with Terraform for infrastructure management.</li> <li>Experience working with Linux, containers (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.), and cloud environments.</li> <li>Familiarity with GitHub Actions for CI/CD automation.</li> </ul> <p>Aura is committed to offering a generous package to support our employees in all aspects of their life in and out of work. Our packages offer competitive pay, generous health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave and much more! title: Senior Software Engineer, D2C Growth
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet.&nbsp; In a world where our lives are increasingly online, Aura's category-defining suite of intelligent digital safety products help millions of customers protect themselves against digital threats, and that number is growing rapidly.&nbsp; This is an exciting phase at Aura, and our team of over 400 people worldwide is guided by a leadership slate that's successfully grown startups into multi-billion dollar organizations.&nbsp;</p> <p>Come build with us!</p></div><p><strong>About the Role:</strong></p> <p>Aura's Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) Growth team is at the forefront of our mission, responsible for attracting, acquiring, and retaining new customers. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to be a technical leader for this team, driving the evolution of our customer acquisition channels and platforms.</p> <p>In this role, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of Aura's growth. You will lead the design and development of configurable, scalable systems that enable rapid experimentation and data-driven decision-making. You will be a key player in weaving personalization into the fabric of the customer journey, from their first interaction with Aura to finding the perfect plan to meet their needs. This is a high-impact role where you will not only be a technical leader but also a mentor to other engineers, raising the bar for technical excellence across the team. You will be responsible for decomposing complex problems into elegant solutions and ensuring our systems are resilient, scalable, and of the highest quality.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you bring to the table:</strong></p> <ul> <li>6-8+ years of professional software engineering experience</li> <li>2-3+ years of experience as the lead engineer on a team or on large projects</li> <li>Demonstrated success in delivering complex, large-scale projects on time and with quality</li> <li>Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.</li> <li>Expert knowledge of software design best practices, data structures, and algorithms</li> <li>In-depth knowledge of cloud technology and the ability to choose the right tool for the job is essential, such as serverless functions vs. containerized services; relational vs. NoSQL databases; appropriate use of caches and queues; etc.</li> <li>Demonstrated ability and desire to learn new technologies</li> <li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience</li> </ul> <p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>It would be great if you also had:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proficiency with the React stack stack, including Node.js, TypeScript, Redux, GraphQL, and related testing frameworks is highly desirable.</li> <li>Experience with Python and Databricks is a plus.</li> </ul> <p>Aura is committed to offering a generous package to support our employees in all aspects of their life in and out of work. Our packages offer competitive pay, generous health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave and much more! Pay range for this position is $150,000-200,000, but may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location.&nbsp;</p> <p>#LI-Remote</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Aura is proud to be an equal employment workplace. title: VP, Organic Growth
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet.&nbsp; In a world where our lives are increasingly online, Aura's category-defining suite of intelligent digital safety products help millions of customers protect themselves against digital threats, and that number is growing rapidly.&nbsp; This is an exciting phase at Aura, and our team of over 400 people worldwide is guided by a leadership slate that's successfully grown startups into multi-billion dollar organizations.&nbsp;</p> <p>Come build with us!</p></div><h2>&nbsp;</h2> <p>Aura is on a mission to create a safer internet for everyone. We are a leading digital security company that provides all-in-one online protection for individuals and families. As we continue to rapidly expand, we're seeking a visionary and results-driven VP, Organic Growth to lead our content strategy, social media, and SEO initiatives.</p> <p>This critical role will be responsible for defining and executing our organic growth roadmap, ensuring Aura remains at the forefront of how consumers discover, engage with, and trust our brand. The ideal candidate is a creative problem-solver, deeply "socially native," and thrives on understanding and leveraging the transformative impact of AI on consumer behavior and brand connection.</p> <p><strong><strong>What you'll do:</strong></strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Develop and champion a holistic organic growth strategy: Create a comprehensive roadmap that integrates content, social media, and SEO to maximize Aura's online visibility, drive qualified traffic, and enhance brand authority.</p> </li> <li> <p>Lead and mentor a high-performing team: Recruit, develop, and inspire a team of content creators, social media managers, and SEO specialists, fostering a culture of innovation, experimentation, and continuous improvement.</p> </li> <li> <p>Innovate our content strategy: Oversee the creation and distribution of compelling, high-quality content across various formats (e.g., blog posts, articles, videos, infographics, interactive tools) that educates, informs, and engages our target audience.</p> </li> <li> <p>Drive social media excellence: Develop and execute a dynamic social media strategy that leverages the unique strengths of each platform, builds a strong brand community, fosters authentic engagement, and drives measurable results.</p> </li> <li> <p>Optimize for search engine visibility: Lead our SEO efforts, ensuring our website and content are optimized for discoverability and ranking across key search engines, staying ahead of algorithm changes and industry best practices.</p> </li> <li> <p>Embrace AI's impact: Continuously explore and implement AI-powered tools and strategies to enhance content creation, personalize user experiences, optimize SEO performance, and gain deeper insights into consumer behavior.</p> </li> <li> <p>Analyze and iterate: Establish clear KPIs, track performance meticulously, and utilize data-driven insights to iterate on strategies, identify opportunities, and demonstrate ROI.</p> </li> <li> <p>Collaborate cross-functionally: Partner closely with product, marketing, and sales teams to ensure alignment of organic growth initiatives with overall business objectives and campaigns.</p> </li> <li> <p>Stay ahead of the curve: Continuously monitor industry trends, competitive landscapes, and emerging technologies in content, social media, and SEO to identify new opportunities and maintain Aura's leadership position.</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong><strong>What you'll bring:</strong></strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>10+ years of experience in digital marketing, with at least 5 years in a leadership role overseeing content, social media, and SEO for a high-growth company, preferably in the tech or consumer subscription space.</p> </li> <li> <p>Demonstrated track record of significantly increasing organic traffic, engagement, and conversions.</p> </li> <li> <p>Profound understanding of social media platforms and trends: You are genuinely "socially native" and instinctively understand how to communicate effectively and authentically across diverse social channels (e.g., TikTok, Instagram, YouTube, Facebook).</p> </li> <li> <p>Deep expertise in SEO best practices: You possess a strong command of technical SEO, content SEO, and link-building strategies, with a proven ability to drive organic rankings and visibility.</p> </li> <li> <p>Exceptional content strategy and editorial skills: You can define a compelling content narrative, understand audience needs, and guide the creation of impactful content across various formats.</p> </li> <li> <p>Strategic mindset with a bias for action: You can develop high-level strategies while also being hands-on and able to execute with precision.</p> </li> <li> <p>Creative problem-solver: You thrive on tackling complex challenges with innovative and data-informed solutions.</p> </li> <li> <p>Strong analytical skills: You are comfortable with data analysis, performance measurement, and utilizing insights to drive continuous improvement.</p> </li> <li> <p>Adaptability and a growth mindset: You are excited by the rapid evolution of digital marketing and eager to embrace new technologies, especially AI, to drive results.</p> </li> <li> <p>Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.</p> </li> <li> <p>Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field; MBA preferred.</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong><strong>Why Aura?</strong></strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Be part of a mission-driven company that's making a real difference in people's lives.</p> </li> <li> <p>Work with a talented, passionate, and supportive team.</p> </li> <li> <p>Opportunity to lead and significantly impact the growth of a rapidly scaling company.</p> </li> <li> <p>Competitive salary, equity, and benefits package.</p> </li> </ul> <p>If you are a strategic leader who is passionate about organic growth, deeply understands the evolving digital landscape, and is excited by the prospect of leveraging AI to connect with consumers, we encourage you to apply!</p> <p>Aura is committed to offering a generous package to support our employees in all aspects of their life in and out of work. Our packages offer competitive pay, generous health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave and much more! The base pay range for this position is $180,000 - $200,000, but may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>#LI-remote</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Aura is proud to be an equal employment workplace. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, veteran status, or any protected category.
