If you need accessibility assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability, please let your Talent Acquisition Partner know.</p> <p>Important privacy information for United States based job applicants can be found <a href="https://uploads-ssl.webflow.com/607724b2ae76e535db9552ff/665e1927dc08a53ebc12cc86_Privacy%20Policy%20-%20Aura%205_24.docx.pdf">here</a>.</p></div>

title: Audi Preowned Manager
description: <p>Your next opportunity awaits – Audi Beverly Hills, the #1 Audi dealership in the nation for 9 consecutive years is hiring a Preowned Sales Manager to join our team!&nbsp;</p> <p>The Preowned Sales Manager is responsible for optimizing sales and profitability while overseeing and managing the operations of our preowned vehicle department. The Preowned Sales Manager will play a crucial role in driving sales, achieving targets and ensuring an exceptional guest experience by providing leadership and effective business practices. This position requires a dynamic individual with a strong background in automotive sales and a passion for delivering an outstanding guest experience.</p> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Health insurance</li> <li>Dental insurance</li> <li>Vision insurance</li> <li>Paid time off</li> <li>401(k)</li> <li>401(k) matching</li> <li>Flexible spending account</li> <li>Professional development assistance</li> <li>Life insurance</li> <li>Employee assistance plan</li> <li>Disability insurance</li> </ul> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and implement sales strategies to increase sales of preowned vehicles.</li> <li>Manage inventory levels and pricing to maximize profitability.</li> <li>Hire, train and develop a team of automotive sales consultants.</li> <li>Collaborate with other departments to ensure a seamless customer experience.</li> <li>Direct and schedule the activities of department employees and monitor performance to ensure individual and department goals are achieved.</li> <li>Maintain appropriate levels of customer service and client retention by resolving customer complaints or concerns immediately and appropriately.</li> </ul> <p><strong><br>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>High School Diploma or equivalent</li> <li>Previous experience as a Preowned Manager - highline preferred</li> <li>Valid in-state driver’s license and clean driving record</li> </ul> <p><strong><br>Pay</strong>: $208,400 to $231,600 per year is the expected total annual earnings after factoring in all forms of compensation including salary, commissions, bonuses, benefits (vacation and sick), etc.&nbsp; Employees in this position will be paid a base annual salary of $60,000.&nbsp; Commissions are expected to range from $80,000 to $120,600 per year based on performance.&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Audi Beverly Hills, we attract, nurture, and retain the most talented people in the industry by providing the highest quality work environment where productivity, creativity, and personal and professional growth can flourish. We believe our team sits behind the wheel of the Fletcher Jones brand that drives our company toward success.</p> <p><em>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer</em></p> <p><a href="https://www.fletcherjones.com/careers/privacy-policy/" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a></p></div>

title: Automotive Sales Consultant
description: <p>At Audi Beverly Hills our mission is to deliver a world class guest experience through the pursuit of excellence. It is this journey, fueled by innovation and integrity, that has led us to be a part of the nation’s #1 family-owned automotive group.</p> <p>We are seeking an Automotive Sales Consultant as we continue to change the industry. The Sales Consultant is responsible for assisting customers to find the perfect vehicle that meets their needs and providing an exceptional guest experience through the sales process.</p> <p>If in your personal pursuit of excellence, you have developed a proven track record of consistently producing outstanding results through a commitment to continuous and never-ending improvement, join us. Your next opportunity awaits.</p> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Health insurance</li> <li>Dental insurance</li> <li>Vision insurance</li> <li>Paid time off</li> <li>401(k)</li> <li>401(k) matching</li> <li>Flexible spending account</li> <li>Professional development assistance</li> <li>Life insurance</li> <li>Employee assistance plan</li> <li>Disability insurance</li> </ul> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Engage with customers and exhibit consultative selling skills while assisting them in selecting a vehicle.</li> <li>Assist customers in making an informed purchasing decision by providing detailed product information including features and specifications</li> <li>Conduct vehicle demonstrations and test drives to showcase the unique features and benefits of different models</li> <li>Stay up-to-date on industry trends, new vehicle models and competitive offerings to effectively communicate product advantages to customers</li> <li>Build and maintain strong relationships with customers to ensure repeat business and referrals</li> <li>Demonstrate proficiency in using CRM software and other sales tools to manage customer interactions and track sales progress</li> <li>Maintain appropriate levels of customer service and client retention by resolving customer complaints or concerns immediately and appropriately; assume ownership of the customer's experience by carrying out those additional assignments that allow the dealership to leave a positive impression with the customer</li> </ul> <p><strong><br>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>Valid in-state driver’s license and clean driving record</li> <li>Previous experience in a sales role preferred</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay: </strong>$46,200 - $281,300 / year is the expected total annual earnings after factoring in all forms of compensation including hourly pay, commissions, overtime, benefits (vacation and sick), etc. Employees in this position will primarily be paid commissions, but they will also be paid minimum wage ($16.50/hr) for non-sales work and for rest periods. Commissions range from $38,800 to $202,800 per year based on performance.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Audi Beverly Hills, we attract, nurture, and retain the most talented people in the industry by providing the highest quality work environment where productivity, creativity, and personal and professional growth can flourish. We believe our team sits behind the wheel of the Fletcher Jones brand that drives our company toward success.</p> <p><em>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer</em></p> <p><a href="https://www.fletcherjones.com/careers/privacy-policy/" target="_blank">Privacy Policy</a></p></div>

title: Automotive Technician - Audi
description: <p>Your next opportunity awaits! Audi Beverly Hills, a leading automotive dealership, is seeking a skilled and experienced Automotive Technician to join our team. The Automotive Technician is responsible for diagnosing, repairing and maintaining vehicles to ensure optimal performance and customer satisfaction.</p> <p><strong>Automotive Technicians – we’ve got your covered! </strong>We offer free health insurance for you and your family, paid training, competitive hourly rates and a busy shop – maximize your productivity and maximize your earnings! &nbsp;<strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>We offer free health insurance for you and your family</li> <li>All training paid by Fletcher Jones to further your career</li> <li>Competitive hourly rates</li> <li>Ability to flag over 200 hours per month</li> <li>Supportive Shop Foreman and Team Leaders</li> </ul> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Health insurance</li> <li>Dental insurance</li> <li>Vision insurance</li> <li>Paid time off</li> <li>401(k)</li> <li>401(k) matching</li> <li>Flexible spending account</li> <li>Professional development assistance</li> <li>Life insurance</li> <li>Employee assistance plan</li> <li>Disability insurance</li> </ul> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Utilize diagnostic tools and equipment to accurately diagnose mechanical and electrical malfunction of vehicles and perform repairs.</li> <li>Accurately document record of all repairs, services and maintenance performed on vehicles in accordance with dealership and manufacturer standards.</li> <li>Collaborate with service team to ensure efficient workflow and timely completion of repairs.</li> <li>Perform maintenance and repairs with efficiency and in accordance with dealership and manufacturer standards.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>Valid driver’s license and clean driving record</li> <li>Degree or Certificate from a trade school preferred</li> <li>Previous experience as an automotive technician preferred</li> <li>Previous experience with highline a plus</li> </ul> <p><strong>Pay:&nbsp;</strong>$74,000 - $172,000 / year is the expected total annual earnings after factoring in all forms of compensation including hourly pay, bonuses, overtime, benefits (vacation and sick), etc.&nbsp; The hourly rate for this position is $33/hr.&nbsp; Bonuses range from $0 to $79,000 per year based on performance.&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Audi Beverly Hills, we attract, nurture, and retain the most talented people in the industry by providing the highest quality work environment where productivity, creativity, and personal and professional growth can flourish. title: *$2,000 Sign-on Bonus* Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)
description: <p>Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA)&nbsp;</p> <p>Shine with us at Sunrise ABA! At Sunrise, our commitment to ethical treatment is the heartbeat of our mission. Sunrise ABA opened its doors 2021with sights to provide ethical care while embracing new-age culture. In 2024, we provide center-based and in-home ABA therapy in California, Oregon, Washington, and Tennessee.</p> <ul> <li>Total Compensation: $95,000-$102,000 plus monthly bonus initiatives.&nbsp;</li> <li>Hybrid-remote opportunities. Maintain work/life balance with the flexibility of telehealth.&nbsp;</li> <li>Schedule flexibility and autonomy.&nbsp;</li> <li>Rise in your BCBA journey with our career path: BCBA - Senior BCBA - Lead BCBA - Area Director</li> <li>Full-time and part-time opportunities.</li> <li>No non-compete contracts.&nbsp;</li> <li>Paid Time Off: 21 paid days off in year 1: 15 days PTO plus 6 holidays. Sick time is available on a state-to-state basis.</li> <li>In-house CEUs</li> <li>Mentorship from industry-leading clinicians&nbsp;</li> <li>401K retirement plans with 4% match</li> <li>Medical, dental, and vision insurance.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Sunrise BCBA Responsibilities:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Providing case management for children on the autism spectrum ages 2-18.&nbsp;</li> <li>Data collection utilizing Central Reach.&nbsp;</li> <li>Billable hour requirements for full-time, salaried BCBAs: 30 hours&nbsp;</li> <li>Billable hour requirement for part-time BCBAs: 75% of total hours worked (preferred).&nbsp;</li> <li>Complete intake and assessments.&nbsp;</li> <li>Parent training.</li> <li>Collaboration with a team of clinicians and clinical directors.&nbsp;</li> <li>Mentorship for a team of RBTs, MLPs, and BCaBAs.</li> </ul> <p>Sunrise BCBA Qualifications:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification</li> <li>Master’s Degree</li> <li>High emphasis on integrity and ethics&nbsp;</li> <li>Passion for client success</li> <li>Strong leadership skills</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-size: 8pt;"><br>brace Competition - The Sunrise Way. 🌞</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="title">Salary </div><div class="pay-range"><span>$95,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$102,000 USD</span></div></div></div>

title: Behavior Technician (BT/RBT)
description: <p>Shine with us at Sunrise! Sunrise ABA is dedicated to providing high-quality, evidence-based Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Our mission is to empower individuals and their families through compassionate, individualized care that promotes meaningful progress and improves the quality of life.</p> <p>All are welcome to apply! Behavior Technicians at Sunrise ABA are responsible for implementing individualized ABA treatment plans under the direct supervision of a BCBA. The role involves working one-on-one with clients to deliver therapy sessions, collect data on client progress, and support the development of critical skills across various domains such as communication, social interaction, and adaptive behavior.</p> <p>Key Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Implement ABA treatment plans as designed and directed by the supervising BCBA.</li> <li>Conduct one-on-one therapy sessions with clients in home, school, and community settings.</li> <li>Utilize positive reinforcement and other ABA techniques to promote skill acquisition and behavior reduction.</li> <li>Accurately collect and record data on client progress during each session.</li> <li>Monitor and report changes in client behavior and progress to the supervising BCBA.</li> <li>Assist in the preparation of progress reports and attend team meetings to discuss client development.</li> <li>Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities.</li> <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of ABA principles and practices.</li> <li>Receive regular feedback and supervision from BCBA to ensure the highest quality of care.</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with clients' families and other team members to ensure consistency and generalization of skills across settings.</li> <li>Provide support and training to family members and caregivers as needed.</li> <li>Maintain professional and respectful communication with clients, families, and colleagues.</li> </ul> <p>Qualifications:</p> <ul> <li>High school diploma or equivalent required.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Education, or a related field preferred.</li> <li>Experience implementing ABA programs or working with children with special needs is a plus!</li> <li>Experience working with children preferred:&nbsp;</li> </ul> <ul> <li>A passion for working with children and helping them flourish required!&nbsp;</li> </ul> <ul> <li>An eagerness to be a part of a caring and team-oriented company culture.</li> </ul> <ul> <li>A deep commitment to show up everyday (which includes reliable transportation).</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Certifications: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification a plus.</li> <li>Skills:</li> <ul> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li> <li>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Patience, compassion, and a genuine desire to help others.</li> </ul> </ul> <p>Work Environment:</p> <ul> <li>Work is performed in various settings including client homes, schools, clinic, and community locations.</li> <li>May involve standing, walking, and engaging in physical activities with clients.</li> <li>Flexible hours may be required to meet client needs, but we also provide flexibility to meet your availability.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Benefits:</p> <ul> <li>Competitive compensation plus merit increases.&nbsp;</li> <li>Paid training and continuous support and education- start your career in ABA.</li> <li>Career development opportunities to Mid-level Supervisor, BCBA, and beyond!&nbsp;</li> <li>Schedule flexibility&nbsp;</li> <li>Health, dental, and vision insurance (for full-time employees).</li> <li>Supportive and collaborative work environment- we place a strong emphasis on our culture.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Sunrise ABA is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.</p> <p>#zip&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="title">Pay Rate </div><div class="pay-range"><span>$24</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$27 USD</span></div></div></div>

title: Behavior Technician (RBT/BT)
description: <p><strong>Behavior Technician</strong></p> <p>Shine with us at Sunrise! Sunrise ABA is dedicated to providing high-quality, evidence-based Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Our mission is to empower individuals and their families through compassionate, individualized care that promotes meaningful progress and improves the quality of life.</p> <p>All are welcome to apply! Behavior Technicians at Sunrise ABA are responsible for implementing individualized ABA treatment plans under the direct supervision of a BCBA. The role involves working one-on-one with clients to deliver therapy sessions, collect data on client progress, and support the development of critical skills across various domains such as communication, social interaction, and adaptive behavior.</p> <p>Key Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Implement ABA treatment plans as designed and directed by the supervising BCBA.</li> <li>Conduct one-on-one therapy sessions with clients in home, school, and community settings.</li> <li>Utilize positive reinforcement and other ABA techniques to promote skill acquisition and behavior reduction.</li> <li>Accurately collect and record data on client progress during each session.</li> <li>Monitor and report changes in client behavior and progress to the supervising BCBA.</li> <li>Assist in the preparation of progress reports and attend team meetings to discuss client development.</li> <li>Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities.</li> <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of ABA principles and practices.</li> <li>Receive regular feedback and supervision from BCBA to ensure the highest quality of care.</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with clients' families and other team members to ensure consistency and generalization of skills across settings.</li> <li>Provide support and training to family members and caregivers as needed.</li> <li>Maintain professional and respectful communication with clients, families, and colleagues.</li> </ul> <p>Qualifications:</p> <ul> <li>High school diploma or equivalent required.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Education, or a related field preferred.</li> <li>Must have valid Driver License</li> <li>Experience implementing ABA programs or working with children with special needs is a plus!</li> <li>Experience working with children preferred:&nbsp;</li> </ul> <ul> <li>A passion for working with children and helping them flourish required!&nbsp;</li> </ul> <ul> <li>An eagerness to be a part of a caring and team-oriented company culture.</li> </ul> <ul> <li>A deep commitment to show up everyday (which includes reliable transportation).</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Certifications: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification a plus.</li> <li>Skills:</li> <ul> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li> <li>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Patience, compassion, and a genuine desire to help others.</li> </ul> </ul> <p>Work Environment:</p> <ul> <li>Work is performed in various settings including client homes, schools, clinic, and community locations.</li> <li>May involve standing, walking, and engaging in physical activities with clients.</li> <li>Flexible hours may be required to meet client needs, but we also provide flexibility to meet your availability.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Benefits:</p> <ul> <li>Competitive compensation plus merit increases.&nbsp;</li> <li>Paid training and continuous support and education- start your career in ABA.</li> <li>Career development opportunities to Mid-level Supervisor, BCBA, and beyond!&nbsp;</li> <li>Schedule flexibility&nbsp;</li> <li>Health, dental, and vision insurance (for full-time employees).</li> <li>Supportive and collaborative work environment- we place a strong emphasis on our culture.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Sunrise ABA is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.</p> <p>#zip</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="title">Pay Rate </div><div class="pay-range"><span>$24</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$30 USD</span></div></div></div>

title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)
description: <p>Shine with us at Sunrise! Sunrise ABA is dedicated to providing high-quality, evidence-based Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy to children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Our mission is to empower individuals and their families through compassionate, individualized care that promotes meaningful progress and improves the quality of life.</p> <p>All are welcome to apply! Registered Behavior Technicians at Sunrise ABA are responsible for implementing individualized ABA treatment plans under the direct supervision of a BCBA. The role involves working one-on-one with clients to deliver therapy sessions, collect data on client progress, and support the development of critical skills across various domains such as communication, social interaction, and adaptive behavior.</p> <p>Key Responsibilities:</p> <ul> <li>Implement ABA treatment plans as designed and directed by the supervising BCBA.</li> <li>Conduct one-on-one therapy sessions with clients in home, school, and community settings.</li> <li>Utilize positive reinforcement and other ABA techniques to promote skill acquisition and behavior reduction.</li> <li>Accurately collect and record data on client progress during each session.</li> <li>Monitor and report changes in client behavior and progress to the supervising BCBA.</li> <li>Assist in the preparation of progress reports and attend team meetings to discuss client development.</li> <li>Participate in ongoing training and professional development opportunities.</li> <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of ABA principles and practices.</li> <li>Receive regular feedback and supervision from BCBA to ensure the highest quality of care.</li> <li>Collaborate effectively with clients' families and other team members to ensure consistency and generalization of skills across settings.</li> <li>Provide support and training to family members and caregivers as needed.</li> <li>Maintain professional and respectful communication with clients, families, and colleagues.</li> </ul> <p>Qualifications:</p> <ul> <li>High school diploma or equivalent required.</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree in Psychology, Education, or a related field preferred.</li> <li>Experience implementing ABA programs or working with children with special needs is a plus!</li> <li>Experience working with children preferred:&nbsp;</li> </ul> <ul> <li>A passion for working with children and helping them flourish required!&nbsp;</li> </ul> <ul> <li>An eagerness to be a part of a caring and team-oriented company culture.</li> </ul> <ul> <li>A deep commitment to show up everyday (which includes reliable transportation).</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Certifications: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) certification required.</li> <li>Skills:</li> <ul> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.</li> <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team.</li> <li>Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.</li> <li>Patience, compassion, and a genuine desire to help others.</li> </ul> </ul> <p>Work Environment:</p> <ul> <li>Work is performed in various settings including client homes, schools, clinic, and community locations.</li> <li>May involve standing, walking, and engaging in physical activities with clients.</li> <li>Flexible hours may be required to meet client needs, but we also provide flexibility to meet your availability.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Benefits:</p> <ul> <li>Competitive compensation plus merit increases.&nbsp;</li> <li>Paid training and continuous support and education- start your career in ABA.</li> <li>Career development opportunities to Mid-level Supervisor, BCBA, and beyond!&nbsp;</li> <li>Schedule flexibility&nbsp;</li> <li>Health, dental, and vision insurance (for full-time employees).</li> <li>Supportive and collaborative work environment- we place a strong emphasis on our culture.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Sunrise ABA is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.</p> <p>#zip&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="title">Pay Rate </div><div class="pay-range"><span>$24</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$30 USD</span></div></div></div>

title: 2025 Tax Manager
description: <p><u>About HBK&nbsp;</u></p> <p>HBK Capital Management is an alternative investment firm currently managing over $7.5 billion in assets.&nbsp; The firm was founded in 1991 and employs approximately 200 individuals in Dallas, New York, London, and Charlottesville.&nbsp; Among the top-rated and longest-tenured hedge funds in the world, we foster a refreshingly transparent and team-focused culture, low turnover, and a fun work environment.</p> <p>Exceptional people are central to the firm's success, and we are committed to hiring the best and brightest talent in all areas of our organization.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><u>Job Description</u></p> <p>HBK is seeking an exceptional Tax Manager to join our Tax team in Dallas, the firm’s headquarters.&nbsp; The Tax Manager is responsible for the tax compliance and consulting needs of HBK’s funds, management companies, and Managing Directors. This role offers the opportunity to join a highly visible team that plays a critical part in all aspects of the Tax function, including compliance, tax consulting, adherence to firm policies, relationship management, and continuous process improvement. HBK's flat organizational structure provides employees with the opportunity to grow beyond their current job scope.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><u>Job Responsibilities</u></p> <p>Working collaboratively with HBK’s Tax Director, the successful candidate’s responsibilities will include:</p> <ul> <li>Tax consulting related to fund investments - This includes understanding dividend, interest and capital gains tax rules and rates and other issues in various jurisdictions (U.S. and foreign), communicating with investment professionals, and developing and implementing appropriate structures</li> <li>Tax consulting related to HBK’s partners and management companies - This includes understanding federal, state, local and U.K. tax rules and issues relevant to the ownership and operation of HBK’s business, communicating with the firm’s partners and senior managers, and developing and implementing appropriate structures.</li> <li>Coordinate with Fund Accounting, Investor Accounting, and Financial Reporting to obtain data for tax return preparation</li> <li>Prepare U.S. and international tax returns for funds, management companies and partners</li> <li>Process tax depreciation for management companies</li> <li>Manage Form 1099 and Form 1042 reporting for funds and management companies</li> <li>Monitor ASC 740 tax exposure and preparing annual report for auditors</li> <li>Perform various special projects, including policy and procedure documentation and data analysis</li> <li>Collaborate with HBK’s development team to enhance tax systems</li> <li>Remain current on relevant tax issues through frequent communication with outside tax advisors</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><u>Required Job Skills</u></p> <ul> <li>Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field with a GPA 3.5 or higher</li> <li>CPA strongly preferred</li> <li>5-7 years of experience; prior experience with a Big 4 accounting firm required</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Strong analytical skills to grasp new concepts and solve problems efficiently</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to remain poised and confident when interacting with colleagues at all levels, including senior management</li> <li>Demonstrated initiative by analyzing situations, recommending alternatives, and implementing improved processes when necessary</li> <li>Effective time management and organization skills, with the ability to evaluate and prioritize multiple tasks and projects</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Sound judgment and the ability to apply firm policies while considering business needs</li> <li>High degree of curiosity and self-motivation to succeed</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><u>&nbsp;</u></p>

title: Executive Assistant
description: <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Executive Assistant – Dallas, TX</p> <p><strong><u>About HBK&nbsp;</u></strong></p> <p>HBK Capital Management is an alternative investment firm currently managing approximately $8 billion in assets. The firm was founded in 1991 and employs approximately 200 individuals in Dallas, New York, and London. Among the top-rated and longest-tenured hedge funds in the world, we have a refreshingly transparent and team-focused culture, low turnover, and a fun work environment.</p> <p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong></p> <p>Exceptional people have been central to the firm's success, and we strive to have the best and brightest individuals in all areas of our organization. HBK is searching for a well-rounded, collaborative, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to support senior executives in various areas of the firm.&nbsp;Executive Assistants within our firm are accustomed to having ownership over their work product and thrive in a fast-paced work environment. This person will play a key role in keeping business initiatives on track and organized, and will be a part of a team of highly valued Executive Assistants who embody our collaborative, dynamic, and engaging work environment, and support the firm’s day-to-day operations.</p> <p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong></p> <ul> <li>3+ years of experience</li> <li>Bachelor’s degree preferred</li> <li>Professional presence with a high degree of energy and enthusiasm</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a desire to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders</li> <li>Highly collaborative team player, with confidence to interact one-on-one with senior leaders and/or intermediaries when necessary</li> <li>Must be thoughtful and creative when needed – a “can do” attitude, with no task too big or too small</li> <li>Effectively and independently prioritize competing priorities, and appropriately assign urgency levels to various tasks</li> <li>Exceptional customer service focus, including attention to detail and producing quality results</li> <li>Proactive problem solver with high degree of resourcefulness and intellectual curiosity</li> <li>Must exhibit high degree of integrity and discretion as it relates to safeguarding confidential information</li> <li>Strong desire to embody HBK’s culture, and contribute to the organization's reputation and success</li> <li>Proficiency in MS Office, including Outlook and Excel</li> </ul>

title: Pilot Line Manager
description: <div class="content-intro"><p><strong>About Blue Current</strong></p> <p>Blue Current is the industry leader in the development of silicon solid state batteries. Free of flammable liquid electrolytes, Blue Current’s fully dry, inherently safe batteries significantly reduce risks to human and environmental health while providing a higher-performance alternative to traditional lithium ion batteries. Blue Current’s silicon-based platform is highly adaptable, enabling a cost-effective solution for both the mobility and stationary storage markets. Blue Current’s team works out of its state-of-the-art headquarters and pilot line facility in Hayward, CA. To learn more about Blue Current, Inc., visit <a href="https://bluecurrent.com/" target="_blank">https://bluecurrent.com/</a>.</p></div><p><strong>Description</strong><br>As a Pilot Line Manager, you will be focused on producing battery materials and building cells that deliver high energy density, safety, and manufacturability. The Manufacturing Tech Manager needs to manage pilot line technicians, plan and organize cell manufacturing based on the requirement. You will be spending your day leading and creating a supply of materials and/or building cells and then characterizing all to support Manufacturing and R&amp;D team. A background in chemical engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or any related field is preferred. This position will offer hands-on, fast paced work on a growing team that has a shared passion to change the energy storage landscape.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Manage manufacturing technician team for day-to-day activities to manufacture small and large format battery cells with manual and pilot line from raw material handling to battery formation and cell quality check</li> <li>Supporting prototype cell manufacturing, sample cell production and Process engineers’ development work</li> <li>Produce various battery components (powders, electrode, assembly)</li> <li>Create plan and schedule for manufacturing prototype battery components, cell and sample cells for customers</li> <li>Manage raw material, components inventory and create purchasing plan</li> <li>Characterize cell materials using with various analytical techniques (e.g. SEM, XRD, TGA, EIS and*CV)</li> <li>Provide feedback and discuss characterization results to understand the impact of material<strong>&nbsp;</strong>properties on cell performance</li> <li>Identify areas of improvement in process and machines, work with process engineering team to improve process capability</li> <li>Establish and maintain safety work environment and manage hazardous waste and parts cleaning areas working with EH&amp;S manager</li> <li>Implement 5S environment, maintain the organization and cleanliness of the laboratory spaces</li> <li>Perform frequent preventative maintenance and calibrations on equipment to maintain best operating conditions and functionality working with facility team</li> <li>Complete material documentation accurately and timely with detail</li> <li>Quickly adapt to constantly evolving processes of core technology while maintaining detailed notes and updated data sheets that reflect changes</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>Previous team management experience (5+ years or more)</li> <li>Experience working in an environment that requires strong attention to detail and precision</li> <li>Consistent and thorough documentation, and standard operating procedures</li> <li>Experience handling hazardous materials and waste management for lab space</li> <li>Ability to work in a dry room and a glove box for extended periods of time</li> <li>Ability to stand or sit for long periods of time and perform hand intensive repetitive tasks</li> <li>Above-average fine manual dexterity and visual acuity</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and experience working with team members to overcome technical challenges</li> <li>Clear written and verbal skills to logically communicate ideas and thought processes</li> <li>Appreciation for and adherence to lab and work safety policies</li> <li>Previous powder process and machine (Powder mixing, synthesis process, sieving, classification)</li> <li>And/or Previous roll to roll process and machine (slot die, gravure, comma coating, calendering, slitting) experience</li> <li>And/or Previous slurry mixing experience (Handling powder, solvent, handling various types of mixers)</li> <li>And/or battery cell assembly (Stamping, stacking, JR winding, ultrasonic welding, pouch sealing)</li> <li>Previous glovebox/dry room experience</li> <li>Previous chemical manufacturing experience</li> </ul> <p><strong>Preferred</strong></p> <ul> <li>BA/BS in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or similar field lab science</li> <li>Familiarity with analytical tools such as SEM, XRD, TGA, FTIR, DSC, and TGA</li> <li>5+ years of work experience in a fast-paced lab or manufacturing environment requiring high accuracy execution of processes or experiments</li> <li>Experience of working in a chemical laboratory and handling hazardous materials</li> <li>Basic knowledge about chemistry (understanding of difference between acid/base, meaning of pH, and awareness of those risks)</li> </ul> <p><strong>Job Type</strong> - Full-time</p> <p><strong>Schedule</strong> - Monday to Friday</p> <p><strong>Ability to commute/relocate</strong> - Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Blue Current is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and embraces diversity. We believe that our team is strengthened through hiring and retaining employees with diverse backgrounds, skill sets, ideas, and perspectives. We make hiring decisions based on merit and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex or gender (including pregnancy) gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran, disability status or any other protected category in accordance with applicable law.</p></div>

title: Principal Battery Design Engineer
description: <div class="content-intro"><p><strong>About Blue Current</strong></p> <p>Blue Current is the industry leader in the development of silicon solid state batteries. Free of flammable liquid electrolytes, Blue Current’s fully dry, inherently safe batteries significantly reduce risks to human and environmental health while providing a higher-performance alternative to traditional lithium ion batteries. Blue Current’s silicon-based platform is highly adaptable, enabling a cost-effective solution for both the mobility and stationary storage markets. Blue Current’s team works out of its state-of-the-art headquarters and pilot line facility in Hayward, CA. To learn more about Blue Current, Inc., visit <a href="https://bluecurrent.com/" target="_blank">https://bluecurrent.com/</a>.</p></div><p>Blue Current is a leader in the next wave of battery innovation. The company manufactures&nbsp;completely dry, safe and high-performance silicon elastic composite solid-state batteries to&nbsp;power the new energy economy including electric vehicles, grid storage and consumer&nbsp;electronics. Blue Current leads with science, data, and thoughtful IP across the full battery&nbsp;stack. We are hiring in all areas of battery design and manufacturing. Come build with us</p> <p>Are you an experienced automotive battery design cell engineering leader? Have you taken new&nbsp;battery designs from R&amp;D to large-scale production? Have you dreamt of being part of the&nbsp;shift to solid-state? Blue Current is an energy storage startup company focused on the next&nbsp;wave of innovation in the battery industry. We’ve developed a 100% dry, safe, and high-performance&nbsp;battery based on what we call “silicon elastic composite” technology. We are&nbsp;well-funded and connected across the supply chain and automotive industry.<br>&nbsp;<br><strong>What you’ll accomplish</strong><br>You’ll drive the overall battery technology platform and test plan as we move from R&amp;D to&nbsp;pilot and large-scale production. You will play a critical role in the design and development of cell pouches for advanced energy storage applications. This is a fast-paced hands-on leadership position with a&nbsp;team that has a shared passion to change the energy storage landscape.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities&nbsp;include the following:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design and optimize cell pouches for energy storage applications, considering factors such as performance, safety, and manufacturability.</li> <li>Select and evaluate materials for cell pouch construction, ensuring compatibility with the application requirements.</li> <li>Develop and design prototypes and conduct testing to validate the design, making improvements as necessary.</li> <li>Lead the cell engineering design, development, and qualification for next generation solid-state pouch batteries</li> <li>Own the cell design plans, design-of-experiments, failure analysis and new development pathways toward building cell products for consumer devices and EV applications</li> <li>Drive product development initiatives and lead technical cell engineering projects for first multi amp-hour cell designs</li> <li>Define and own cell design specifications, and test procedures for product validation</li> <li>Partner with materials R&amp;D and process engineering to select best formulations and<br>SOPs to meet performance and scalability goals</li> <li>Drive quarterly cadence of updates and stage gate transitions</li> <li>Internalize system design concepts (thermals, cell to pack) and compliance<br>requirements from customers</li> <li>Work with data analytics team to characterize and optimize performance</li> <li>Partner with manufacturing process engineering to ensure economics and scalability<br>of design</li> <li>Own and ensure alignment on bill of materials with product requirements (BOM)</li> </ul> <p><strong>Your experience and qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>Ph.D. or MS in chemistry, chemical or mechanical engineering, materials science, or<br>related field.</li> <li>5+ years work experience with pouch, prismatic or VDA compliant batteries for&nbsp;automotive and consumer applications; hands-on experience in scale-up/manufacturing environments preferred</li> <li>Proficiency in CAD software and simulation tools</li> <li>Strong understanding of lithium based cells, cell components and their interactions inside the cell</li> <li>Demonstrated experience on cell design, &nbsp;characterization and failure mode identifications</li> <li>Experience assembling battery cells and developing new electrode and electrolyte&nbsp;formulations.</li> <li>Experience working with high-speed battery manufacturing systems</li> <li>Track record of driving cell development roadmaps and customer-facing deliverables</li> <li>Appreciation for and adherence to lab and work safety policies</li> <li>Positive, can-do attitude and experience coaching and inspiring team to overcome&nbsp;technical challenges</li> <li>Creative thinker with attention to detail</li> <li>Strong communication skills and experience sharing results with team members and leadership</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Blue Current is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and embraces diversity. We believe that our team is strengthened through hiring and retaining employees with diverse backgrounds, skill sets, ideas, and perspectives. We make hiring decisions based on merit and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex or gender (including pregnancy) gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran, disability status or any other protected category in accordance with applicable law.</p></div>

title: R&D Technician
description: <div class="content-intro"><p><strong>About Blue Current</strong></p> <p>Blue Current is the industry leader in the development of silicon solid state batteries. Free of flammable liquid electrolytes, Blue Current’s fully dry, inherently safe batteries significantly reduce risks to human and environmental health while providing a higher-performance alternative to traditional lithium ion batteries. Blue Current’s silicon-based platform is highly adaptable, enabling a cost-effective solution for both the mobility and stationary storage markets. Blue Current’s team works out of its state-of-the-art headquarters and pilot line facility in Hayward, CA. To learn more about Blue Current, Inc., visit <a href="https://bluecurrent.com/" target="_blank">https://bluecurrent.com/</a>.</p></div><p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>Blue Current is seeking an experienced and talented R&amp;D Technician with a passion for batteries to join our team in Hayward, California. As a hands-on member of Blue Current’s R&amp;D team, you will be instrumental in developing next-generation solid state battery chemistries for high performance applications such as electric vehicles. The successful candidate will build and test prototype batteries in furtherance of Blue Current’s technology.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with team members to perform all tasks related to R&amp;D cell building and testing</li> <li>Follow recipes to create slurries for various battery formulations</li> <li>Coat slurries using a Dr blade or similar coating method</li> <li>Calender electrodes to target porosities, following instructions from engineers</li> <li>Assemble solid state cells according to work order instructions specifying certain material combinations to test</li> <li>Perform visual quality checks on coating quality, and take measurements to ensure various weights, voltages, dimensions, etc. are within specifications</li> <li>Enter measurement results into internal data portal, ensuring completeness and accuracy</li> <li>Assemble completed cells into test fixtures</li> <li>Place cells on test with specific test protocols, and with specific test channels as determined by the team.</li> <li>Monitor cell test status. Alert team members to tests with status changes such as errors, completion, and change orders.</li> <li>Perform electromechanical assembly tasks as needed, such as terminating cables and soldering wires</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>Minimum 5 years experience working in an R&amp;D environment</li> <li>Ability to work in a dry room and in gloveboxes for extended periods of time</li> <li>Ability to follow written SOPs and identify errors or clarity issues</li> <li>Working knowledge of Excel, Word, Google Sheet, Airtable, and similar software</li> <li>Strong interpersonal skills. Must be able to deal with a fast paced working environment with changing priorities and evolving assembly and test procedures</li> <li>Respect and adherence to lab and work safety policies</li> </ul> <p><strong>Physical Demands and Work Environment</strong></p> <ul> <li>Required to wear personal protective equipment when applicable.</li> <li>Able to pass a respirator fit test and wear a respirator periodically.</li> <li>Able to work in office, lab, and manufacturing environments with chemicals, moving mechanical parts, and electrical hazards.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Preferred </strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience working with battery assembly and/or testing</li> <li>Previous glovebox/dry room experience</li> <li>Experience assembling R&amp;D cells, including electrode punching, tab welding, alignment, taping, and quality control checks</li> <li>Previous chemical handling experience, including slurry mixing, coating, inventory management</li> </ul> <p><strong>Job type </strong>- full time</p> <p><strong>Schedule </strong>- Monday through Friday, day shift</p> <p><strong>Ability to commute/relocate</strong> - Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Blue Current is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and embraces diversity. We believe that our team is strengthened through hiring and retaining employees with diverse backgrounds, skill sets, ideas, and perspectives. We make hiring decisions based on merit and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex or gender (including pregnancy) gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran, disability status or any other protected category in accordance with applicable law.</p></div>

title: Senior Battery Scientist (Anode) Cell Engineering
description: <div class="content-intro"><p><strong>About Blue Current</strong></p> <p>Blue Current is the industry leader in the development of silicon solid state batteries. Free of flammable liquid electrolytes, Blue Current’s fully dry, inherently safe batteries significantly reduce risks to human and environmental health while providing a higher-performance alternative to traditional lithium ion batteries. Blue Current’s silicon-based platform is highly adaptable, enabling a cost-effective solution for both the mobility and stationary storage markets. Blue Current’s team works out of its state-of-the-art headquarters and pilot line facility in Hayward, CA. To learn more about Blue Current, Inc., visit <a href="https://bluecurrent.com/" target="_blank">https://bluecurrent.com/</a>.</p></div><p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>Are you a materials science and electrochemistry super star?&nbsp; Have you worked in the battery, fuel cell, solar, semiconductor, or other electronic materials industry?&nbsp; Are you hungry for a role where you will have an immediate impact across the company and in the industry?&nbsp; Batteries are the single most critical part of the new energy economy for EVs, grid storage, consumer and IoT.&nbsp; Blue Current has developed a solid-state solution that exceeds the best batteries in the industry.&nbsp; The company is well funded and has a deep IP portfolio with dozens of patents granted and pending.&nbsp; Now we need you to drive the next level of innovation in our cell development.</p> <p><strong>Description</strong></p> <p>As a Senior Battery Scientist, you will be focused on developing new solid state electrode materials with a specific focus on Blue Current’s composite silicon anode technology. &nbsp;A background in materials science, chemical engineering, chemistry, or a related field is preferred. &nbsp;Additional experience developing and silicon active material anodes is required.&nbsp; This position will offer hands-on, fast paced work on a growing team that has a shared passion to change the energy storage landscape.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and test composite solid state, silicon anode materials and formulations that improve cell performance and safety.</li> <li>Assemble solid state cells and perform electrochemical testing to analyze the impact of silicon active materials and electrode composition on cell performance.</li> <li>Characterize cell materials using various analytical (e.g. SEM, XRD, TGA, etc.) and electrochemical (e.g. EIS and CV) techniques.</li> <li>Analyze electrochemical testing and analytical characterization results to understand the impact of anode material properties on cell performance.</li> <li>Document and analyze experimental results. Present and share results with team members.</li> <li>Help set the technical direction for cell development and company technical strategy.</li> <li>Develop and submit intellectual property.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>PhD/MS in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, or similar field with a focus on batteries, capacitors, fuel cells, or other electrochemical devices</li> <li>Track record of peer-reviewed journal articles</li> <li>Experience testing silicon active materials and/or polymer materials for silicon anodes is required</li> <li>2+ years of experience working at an battery manufacturer or R&amp;D company is highly preferred</li> <li>Experience with electrochemical tests such as EIS, GITT, HPPC, CV, and others</li> <li>Familiarity and experience working with analytical tools such as SEM, XRD, TGA, FTIR, DSC, and TGA</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and experience working with team members to overcome technical challenges</li> <li>Appreciation for and adherence to lab and work safety policies</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Blue Current is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and embraces diversity. safety training and continuous improvement initiatives</li> <li>Maintain controlled atmosphere environments and inert gas handling systems required for solid-state processing</li> </ul> <p><strong>Documentation &amp; Reporting</strong></p> <ul> <li>Update equipment documentation, drawings, and standard operating procedures</li> <li>Track spare parts inventory and coordinate with procurement for equipment needs</li> <li>Provide technical input for equipment specifications and vendor evaluations</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p> <p><strong>Education &amp; Certifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>Associate degree in Mechanical Engineering Technology, Electrical Technology, or related technical field</li> <li>Technical certification from accredited trade school or equivalent military training</li> <li>Forklift and aerial lift certifications (or ability to obtain)</li> </ul> <p><strong>Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>8+ years of experience in manufacturing equipment maintenance, preferably in Li ion battery, all solid-state battery manufacturing, ceramics, or advanced materials industries</li> <li>Experience with automated manufacturing systems, PLCs, and industrial control systems</li> <li>Familiarity with powder handling systems, sintering processes, chemical material processes, Li ion battery manufacturing process including formation</li> </ul> <p><strong>Technical Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proficiency with hand tools, power tools, and precision measuring instruments</li> <li>Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, schematics, and P&amp;IDs</li> <li>Experience with predictive maintenance techniques (vibration analysis, thermography, oil analysis)</li> <li>Basic welding and fabrication skills preferred</li> </ul> <p><strong>Personal Attributes</strong></p> <ul> <li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills</li> <li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li> <li>Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written</li> <li>Flexibility to work various shifts and respond to emergency calls</li> </ul> <p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience in all solid-state battery manufacturing, advanced ceramics, or solid-state electrochemical processes</li> <li>Knowledge of Li ion battery and/or solid-state battery production equipment</li> <li>Familiarity with lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies</li> </ul> <p><strong>Working Conditions</strong></p> <ul> <li>Manufacturing environment with dry air, clean room, and inert gases</li> <li>Controlled atmosphere environment requiring appropriate PPE and specialized safety protocols</li> <li>Occasional work in confined spaces or at heights</li> <li>May require overtime, weekend work, and emergency response calls</li> <li>Shift work may be required to support 24/7 operations in the future</li> </ul> <p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full-time</p> <p><strong>Schedule: </strong>Monday to Friday</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div title: Senior Process Engineer
description: <div class="content-intro"><p><strong>About Blue Current</strong></p> <p>Blue Current is the industry leader in the development of silicon solid state batteries. Free of flammable liquid electrolytes, Blue Current’s fully dry, inherently safe batteries significantly reduce risks to human and environmental health while providing a higher-performance alternative to traditional lithium ion batteries. To learn more about Blue Current, Inc., visit <a href="https://bluecurrent.com/" target="_blank">https://bluecurrent.com/</a>.</p></div><p><strong>Summary</strong><br>Are you a process engineering super star? Have you worked in the battery, fuel cell, solar, electronic materials, pharmaceutical or other materials industries? Are you hungry for a role where you will have an immediate impact across the company and in the industry? Batteries are the single most critical part of the new energy economy for EVs, grid storage, consumer electronics and IoT. Blue Current has developed a solid- state battery solution that exceeds the best batteries in the industry. The company is well funded and has a deep<br>IP portfolio with dozens of patents granted and pending. Now we need you to drive the next level of innovation in our cell manufacturing process.</p> <p><strong>Description</strong><br>As a Process Engineer, you will be focused on developing formulation and coating processes for next generation separators for Blue Current’s solid-state batteries. A background in materials science, chemical engineering, chemistry, physics, or a related field is required. Additional experience in electrochemistry of lithium-ion batteries is a bonus. This is a hands-on, fast paced position with a team of scientists and engineers that have a shared passion to change the energy storage landscape.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop and test new materials, formulation, mixing and coating processes for separators that enable safe, high energy density solid-state Li-ion batteries.</li> <li>Characterize slurry and separator quality using rheological, mechanical, imaging and electrochemical techniques, and develop new characterization methods as needed.</li> <li>Collaborate with cell build teams for evaluating novel separator compositions and architectures in solid state cells. Analyze test results to understand the impact of separator properties on cell performance.</li> <li>Collaborate with the Advanced Manufacturing team for transferring mixing and coating processes to manufacturing equipment.</li> <li>Document and analyze experimental results, and present findings in team meetings and company-wide events.</li> <li>Develop and submit intellectual property.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>BS in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Chemistry, Mechanical Engineering or related fields. MS or PhD preferred.</li> <li>2+ years industry experience working with materials and process development in lithium-ion batteries, fuel cell, thin film or other related fields</li> <li>Experience with slurry mixing, coating and calendering equipment is preferred (e.g. planetary mixers, roll-to-roll coating, slot-die, comma blade, gravure, etc.)</li> <li>Experience with characterization methods such as rheometry, SEM, TGA and tensile/compression testing, electrochemical methods such as EIS and CV, and statistical analysis tools such as JMP or Minitab are preferred.</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and organizational skills and experience working with team members to overcome technical challenges</li> <li>Appreciation for and adherence to lab and work safety policies</li> </ul> <p><strong>Location - </strong>Hayward, California</p> <p><strong>Job Type -</strong> Full-time</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Blue Current is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and embraces diversity. We believe that our team is strengthened through hiring and retaining employees with diverse backgrounds, skill sets, ideas, and perspectives. We make hiring decisions based on merit and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex or gender (including pregnancy) gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran, disability status or any other protected category in accordance with applicable law.</p></div>

title: Director, Machine Learning
description: <p>At <a href="https://amperity.com/company" target="_blank">Amperity</a>, we’re an AI-first company helping the world’s leading brands create personalized customer experiences that build loyalty and fuel growth. Our AI-powered Customer Data Cloud,&nbsp; built on multi-patented technology, enables more than 400 <a href="https://amperity.com/customers" target="_blank">global brands</a>, including Alaska Airlines, Wyndham Hotels &amp; Resorts, and DICK’S Sporting Goods, to turn customer data into a competitive advantage.</p> <p>We unlock the full value of customer data with simplicity and speed. AI is at the core of our platform and the way we work — from powering advanced identity resolution and predictive analytics to streamlining internal workflows and decision-making. It’s not just a capability; it’s part of our DNA.</p> <p>Our team thrives on curiosity, collaboration, and transparency, fostering a culture where everyone can contribute, learn, and grow. We welcome talented individuals from diverse backgrounds to help us remove data bottlenecks, accelerate business impact, and push the boundaries of what AI can do for the world’s most innovative companies.</p> <p>With offices in Seattle, New York City, London, and Melbourne, you’ll join a fast-growing team tackling critical challenges at the intersection of AI, data, and customer experience. Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.</p> <h3><strong>The Role</strong></h3> <p>As Director of Machine Learning, you will lead the development, deployment, and optimization of machine learning systems that power Amperity's customer intelligence products. You'll guide innovation across our ML platform — scaling from applied research of new models to production deployment — while partnering with Product, Engineering, and Data Science to bring measurable impact for customers.You will report to the SVP, Engineering.</p> <p>You will:</p> <ul> <li>Lead a team of engineers and data scientists in building scalable, high-performance ML systems for customer data intelligence and personalization.</li> <li>Lead the architecture, design, and productionization of ML models across entity resolution, predictive modeling, personalization, and LLM-driven customer intelligence.</li> <li>Partner with Product and AI leadership to define the roadmap for ML capabilities embedded within Amperity's platform.</li> <li>Improve best practices for experimentation, model evaluation, and continuous improvement of deployed models in production environments.</li> <li>Champion MLOps excellence — ensuring model reliability, reproducibility, and maintainability.</li> <li>Collaborate to deliver new features and capabilities that use ML to enhance customer experience and outcomes.</li> <li>Develop a team of engineers and applied ML practitioners, promoting a culture of technical thoughtfulness and curiosity.</li> <li>Contribute to Amperity's external expertise through publications, talks, and collaboration with academic or industry research partners.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Interesting Problems</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Production-scaled entity resolution and probabilistic record linking.</li> <li>Predictive modeling for PCLV, product affinity, and channel optimization.</li> <li>Generative and retrieval-augmented systems for customer intelligence.</li> <li>LLM-powered interfaces for democratized data access and insight generation.</li> <li>Reinforcement learning for campaign optimization.</li> <li>Privacy-preserving machine learning techniques such as federated learning and differential privacy.</li> <li>Real-time personalization and recommendation serving at scale.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>About You</strong></h3> <ul> <li>You have 15+ years of experience in data science or machine learning, including the integration of data science capabilities into a scalable customer-centric product experience.</li> <li>You have experience mentoring other data scientists to achieve high levels of success, or you have previous management experience.</li> <li>You excel at leading and operating in complex, cross-functional organizations where your teams must collaborate and integrate with others.</li> <li>Deep understanding and demonstrated experience with data science tools, including Python, SQL, PySpark, scikit-learn, and cloud platforms of AWS, Azure, and/or Google Cloud.</li> <li>Experience in defining and building KPIs that measure business and product outcomes, providing updates to senior leadership on a regular cadence.</li> <li>Experience translating data science initiatives into revenue opportunities for C-suite executives.</li> <li>Advanced degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or related field.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Location</strong></h3> <p><strong>Seattle, WA&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Our hybrid work model includes three days in the office each week, providing a mix of in-person collaboration and remote flexibility</p> <h3><strong>Compensation</strong></h3> <p><strong>Base Salary:&nbsp; $200,000-$275,000. </strong>Within our pay range, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications such as skills, experience, and education/training.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Cash Incentives: </strong>Cash incentives are also available.</p> <p><strong>Stock Options:&nbsp; </strong>The opportunity for ownership is an exciting part of Amperity’s total compensation package. Every employee at Amperity receives a new-hire equity grant, commensurate with the scope of their position.</p> <h3><strong>Benefits</strong></h3> <p>We offer all the benefits you'd expect from a great place to work: 100% employee healthcare coverage, transportation subsidies, a comfortable work environment with plenty of snacks, and other employee experience perks like events and activities, both in-person and remote. We also offer self-managed PTO and the flexibility to do your best work in the way that works for you. We provide an inclusive environment where you'll be challenged to find and unlock your full potential, surrounded by a team of world-class people driving for excellence. For more details on our benefits, please see our<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jd5O27HxNE1AbAQu8jeQyC7aR1vWQHud/view" target="_blank"> US Benefits &amp; Perks Guide</a>.</p> <p>Amperity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and reproductive health choices), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as someone with a disability, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.</p>

title: Enterprise Architect
locationName: New York, NY; Remote; Seattle, WA

title: General Manager, ChuckData - PLG
description: <p>At <a href="https://amperity.com/company" target="_blank">Amperity</a>, we’re an AI-first company helping the world’s leading brands create personalized customer experiences that build loyalty and fuel growth. Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.</p> <h3><strong>The Role</strong></h3> <p>We're looking for a General Manager to lead ChuckData's growth as a business, a product, and a community. This is a broad, entrepreneurial leadership role with accountability for strategy, and results. You will lead the P&amp;L, define the vision, orchestrate product and go-to-market understanding, and build a high-performing team.</p> <p><strong>This is a coach/player role:</strong> you'll balance hands-on execution with strategic leadership. Expect to roll up your sleeves on product, growth campaigns, and community engagement, while also guiding the long-term business trajectory. You'll chart the path from technology preview to scaled business.</p> <p>You will report directly to the Chief Product Officer (CPO) of Amperity and will collaborate with peers across Amperity's product portfolio.</p> <p><strong><em>Why this role?</em></strong></p> <ul> <li>Rare opportunity to manage and scale a PLG incubation inside Amperity with both freedom and backing.</li> <li>Shape the future of customer data engineering and help ignite a global community.</li> <li>High-visibility role with influence across industry partners, developer communities, analysts, and the Amperity leadership team.</li> <li>Work at the intersection of product, community, and business — building something that can redefine an industry.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Interesting Problems</strong></h3> <ul> <li><strong>Business &amp; Community Leadership</strong></li> <ul> <li>Guide product strategy in close partnership with engineering and product management.</li> <li>Ensure ChuckData meets the needs of data engineers across AWS, Azure, and GCP, integrating with Amperity CDC and the broader ecosystem.</li> <li>Cultivate and amplify ChuckData's community presence — building trust, advocacy, and developer-first adoption.</li> <li>Translate community insights and market feedback into differentiated product value.</li> </ul> <li><strong>Go-to-Market &amp; Culture</strong></li> <ul> <li>Recruit, lead, and inspire a cross-functional team (product, engineering, DevRel, GTM).</li> <li>Foster a culture of bold experimentation, rapid iteration, and continuous learning &amp; adaptation.</li> <li>Be the visible face of ChuckData with external stakeholders — from developer forums to industry events to analyst briefings to investor updates.</li> <li>Create clarity, alignment, and accountability across a fast-moving, ambiguous environment.</li> <li>Balance strategic leadership with hands-on execution.</li> </ul> </ul> <h3><strong>About You</strong></h3> <ul> <li>15+ years of progressive leadership experience across product, go-to-market, and general management roles.</li> <li>5+ years of managing managers and high-level performing IC's.</li> <li>Expertise in building and scaling PLG businesses in developer tools, data platforms, or AI.</li> <li>Experience overseeing a P&amp;L, business strategy, and end-to-end execution.</li> <li>Experience with data engineering and developer ecosystems.</li> <li>Familiarity with MarTech/AdTech landscapes is a bonus.</li> <li>Credible with industry analysts and experience in building market narratives and thought leadership.</li> <li>Exceptional storyteller and communicator, with influence across executives, engineers, and developer communities.</li> <li>Entrepreneurial builder mindset: excels in ambiguity, embraces risk, and converts setbacks into momentum.</li> <li>Experience building high-performing teams and fostering a culture of experimentation and bold bets.</li> <li>Hands-on operator who excels in a coach/player role.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Location</strong></h3> <p><strong>Seattle, WA&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Our hybrid work model includes three days in the office each week, providing a mix of in-person collaboration and remote flexibility</p> <h3><strong>Compensation</strong></h3> <p><strong>Base Salary:&nbsp; $200,000-$270,000. </strong>Within our pay range, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications such as skills, experience, and education/training.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Cash Incentives: </strong>Cash incentives are also available.</p> <p><strong>Stock Options:&nbsp; </strong>The opportunity for ownership is an exciting part of Amperity’s total compensation package. Every employee at Amperity receives a new-hire equity grant, commensurate with the scope of their position.</p> <h3><strong>Benefits</strong></h3> <p>We offer all the benefits you'd expect from a great place to work: 100% employee healthcare coverage, transportation subsidies, a comfortable work environment with plenty of snacks, and other employee experience perks like events and activities, both in-person and remote.
