description: <p>At <a href="https://amperity.com/company" target="_blank">Amperity</a>, we’re an AI-first company helping the world’s leading brands create personalized customer experiences that build loyalty and fuel growth. Our AI-powered Customer Data Cloud,&nbsp; built on multi-patented technology, enables more than 400 <a href="https://amperity.com/customers" target="_blank">global brands</a>, including Alaska Airlines, Wyndham Hotels &amp; Resorts, and DICK’S Sporting Goods, to turn customer data into a competitive advantage.</p> <p>We unlock the full value of customer data with simplicity and speed. AI is at the core of our platform and the way we work — from powering advanced identity resolution and predictive analytics to streamlining internal workflows and decision-making. It’s not just a capability; it’s part of our DNA.</p> <p>Our team thrives on curiosity, collaboration, and transparency, fostering a culture where everyone can contribute, learn, and grow. We welcome talented individuals from diverse backgrounds to help us remove data bottlenecks, accelerate business impact, and push the boundaries of what AI can do for the world’s most innovative companies.</p> <p>With offices in Seattle, New York City, London, and Melbourne, you’ll join a fast-growing team tackling critical challenges at the intersection of AI, data, and customer experience. Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.</p> <h3><strong>The Role</strong></h3> <p>As a Senior Sales Director at Amperity, you will collaborate with motivated strike teams of internal technical &amp; business strategists in pursuit of driving significant new business growth. This role is tailored for an accomplished enterprise seller with a strong background in technical selling who can effectively bridge business and technology, delivering compelling solutions to complex client needs. You will play an integral role in Amperity's growth by ensuring predictable revenue attainment and market penetration with Amperity's suite of products. Additionally, you'll play an instrumental role in Amperity's growth strategy, influencing areas such as process improvements, go-to-market approaches, messaging, and collaboration across teams.</p> <h3><strong>Interesting Problems</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Drive pipeline and outbound prospecting as primary activities, setting strategies to create and expand opportunities within target accounts.</li> <li>Construct, forecast, and manage sales activities and pipeline to achieve revenue targets and support company growth goals.</li> <li>Define and execute Amperity's sales plan for your named accounts, proactively seeking out and cultivating new client relationships.</li> <li>Commitment to understanding client needs and challenges to build aligned customer-focused solutions with a consultative approach.</li> <li>Regularly communicate traction, friction, and insights from the field to enhance customer engagement and advance deals.</li> <li>Leverage CRM tools (e.g. Salesforce) to manage daily and weekly sales activities, pipeline management, and forecasting to ensure consistent, above-quota performance.</li> <li>Partner closely with cross-functional teams (marketing, pre-sales, product, professional services, finance, and legal) to create a seamless customer experience.</li> <li>Maintain up-to-date knowledge of relevant industry trends and competitive landscape.</li> <li>Actively drive conversations and collaborate with ecosystem partners, systems Integrators (Deloitte, Slalom, Accenture, etc), Clouds (Microsoft, AWS, Google) and ISVs (Databricks, Snowflake, Braze, etc) to expand pipeline opportunities and enhance the effectiveness of sales efforts within target accounts.</li> <li>Actively engage in client interactions, especially at the executive level, and support contract negotiations and deal execution as needed while ensuring to balance customer needs with company goals.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>About You</strong></h3> <ul> <li>8-12 years of experience in technical sales, with a deep focus on data platforms, ideally within a SaaS or technology-driven organization.</li> <li>Expertise in driving revenue growth and exceeding sales targets in complex sales cycels, particularly in data infrastructure, analytics, and AI-driven solutions.</li> <li>Expertise in technical sales methodologies, including solution selling, consultative sales, and architecting customized data platform solutions for enterprise clients.</li> <li>Experience digging into prospects' pain points and validating the issues they're facing with technical and business stakeholders at all levels, particularly C-suite and data-driven executives, by translating complex data capabilities into actionable business outcomes.</li> <li>Deep technical understanding of modern data architectures, cloud-based data platforms, data lakes, ETL/ELT processes, data warehousing, and advanced analytics tools, including AI/ML capabilities.</li> <li>Experience communicating product benefits appropriate for each prospect, including the value of data platforms to both technical and non-technical audiences through detailed product demonstrations, technical deep dives, and high-level strategic discussions.</li> <li>Strategic in positioning Amperity as the leading data platform solution for tech teams, fostering relationships that lead to transformative data-driven initiatives and long-term client success.</li> <li>Ability to travel 25%for prospective client meetings, conferences, and company meetings.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Benefits</strong></h3> <p>We offer all the benefits you’d expect from a great place to work: 100% healthcare coverage, 28 days of Annual Leave (inclusive of the usual public holidays in England and Wales), a communications stipend, and the flexibility to do your best work in a modern, comfortable working space. We provide an inclusive environment where you’ll be challenged to find and unlock your full potential, surrounded by a team of world-class people driving for excellence.&nbsp;</p> <p>Amperity values diversity. We are an equal opportunities employer and do not discriminate on the grounds of gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, gender reassignment, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, disability or age.</p>

title: Senior Solutions Delivery Manager
description: <p>At <a href="https://amperity.com/company" target="_blank">Amperity</a>, we’re an AI-first company helping the world’s leading brands create personalized customer experiences that build loyalty and fuel growth. Our AI-powered Customer Data Cloud,&nbsp; built on multi-patented technology, enables more than 400 <a href="https://amperity.com/customers" target="_blank">global brands</a>, including Alaska Airlines, Wyndham Hotels &amp; Resorts, and DICK’S Sporting Goods, to turn customer data into a competitive advantage.</p> <p>We unlock the full value of customer data with simplicity and speed. AI is at the core of our platform and the way we work — from powering advanced identity resolution and predictive analytics to streamlining internal workflows and decision-making. It’s not just a capability; it’s part of our DNA.</p> <p>Our team thrives on curiosity, collaboration, and transparency, fostering a culture where everyone can contribute, learn, and grow. We welcome talented individuals from diverse backgrounds to help us remove data bottlenecks, accelerate business impact, and push the boundaries of what AI can do for the world’s most innovative companies.</p> <p>With offices in Seattle, New York City, London, and Melbourne, you’ll join a fast-growing team tackling critical challenges at the intersection of AI, data, and customer experience. Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.</p> <h3><strong>The Role</strong></h3> <p>As a Solutions Delivery Manager,&nbsp; you will own the success of the customer journey from the closure of the sales process, to the launch of customer use cases within the platform, ensuring a durable, user-friendly, and maintainable outcome for the solution.&nbsp;</p> <p>The primary objective of this role is to provide the oversight and management required to ensure a successful, on-time, and within-budget implementation that meets the objectives of the engagement. Your skillset will include; the ability to communicate openly and effectively with audiences of all seniority levels, understand and speak to higher level technical topics, demonstrated experience&nbsp; project managing large-scale and complex SaaS implementations at Fortune 500 companies with appropriate rigor, and in collaboration with internal and external partners to ensure successful outcomes.</p> <p>You will be engaging with the customer and Amperity teams on the day-to-day management of the deployment as well as providing a communication channel &amp; guidance with customer and Amperity executive steering committees. This regular stream of communication will be sponsored by your ability to evaluate risk, promote benefit, manage expectations, and control implementation scope.</p> <h3><strong>Interesting Problems</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Support scoping &amp; discovery sessions with clients to understand requirements and document accordingly in a statement of work</li> <li>Project manage multiple, concurrent implementations varying in duration and complexity</li> <li>Manage resources across both Amperity local &amp; global teams, plus work with local System Integrators and partners</li> <li>Drive customer and internal teams to timely and on-budget completion with appropriately managed project scope</li> <li>Coordinate and prioritise project tasks, manage timelines, maintain project plans, and communicate status to clients, project sponsors, and senior management</li> <li>Own connecting the dots between the right resources (executive and technical) and the right problems, directly participating, and ensuring the teams are empowered to deliver the best possible outcomes</li> <li>Anticipate, mitigate, and communicate project risk to deliverables, their dates, and impact on implementation success</li> <li>Understand the client from a practitioner’s perspective - what does their day look like, what systems and technologies do they use, what are their pain points, how can Amperity’s solution drive the most meaningful results</li> <li>Be curious about your customers from a business and strategic perspective - get to know their business, their industry, and develop an understanding of Amperity’s value proposition within this context to deliver the best possible consultative experience</li> <li>Be passionate about continuing to build on a world-class consulting business within the Amperity platform</li> <li>Be an advocate of your client base across the organization – work with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Executive Leadership teams to ensure the Amperity service is built to be well-aligned with client needs and goals</li> </ul> <h3><strong>About You</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Minimum 8&nbsp; years experience in professional services, technical project management, or similar</li> <li>Experience managing complex technical implementations, end-to-end</li> <li>Experience with managing stakeholders across various levels and functions</li> <li>Able to grasp and contribute to technical discussions from a conceptual standpoint&nbsp;</li> <li>Understanding and exposure to SQL&nbsp;</li> <li>Understanding of data analysis skills. Ability to direct and curate&nbsp; efforts to dig into customer data and extract insights for stakeholders</li> <li>Passionate - you have&nbsp; a passion for diving into real customer data to solve real customer problems</li> <li>Organized - you have a natural ability to prioritize and you never drop the ball</li> <li>Comfortable leading in an ambiguous environment - you collaborate on design, architecture, and strategy, while not afraid to get into the&nbsp; technical details when needed to drive quality deliverables</li> <li>Gritty - you are able to pick yourself&nbsp; up, dust yourself off, and keep driving towards your vision</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Location</strong></h3> <p><strong>Melbourne, AUS</strong></p> <p>Our hybrid work model includes three days in the office each week, providing a mix of in-person collaboration and remote flexibility</p> <h3><strong>Benefits</strong></h3> <p>We offer a comprehensive benefits program that includes company paid healthcare coverage, a communication subsidy, a mobile subsidy, and a self-managed PTO program (in addition to statutory leave and company holidays). To support you in a way that works for you, new hires are eligible for a home office equipment program.</p> <p>We provide an inclusive environment where you’ll be challenged to find and unlock your full potential, surrounded by a team of world-class people driving for excellence.</p> <p>Amperity is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</p>

title: Senior Training Program Manager
description: <p>At <a href="https://amperity.com/company" target="_blank">Amperity</a>, we’re an AI-first company helping the world’s leading brands create personalized customer experiences that build loyalty and fuel growth. Our AI-powered Customer Data Cloud,&nbsp; built on multi-patented technology, enables more than 400 <a href="https://amperity.com/customers" target="_blank">global brands</a>, including Alaska Airlines, Wyndham Hotels &amp; Resorts, and DICK’S Sporting Goods, to turn customer data into a competitive advantage.</p> <p>We unlock the full value of customer data with simplicity and speed. AI is at the core of our platform and the way we work — from powering advanced identity resolution and predictive analytics to streamlining internal workflows and decision-making. It’s not just a capability; it’s part of our DNA.</p> <p>Our team thrives on curiosity, collaboration, and transparency, fostering a culture where everyone can contribute, learn, and grow. We welcome talented individuals from diverse backgrounds to help us remove data bottlenecks, accelerate business impact, and push the boundaries of what AI can do for the world’s most innovative companies.</p> <p>With offices in Seattle, New York City, London, and Melbourne, you’ll join a fast-growing team tackling critical challenges at the intersection of AI, data, and customer experience. Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.</p> <h3><strong>The Role</strong></h3> <p>As a Training Program Manager at Amperity, you will be a primary driver in the enablement of employees, partners, and customers.&nbsp; Your focus will be to develop and deliver high-energy technical and business user focused training. You will also assist with developing self-service training assets.&nbsp; You will collaborate on the development of training content and programs for all audiences and all mediums. As a team member, you will assist with operational tasks, and suggest ways in which those tasks can be improved or automated.&nbsp;</p> <h3><strong>Interesting Problems</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Develop, deliver, and maintain end-user product training to Amperity employees, partners, and customers.&nbsp; Training delivery will be a combination of virtual classroom and on-demand content,&nbsp;</li> <li>Your training will focus on enabling product users to leverage data to drive value from our platform. You help drive product adoption by focusing on customer success,&nbsp; best practices, and building product champions.</li> <li>Assist colleagues in developing and evolving learning assets, keeping them up to date and organized.</li> <li>Collaborate on curriculum development and instructional design, creating exercises, labs, and quizzes.&nbsp;</li> <li>Assist in the development of training kits and Train the Trainer programs to aid others who provide customer end-user training.</li> <li>Contribute to the continuous improvement and scalability of the training process, utilizing the LMS and other tools.&nbsp;</li> <li>Work with Product Managers directly to improve the product based on your insights.</li> <li>Engage deeply with subject matter experts to develop your own expertise</li> </ul> <h3><strong>About You</strong></h3> <ul> <li>You have knowledge of databases, big data, cloud computing, IT, AI, and LLMs as well as basic SQL proficiency.</li> <li>You have an understanding of Marketing technology, digital marketing strategies, concepts, and processes.</li> <li>You have a minimum of 5 years’ experience working in related technologies, ideally in enterprise b2b SaaS environments.</li> <li>You are customer-focused and motivated to help our learners succeed&nbsp;</li> <li>You are an excellent writer and speaker&nbsp;</li> <li>You are flexible and patient with students and are comfortable communicating to all levels of audiences.</li> <li>You have proven success in the ability to transfer your knowledge that bridges data, technology, and business value.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>You are passionate about learning and sharing your knowledge with others.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>You have experience with a variety of training concepts, principles, and adult learning theory</li> <li>You are quick to learn new technical concepts and can rapidly turn around and impart that knowledge to others with passion and enthusiasm.&nbsp;</li> <li>You act with urgency to produce results quickly with an iterative approach to improvement.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience with API’s a plus</li> <li>Experience with video-based and on-demand content is a plus.</li> <li>Willingness to travel up to 5% as needed</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Location</strong></h3> <p><strong>New York, NY</strong></p> <p>Our hybrid work model includes three days in the office each week, providing a mix of in-person collaboration and remote flexibility</p> <h3><strong>Compensation</strong></h3> <p><strong>Base Salary:&nbsp; $100,000-$140,000. </strong>Within our pay range, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications such as skills, experience, and education/training.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Cash Incentives: </strong>Cash incentives are also available.</p> <p><strong>Stock Options:&nbsp; </strong>The opportunity for ownership is an exciting part of Amperity’s total compensation package. Every employee at Amperity receives a new-hire equity grant, commensurate with the scope of their position.</p> <h3><strong>Benefits</strong></h3> <p>We offer all the benefits you'd expect from a great place to work: 100% employee healthcare coverage, transportation subsidies, a comfortable work environment with plenty of snacks, and other employee experience perks like events and activities, both in-person and remote. We also offer self-managed PTO and the flexibility to do your best work in the way that works for you. We provide an inclusive environment where you'll be challenged to find and unlock your full potential, surrounded by a team of world-class people driving for excellence. For more details on our benefits, please see our<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jd5O27HxNE1AbAQu8jeQyC7aR1vWQHud/view" target="_blank"> US Benefits &amp; Perks Guide</a>.</p> <p>Amperity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and reproductive health choices), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as someone with a disability, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.</p>

Our AI-powered Customer Data Cloud,&nbsp; built on multi-patented technology, enables more than 400&nbsp;<a href="https://amperity.com/customers" target="_blank">global brands</a>, including Alaska Airlines, Wyndham Hotels &amp; Resorts, and DICK’S Sporting Goods, to turn customer data into a competitive advantage.</p> <p>We unlock the full value of customer data with simplicity and speed. AI is at the core of our platform and the way we work — from powering advanced identity resolution and predictive analytics to streamlining internal workflows and decision-making. It’s not just a capability; it’s part of our DNA.</p> <p>Our team thrives on curiosity, collaboration, and transparency, fostering a culture where everyone can contribute, learn, and grow. We welcome talented individuals from diverse backgrounds to help us remove data bottlenecks, accelerate business impact, and push the boundaries of what AI can do for the world’s most innovative companies.</p> <p>With offices in Seattle, New York City, London, and Melbourne, you’ll join a fast-growing team tackling critical challenges at the intersection of AI, data, and customer experience. Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.</p> <h3><strong>The Opportunity</strong></h3> <p>We’re always eager to connect with driven and customer-focused sales professionals who are passionate about helping organizations unlock the full potential of their customer data. While we don't currently have an open position available, we’re growing and regularly hire for a range of sales roles.</p> <p>At Amperity, our Sales team plays a pivotal role in shaping the company’s growth and success. From identifying opportunities and building lasting relationships to delivering strategic solutions that address complex business challenges, you’ll help prospects and customers discover the value of our platform and achieve their goals. Whether your strengths are in new business development, pre-sales solutions consulting, operations, enablement, business value consulting, or strategic partnerships, you’ll collaborate closely with prospects and customers to create meaningful impact.</p> <p>If you’re interested in joining Amperity’s Sales team but don’t see an opportunity that fits right now, please submit your resume. We’ll keep your information on file and reach out when we find a match!<br><span data-sheets-root="1">#LI-DNI</span></p>

title: Future Opportunities
description: <h2>Don't see a current opening that aligns with your expertise, but you'd like to submit your resume to be considered for future opportunities? &nbsp;</h2> <p>We'd love for you to join our Talent Community. &nbsp;</p> <p>Please submit a general application and we'll reach out when we find a good fit!</p> <p>_________________________</p> <p>By joining our Talent Community, you have not officially applied for a position. If you are interested in applying for a specific position, please click on the "VIEW ALL JOBS" button at the top of the page to go back to the current open jobs and apply to that posting.</p>

title: Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis
description: <p><strong>Role Summary &amp; Opportunity for Impact</strong></p> <p><span class="TextRun SCXW52998638 BCX0" lang="EN-US" data-contrast="none"><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW52998638 BCX0" data-ccp-parastyle="heading 3">Bigleaf Network’s is hiring for its first FP&amp;A member of the CFO’s team. Successful candidates are detail-oriented, have intellectual curiosity, value accuracy, are energized by using data to drive business insight and improvement, successfully collaborate with others, and can operate as an individual contributor responsible for a mission-critical company function. In this role, you will elevate the way we manage and communicate financial data across the company. Your analysis and insights will help ensure we make smart, strategic decisions that support and drive Bigleaf Networks’ continued growth. By improving forecasting, identifying and recommending areas for operational and financial performance improvements, enhancing reporting accuracy, and partnering across departments, you will contribute meaningfully to our financial health and long-term success.</span></span></p> <p><strong>Required Knowledge, Skills &amp; Abilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Preferred candidate with 5-7 years of experience in a larger FP&amp;A team, Private Equity or Investment Banking. Technology or e-commerce industry experience a plus.</li> <li>Bachelor's degree in finance, business or related area of study is required. MBA is a plus.</li> <li>Strong background in FP&amp;A or related roles, with demonstrated understanding of financial statements, internal reporting, analysis processes and experience with compliance requirements and financial governance best practices.</li> <li>Deep understanding of operational business drivers and ability to identify key financial drivers then translate that to our financial model to provide critical insights and inform decisions.</li> <li>Proven ability to understand complex business operations, at a tactical level, and translate operational metrics to financial impact.</li> <li>High proficiency in Excel and financial modeling; experience with analytical tools and ERP systems (NetSuite) a plus.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to simplify complex financial and analytic information for cross-function partners.</li> <li>A collaborative and intellectually curious mindset, with the ability to build trust in a remote environment.</li> <li>Strong written and verbal communication, with experience translating data and financial analysis (at times for non-financial stakeholders) with the intent of influencing and informing executive decision making.</li> <li>A strong track record of independent work and ownership over tasks and projects.</li> <li>Comfortable working in a currently challenging data environment and experience managing change without compromising performance as we move towards a financial systems upgrade.</li> <li>Ability to build and lead a high-performing FP&amp;A function as the role scales.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Responsibilities<em>:</em></strong></p> <ul> <li>Take ownership of the company’s current financial model.</li> <li>Overhaul and tune the existing model to incorporate key drivers and levers of the business.</li> <li>Own forecasting and planning process, through organization-wide collaboration.</li> <li>Build a FP&amp;A function that drives insights and informed decision making.</li> <li>Drive scenario planning and sensitivity analysis to assess financial impact of different business outcomes (e.g., changes in advertising spend, revenue mix shifts, customer churn, pricing, etc.).</li> <li>Act as trusted financial advisor to business leaders, offering clear financial insights, evaluating the impact of new initiatives, and challenging assumptions constructively.</li> <li>Utilize system data to investigate for insights and opportunities for process improvement.</li> <li>Closely manage monthly close variance analysis, partnering with accounting team to provide actionable insights and recommendations to drive close time.</li> <li>Lead process improvement initiatives across Corporate Finance, with focus on reporting cycles, Board meetings, and forecasting.</li> <li>Leverage financial planning tools, NetSuite ERP system, and business intelligence (BI)/artificial intelligence (AI) tools to enhance decision making and drive efficiency.</li> <li>Manage weekly cash forecasting process &amp; treasury management processes, working closely with CFO and Controller to ensure accuracy, timeliness, and effectiveness.</li> <li>Contribute to lender and private equity sponsor-related reporting cycles (e.g., covenant calculations and quarterly sponsor reporting).</li> <li>Play a significant role in quarterly board prep by owning key corporate metrics.</li> <li>Work with the CEO on ad-hoc projects.</li> </ul> <p><strong>How you will be measured:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Accuracy, clarity, and scalability of forecasting models and reporting tools.</li> <li>Quality and impact of financial insights provided to leadership.</li> <li>Improvements in and efficiency of reporting and planning / forecasting process.</li> <li>Business partner satisfaction &amp; collaboration, plus influence in financial decision-making.</li> </ul> <p><strong>About Bigleaf</strong></p> <p>Bigleaf Networks provides internet connectivity without complexity, making it easy for IT pros and their organizations to conduct business on the internet with confidence. Bigleaf’s unique network optimization solution adapts traffic to circuit conditions in real-time to preserve application performance and optimize user productivity despite circuit degradations or outages. The Bigleaf solution integrates seamlessly with established firewalls, ISPs, and applications, takes only minutes to install, and works unattended to provide immediate relief and value. <br><br>Founded in 2012 in Portland, Oregon, Bigleaf Networks is investor-backed and provides service across North America and Europe. Whether working with a customer or interacting with one another around the office, we believe in our core mission and are grounded in our collective goals. We’re fueled by a desire for excellence in our work, at our core, we are here at Bigleaf to develop technology that will help people.</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><em>Individual compensation packages are based on a number of factors unique to each candidate including skill set, experience, qualifications, and other job related factors.<br><br><br></em></div><div class="title">Salary Range </div><div class="pay-range"><span>$115,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$145,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>&nbsp;</p> <h3><strong>Highlight of our Benefits:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Medical,&nbsp;Dental &amp; Vision Coverage</li> <li>Optional Life Insurance &amp; Long Term Disability</li> <li>401k with employer match</li> <li>Incentive Stock Options plan</li> <li>6 Weeks of Paid Parental leave</li> <li>4 weeks of PTO + 2 weeks of Sick Time per year</li> <li>14 Company Holidays</li> <li>$25 monthly wellness reimbursement</li> <li>$40 monthly meal credit via GrubHub</li> <li>$55 home internet reimbursement</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>This is a very exciting period of growth for our team. We appreciate you taking the time to carefully read through this ad.</p> <p>We're building a team in addition to a product, and we value and seek inclusion and diversity on our team. Bigleaf is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage candidates to apply even if you don't meet the exact qualifications for this role.</p></div>

title: Account Executive, Expansion
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><span style="text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt;"><strong data-olk-copy-source="MessageBody">**This is a hybrid position that requires 2 days per week in office at our Chicago location**</strong></span></p> <p><span data-contrast="none">The mission of a Syndigo </span><strong><span data-contrast="none">Account Executive, Expansion,</span></strong><span data-contrast="none">&nbsp;is to uncover opportunities and grow existing customers in the SMB/Mid-Market space with a hunter mindset. You will be collaborating and working closely with the Account Managers who own the book of business.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span data-contrast="none">In this role, you will seek out manufacturers and suppliers that primarily sit within the Mid-Market &amp; SMB client territories and articulate the story of how Syndigo serves similar brands in advancing their omni-channel strategy by ensuring retailers and shoppers have the most accurate, up-to-date and optimized content experiences in the market.</span><span data-ccp-props="{&quot;134233117&quot;:false,&quot;134233118&quot;:false,&quot;335551550&quot;:0,&quot;335551620&quot;:0,&quot;335559738&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:0}">&nbsp;</span></li> </ul> <p><span data-ccp-props="{}">&nbsp;</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Your individual compensation within the budgeted salary range is determined based on your skills, education, experience, and internal equity. This position is commission eligible.</p> <p>For full-time U.S. based-employees, we offer competitive health insurance benefits, PTO and volunteer time off, employer-paid short- and long-term disability, parental and adoption leave, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Budgeted Salary Range is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$96,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$120,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Billing Specialist
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p>Billing Specialist - India (Bangalore)</p> <p>As a part of the Syndigo accounting team, the Billing Specialist is responsible for the billing of all revenue in a timely and accurate manner.&nbsp; This role will be key to the success of delivering accurate and on-time billing to our customers.</p> <p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Create and bill out all revenue in a timely manner</li> <li>Audit Salesforce Opportunities for Accuracy</li> <li>Review Client Agreements for Billing purposes</li> <li>Manage remedy tickets for billing team and resolve in a timely and accurate manner</li> <li>Deliver and manage all billing requirements through the required customer portals</li> <li>Meet stated financial goals and objectives monthly</li> <li>Ensure internal control and financial integrity over the revenue management process</li> <li>Define and document recommendations for process improvement</li> <li>Contribute to Intercompany communication and cohesiveness</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li>Proven experience as a Revenue Billing Specialist or similar</li> <li>Salesforce and Netsuite exposure a plus</li> <li>Ability to read and understand contracts</li> <li>Strong math skills are a plus when calculating contract pro-rata amounts</li> <li>Familiar with billing schedules and ability to manage manual billing outside of the system</li> <li>Proficient in Excel and MS Word</li> </ul> <p><strong>Key Attributes</strong></p> <ul> <li>Must have strong attention to detail and an eye for accuracy</li> <li>Self-disciplined and capable of identifying and completing critical tasks to a deadline</li> <li>Strong customer service skills</li> <li>Strong written and oral communication skills</li> <li>Self-starter, trustworthy and can work independently</li> </ul> <p><strong>This is a hybrid position that requires 2 days per week in office at our Bangalore location</strong>.<br><br></p> <p></p> <p><strong>#LI_Hybrid_Bangalore/Bengaluru</strong></p> <p><strong>#LI_SP1</strong></p> <p></p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Business Analyst
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p>***<span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>This is a B2B Contract Role - Candidate Must Be Based in Poland***</strong></span></p> <p>The Business Analyst, GDSN plays a critical role at Syndigo.&nbsp;</p> <p>This role carries responsibility for ensuring the best data model design to fit the customer requirements while ensuring full alignment with GDSN standards. The Analyst reviews initial customer requirements, then provides feedback to ensure the highest quality model with full alignment.</p> <p>With a special focus on GDSN Recipients, responsibilities flow from technical onboarding with account feature configurations, establishing trading partner connections, ensuring data is flowing properly end to end, and ensuring data quality. Using special admin tools, data analysis and investigations are performed, with action plans and implementations of solutions carried out as implementation projects progress and business changes occur.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Analyze initial customer requirements to provide feedback and recommendations to perfect the data model in full alignment with GDSN standards of the countries they will operate in</li> <li>Identify and document new trends and business rules to enhance product data scope and quality</li> <li>Play a key role in select customer facing design workshops/sessions to help customers develop best practice-based solutions</li> <li>Act as a key consult for internal teams and key customers on GDSN subject matter</li> <li>Triage and provide impact assessment and business justification for priority configurations and enhancements</li> <li>Create tickets for data model creation and maintenance, and for data quality rule creation</li> <li>Coordinate activities / projects within SDLC to drive project implementations</li> <li>Report, track, and communicate status of assigned items to a diverse group of stakeholders</li> <li>Act a quality assurance lead for addressed development needs to ensure it solves the customer business needs</li> <li>Perform other duties as assigned</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Required Skills/Abilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Strong data analysis competencies, with focus on quality, data integrity, and pattern recognition</li> <li>Quickly learn and master workflow choreography – keen desire to know how things work</li> <li>Ability to effectively manage time and adjust to changing priorities</li> <li>Effective communication skills to distill key message and impacts</li> <li>Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional stakeholders, including customers during onboarding</li> <li>Detail oriented, but able to handle ambiguity</li> <li>Experience with SQL, Excel, Visio or other data analysis and visualization tools</li> <li>Always hungry to find great data insights, trends, and identify anomalies!</li> </ul> <p><strong>Education and Experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelors degree required</li> <li>5 years of proven data analysis, data transformation, requirements definition</li> <li>GDSN attribute and choreography knowledge</li> <li>Technical background in ETL, Data Engineering a plus, but not required</li> <li>English, German mandatory, French a plus</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Client Training & Enablement Specialist (Technical Trainer)_ Hybrid Role
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><strong>Client Training &amp; Enablement Specialist (Technical Trainer _ Hybrid)</strong></p> <p><strong>Job Summary:</strong></p> <p>Facilitate end-to-end technical and product training for employees, customers, and partners through both virtual and instructor-led sessions. Design engaging learning experiences grounded in adult learning principles and ensure continuous improvement of training effectiveness and materials.<br><em>&nbsp;</em></p> <p><strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong></p> <p><strong><em>Training Delivery –</em></strong><em> Collaborate with stakeholders to streamline delivery strategies and take ownership of end-to-end training execution. Facilitate virtual and instructor-led sessions for employees, customers, and partners based on project needs and skill requirements.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Delivery Methodology - </em></strong><em>Apply Adult Learning Principles (ALP), experiential, and cognitive learning methodologies to design engaging and effective learning experiences. Create a dynamic and inclusive learning environment using varied modalities to address diverse learner needs.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Delivery Content Development &amp; Review – </em></strong><em>Develop and maintain training materials, including trainer and participant guides, ensuring alignment with product updates and business objectives. Review content regularly and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure consistency and high-quality training deliverables.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Learner Engagement – </em></strong><em>Serve as the primary point of contact for learners throughout the enablement journey. Understand learner’s requirements and enable them to achieve certification.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Platform Maintenance – </em></strong><em>Lead, Maintain the learning management platform (backend configurations) for the launch of new training and supporting existing training offerings.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Learner Success – </em></strong><em>Comes with a learner-first mindset to enable learners to achieve certification. </em></p> <p><em>Gather and analyze learner feedback to identify areas for improvement. Establish a feedback loop with the training design team and contribute to the development and refinement of training content and strategies.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Reporting – </em></strong><em>Analyze training data, reports, and learner feedback to assess program effectiveness and identify areas for improvement. Track and report training metrics, adoption trends, and learner outcomes to stakeholders.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Team Player – </em></strong><em>Foster a collaborative environment and encourage open communication within the learning team.</em><br><br></p> <p><strong>Required Skills/Abilities: </strong></p> <ul> <li><em>Proven experience in delivering virtual and instructor-led training for technical audiences.</em></li> <li><em>Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills with strong customer service orientation.</em></li> <li><em>Extensive experience in the technical training domain and familiarity with programming languages like Java or Python, SQL, testing frameworks, Maven and application development lifecycle.</em></li> <li><em>Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).</em></li> <li><em>Skilled in reporting and analytics, including data interpretation, dashboard creation, and report automation.</em></li> <li><em>Exceptional organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills with close attention to detail.</em></li> <li><em>Proven ability to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.</em></li> <li><em>Ability to collaborate across teams, coordinate projects, and ensure training compliance and adoption.</em></li> <li><em>Demonstrated adaptability and composure when operating in high-paced or dynamic environments.</em></li> <li><em>Open to occasional domestic and international travel for training or business purposes.</em></li> </ul> <p><strong>Education and Experience:</strong></p> <p><em>Undergraduate or Postgraduate, or Engineering in Computer Science.</em></p> <p><em>One to Two years of technical training experience required.</em></p> <p><em>Extensive experience in the technical training domain and familiarity with programming languages like Java or Python, SQL, testing frameworks, Maven and application development lifecycle.</em></p> <p><strong><em>This position is based at Bangalore and would require to be working from Bangalore office in hybrid Mode (Twice a week)</em></strong></p> <p><strong><em>.</em></strong></p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Commissions Analyst
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><strong>Commission Analyst - India (Bangalore)<br><br>Position Summary:</strong></p> <p>The Commission Analyst plays a critical role in calculating, analyzing, and administering sales incentive plans that drive performance and align with business objectives. This role partners closely with Sales, Finance, HR, and senior leadership to ensure incentive plans are effective, and compliant.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Support monthly, quarterly, and annual commission calculations and payouts with accuracy and timeliness.</li> <li>Manage ongoing daily operation of Xactly, including making personnel updates, processing commissions data, and distributing plan and quota documents.</li> <li>Ensure accurate employee data within the commissions system.</li> <li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure incentive plans are distributed and understood. Provide training and support to the sales team on compensation plans and Xactly functionality.</li> <li>Maintain internal process documentation and audit trails for all incentive-related processes.</li> <li>Engage in ongoing support to resolve commission calculation-related inquiries with the sales teams.</li> <li>Continuously identify opportunities to streamline and automate sales compensation processes.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Economics, or related field.</li> <li># &nbsp;years of experience in sales compensation, financial analysis, or related roles.</li> <li>Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel; experience with tools like Salesforce, Xactly, or similar is a plus.</li> <li>Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.</li> <li>Strong written communication and interpersonal skills.<br><br> <p><strong>This is a hybrid position that requires 2 days per week in office at our Bangalore location</strong>.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>#LI_Hybrid_Bangalore/Bengaluru</strong></p> <p><strong>#LI_SP1</strong></p> </li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. title: Director, Marketing Operations
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p>We’re seeking a strategic and hands-on&nbsp;<strong>Director of Marketing Operations</strong> to lead the transformation of our marketing infrastructure. This role is ideal for a seasoned operations leader who thrives in a fast-paced B2B SaaS environment, has a passion for data-driven decision-making, and knows how to build and scale high-performing teams and systems.</p> <p>You’ll be instrumental in operationalizing our account-based strategy, streamlining campaign operations, and building a best-in-class reporting and analytics framework. You’ll partner closely with internal stakeholders and agency partners to drive pipeline growth and marketing efficiency.</p> <p><strong>HOW WE'LL BE WINNING TOGETHER DAY TO DAY:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Lead and scale the Marketing Operations function, managing a team and agency partners to support campaign execution, technology, and analytics.</li> <li>Drive the transition from a lead-based to an account-based marketing (ABM) model, leveraging platforms like 6sense to increase pipeline and engagement.</li> <li>Build and optimize marketing performance dashboards, KPIs, and attribution models to provide actionable insights to executive stakeholders.</li> <li>Streamline campaign operations by implementing scalable processes, documentation, compliance, and governance across tools and teams.</li> <li>Own and optimize our marketing tech stack, including Marketo (certification preferred),&nbsp;<em class="Highlight hta01ade78-8b48-44df-8cb4-6f3b2cdb0662">Salesforce</em>, 6sense, RingLead, Chili Piper, and Drift.</li> <li>Develop and enforce data hygiene and lead/contact routing best practices to ensure clean, actionable data across systems.</li> <li>Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, RevOps, Product Marketing, Finance, and more to align on goals, processes, and reporting.</li> <li>Present confidently to executive audiences, translating complex data into clear, strategic recommendations.</li> </ul> <p><strong>WE SHOULD TALK IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU:</strong></p> <ul> <li>8+ years of experience in B2B SaaS marketing operations, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.</li> <li>Proven success in building and scaling marketing operations functions in<em> </em><span class="Highlight hta01ade78-8b48-44df-8cb4-6f3b2cdb0662">high-growth environments</span>.</li> <li>Deep expertise in Marketo (certification strongly preferred),&nbsp;<em class="Highlight hta01ade78-8b48-44df-8cb4-6f3b2cdb0662">Salesforce</em>&nbsp;administration, and ABM platforms like 6sense.</li> <li>Experience leading the shift from lead-based to account-based marketing models.</li> <li>Strong analytical mindset with a track record of building robust reporting frameworks and dashboards.</li> <li>Experience managing internal teams and external agencies to deliver high-impact results.</li> <li>Familiarity with RingLead, Chili Piper, and Drift is a plus.</li> <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization.</li> <li>A builder’s mindset—strategic, hands-on, and always looking for ways to improve and scale.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Your individual compensation within the budgeted salary range is determined based on your skills, education, experience, and internal equity. This position is Bonus Eligible.</p> <p>For full-time U.S. based-employees, we offer competitive health insurance benefits, PTO and volunteer time off, employer-paid short- and long-term disability, parental and adoption leave, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Budgeted Salary Range is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$150,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$180,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Enterprise Account Executive
locationName: France - Remote; Remote - Germany; Remote - Poland; Remote - UK
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><span style="text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt;"><strong>**This is a remote role for candidates located in Germany, France, Poland, or the UK only**</strong></span></p> <p>The mission of a Syndigo&nbsp;<strong>Enterprise Account Executive</strong>&nbsp;is to uncover, develop &amp; nurture meaningful relationships, converting them into closed business that can blossom into long-standing clients of Syndigo.</p> <p>In this independent contributor role, you will seek out target enterprise companies and articulate the story of how Syndigo serves similar companies in advancing their individual strategies.</p> <p><strong>HOW WE’LL BE WINNING TOGETHER DAY TO DAY</strong></p> <ul> <li>Prospecting and building new business opportunities within the assigned territory</li> <li>Ability to understand prospect needs and objectives, then effectively communicate Syndigo’s value proposition to solve their unique challenges</li> <li>Utilize a consultative &amp; challenger sales approach to close opportunities with senior-level executives and forecast weekly when deals will be closed and won</li> <li>Collaborate with operations and solution engineering as needed to ensure appropriate platform positioning and seamless delivery of solutions/services</li> <li>Initiate introductory meetings through networking, cold calls, email, and other tools in the standard sales tech stack to help bolster the pipeline generated near the top of the funnel</li> <li>Coordinate and schedule online or onsite meetings with key decision makers</li> <li>Be comfortable demonstrating a SaaS-based platform and communicating critical capabilities to differentiate our solutions</li> <li>Negotiate and drive pricing strategy and proposal development to drive conversion</li> <li>Negotiate contract terms within the acceptable guidelines provided by commercial leadership</li> <li>Working the plan and closing deals</li> <li>Develop prospect account strategy across owned accounts in Salesforce and consistently execute on plan to penetrate through frequent outbound engagement</li> <li>Research key companies that fit ideal customer profiles and assemble creative outbound messaging</li> <li>Own and manage an active pipeline in Salesforce.com and forecast accurately in Clari on a weekly cadence</li> <li>Achieve weekly activity KPI’s with clear goals set in Salesforce for prospect accounts and contacts targeted in a given week</li> </ul> <p><strong>WE SHOULD TALK IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years in a quota-carrying sales role with a consistent track record of success against quota attainment</li> <li>PIM/MDM experience is preferred&nbsp;</li> <li>Fluency in German at a native level is required for this role, both written and spoken.</li> <li>Extreme passion for hunting and closing net new logos</li> <li>Deep familiarity with Salesforce and related solutions</li> <li>Challenger Sales &amp; ValueSelling certified or proven mastery of other sales methodologies</li> <li>Curiosity and interest in the retail or e-commerce vertical is a plus</li> <li>Proven ability to qualify prospects and open opportunities in a primarily outbound environment</li> <li>Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Your individual compensation within the budgeted salary range is determined based on your skills, education, experience, and internal equity. This position is commission eligible.</p> <p>For full-time U.S. based-employees, we offer competitive health insurance benefits, PTO and volunteer time off, employer-paid short- and long-term disability, parental and adoption leave, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Budgeted Salary Range is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$100,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$130,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Enterprise Account Executive, PIM/MDM
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><span data-contrast="auto">The mission of a Syndigo&nbsp;</span><strong><span data-contrast="auto">Enterprise Account Executive, PIM/MDM&nbsp;</span></strong><span data-contrast="auto">is to</span>&nbsp;<span data-contrast="none">develop and execute sales strategies to maximize client value and meet revenue targets. This role will be responsible for the full sales cycle, including the development and maintenance of a large deal pipeline, resource allocation, proposal management, and deal closure.&nbsp;</span><span data-contrast="auto">You will own a comprehensive target list that positions Syndigo to dominate the Commerce market, especially focused on Product Information Management (PIM) and Master Data Management (MDM). You will be our “tip of the spear” as we continue to penetrate and grow our PIM/MDM market share. This role requires a skill set that includes driving company and product positioning, value selling, and goal orientation.</span><span data-ccp-props="{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}">&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span data-contrast="auto">We're talking about hunters who can qualify prospects, establish real relationships with key decision-makers, and close the deal. </span><span data-ccp-props="{&quot;134233117&quot;:true,&quot;134233118&quot;:true,&quot;201341983&quot;:0,&quot;335559740&quot;:240}">&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span data-contrast="auto"> Bring yourself to our table. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><strong>INSTRUCTIONAL DESIGNER</strong> (Hybrid Mode - Work from Bangalore Office)</p> <p>The Instructional Designer plays a pivotal role in designing and delivering high-quality technical training programs that support the learning needs of internal teams and external customers. The Instructional Designer will develop and manage training content—including e-learning modules, guides, and assessments—while collaborating with subject matter experts and cross-functional teams. Their work ensures training is delivered on time, aligns with business goals, and meets the growing demand for scalable, engaging learning experiences.</p> <p><em>&nbsp;</em><strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong></p> <p><strong><em>Project execution</em></strong><em> – Apply instructional design principles and project management skills to create impactful training modules that align with organizational goals and learner needs.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Team management </em></strong><em>- Mentor junior instructional designers and delegate tasks based on individual strengths and project requirements to ensure efficient content development.</em></p> <p><strong><em>Learning Engagement </em></strong><em>– Serve as the primary point of contact for training design-related queries. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand product features, training objectives, and learner needs, ensuring the delivery of relevant and engaging learning experiences.</em></p> <p><em>&nbsp;</em><strong><em>Training Design – </em></strong></p> <ul> <li><em>Create storyboards and detailed content outlines.</em></li> <li><em>Structure, revise, and script content to ensure clarity, engagement, and alignment with learning objectives.</em></li> <li><em>Communicate effectively through visual, oral, and written formats; deliver engaging presentations as needed.</em></li> <li><em>Design and build a variety of learning materials, including trainer guides, training schedules, e-learning modules, instructional and API training documents, refresher trainings, and virtual instructor-led training (VILT) content.</em></li> <li><em>Independently manage coordination with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to gather accurate and relevant content.</em></li> <li><em>Create assessments and quizzes to evaluate learner comprehension and measure training effectiveness.</em></li> <li><em>Maintain organized project documentation and course repositories for easy access and version control.</em></li> <li><em>Manage multiple projects simultaneously while collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure timely delivery and quality outcomes.</em></li> </ul> <p><em>&nbsp;</em><strong>Required Skills/Abilities: </strong></p> <ul> <li>Proven experience in instructional design, training need analysis and adult learning theories</li> <li><em>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</em></li> <li><em>Excellent interpersonal skills</em></li> <li><em>Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail</em></li> <li><em>Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines</em></li> <li><em>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</em></li> <li><em>Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment</em></li> <li><em>Proficient with Camtasia, Microsoft Office Suite or related software</em></li> <li><em>Working knowledge of Learning Management Systems (LMS), including content upload,
