title: Manager, Client Development - Expansion
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><span style="text-decoration: underline; font-size: 12pt;"><strong data-olk-copy-source="MessageBody">**This is a hybrid position that requires 2 days per week in office at our Chicago location**</strong></span></p> <p>We are seeking a&nbsp;<strong>Manager, Client Development</strong> for our Expansion team.&nbsp; This person will be responsible for managing a team of 8-10 individual Account Executives. This role will directly report into the VP, Client Development, and they will be leading the growth strategy and revenue attainment within the MM/SMB market sectors of Syndigo’s existing client base across the Americas region (~12,000 Accounts). Additionally, this role will oversee pipeline cultivation and cross-sell into Syndigo’s PXM/PIM/MDM solution lines.</p> <p><strong><span data-contrast="auto">HOW WE’LL BE WINNING TOGETHER DAY TO DAY</span></strong></p> <ul> <li>Build and maintain an excellent growth team that is focused on expanding the existing MM/SMB client base by successfully securing upsells/cross-sells into that area of the business.</li> <li>Ensure the team appropriately forecasts and executes against the qualified high velocity pipeline within the current client territory that exceeds 3X-4X of quarterly/annual targets.</li> <li>Foster internal &amp; external partnerships that allow for enhanced field enablement, growth opportunities, and alignment within Syndigo’s OKRs and new GTM strategies related to our evolving PXM/PIM/MDM programs.</li> <li>Drive and support active lead generation in partnership with BDR, Marketing, and Retail teams.</li> <li>Facilitate and engage in cross-collaboration with Account Management/CSM Teams to ensure proper account alignment, planning, and strategies are being deployed for the existing client base.</li> <li>Become the primary negotiation lead on contract terms, pricing, and other details to close growth deals.</li> <li>Deliver sales coaching, opportunity management alignment, and ultimately support critical pipeline opportunities through closed-won</li> <li>Leverage existing sales tech stack (Salesforce, Salesloft, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, MindTickle, etc.) and share best practices across the team</li> <li>Standardize the practices of the current team: <ul> <li>Prepare compelling sales presentations and proposals tailored to client needs to showcase the company's value proposition.</li> <li>Enhance the team's approach around account planning and heatmapping of territories to align the client's investment appetite for all of Syndigo’s offerings. Both in Brand Syndication and PIM/MDM scope of work.</li> <li>Hold the team accountable for converting PXM Essentials upsells but also guide them to uncover leads across the PXM/PIM/MDM solution line for additional value, growth, and deeper partnerships.</li> <li>Support Account Management/CSM teams in the overall CSAT of a client and drive additional value in upsells, references, and success stories.</li> </ul> </li> <li>Support &amp; Lead in the next-gen evolution of the existing Business Development team. <ul> <li>Driving the execution of Syndigo’s new GTM approach for PIM/MDM. Mapping out future state and advising on BPIs, ROEs, and GTM deployments.</li> <li>Conduct market research to identify potential changes, industry trends, and assess market opportunities as it pertain to Syndigo’s GTM positions.</li> <li>Enhancing Syndigo’s MQL &amp; SQL processes in partnership with marketing.</li> <li>Ramp the existing BDR team around strategies and approaches for targeting the existing client base.</li> </ul> </li> </ul> <p><strong><span data-contrast="auto"><span data-ccp-props="{&quot;134233117&quot;:false,&quot;134233118&quot;:false,&quot;335557856&quot;:16777215,&quot;335559738&quot;:0,&quot;335559739&quot;:120}">WE SHOULD TALK IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU</span></span></strong></p> <ul> <li>10+ years of B2B sales experience; proven ability to manage a successful sales team at a manager level.</li> <li>3+ years of leadership experience&nbsp;</li> <li>2-3 years of experience in PIM/MDM in conjunction with data syndication to 3rd parties (i.e., Retailers, Data pools) is highly preferred&nbsp;</li> <li>Sales Methodology experience with MEDDPICC</li> <li>Demonstrated record of success at both large, complex organizations and in mid-sized environments.</li> <li>Strong relationship building and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with executives and interface with all levels of management.</li> <li>A high degree of comfort with technology and familiarity with data management, syndication, and analytics are huge pluses.</li> <li>Proven track record of developing industry relationships with clients, peers, vendors, and business partners</li> <li>Excellent people leadership, organization, and time management skills</li> <li>Proficient in written and verbal communication skills at all levels; strong ability to build compelling sales presentations and proposals.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Your individual compensation within the budgeted salary range is determined based on your skills, education, experience, and internal equity. This position is commission eligible.</p> <p>For full-time U.S. based-employees, we offer competitive health insurance benefits, PTO and volunteer time off, employer-paid short- and long-term disability, parental and adoption leave, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Budgeted Salary Range is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$128,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$160,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Marketing Manager
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><span data-contrast="auto"><span style="text-decoration: underline;"><strong>***This role is open to candidates currently residing in Poland***</strong></span></span></p> <p><span data-contrast="auto">We’re a fast-growing B2B software company transforming the way brands and retailers manage their product experiences. title: Nutrition Business Analyst
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><strong data-olk-copy-source="MessageBody">**This is a hybrid position that requires 2 days per week in office at our Chicago location</strong>.**<br><br>Syndigo’s nutrition and wellness data solutions give restaurants, retailers, and platforms the high-quality data they need to create engaging consumer experiences across a wide range of health, fitness, nutrition, and retail applications. We depend on our team of registered dietitians to develop, maintain, and monitor the quality of our nutrition data, as well as serving as subject matter experts for data analysis and new solution development.</p> <p>As Nutrition Business Analyst, you’ll play a key role in managing the quality of our nutrition data solutions for restaurants, apps, and retailers, and work cross-functionally across the organization to ensure the highest data quality for our customers.</p> <p><strong>HOW WE’LL BE WINNING TOGETHER DAY TO DAY</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Manage the Data: </strong>Serve as manager for one or more sets of nutrition data, ensuring processes that develop/maintain/analyze data accuracy and currency at the highest standards of quality.</li> <li><strong>Communicate Effectively: </strong><strong>Communicate internally and with clients in writing, on the phone/video, and in person as needed to </strong>share the impact of nutrition and wellness solutions, advise clients on using the solutions effectively, and handle challenges.</li> <li><strong>Identify Risk:</strong> Proactively identify issues that present data quality risk, and devise solutions in collaboration with VP of Data Management and other teams.</li> <li><strong>Collaborate on Projects. </strong>Work with other nutrition data team members and cross-functionally across the organization to meet project goals.</li> <li><strong>Support Data Solutions:</strong> Work with other Data team members, as well as cross-functional partners, to support the development of data solutions or improve efficiency, accuracy, and usability of current solutions.</li> <li><strong>Serve as Subject Matter Expert:</strong> Serve as a nutrition data subject matter expert internally and with customers as needed.</li> <li><strong>Maintain Professional Expertise:</strong> Keep RD credential current, and stay up to date on regulatory and market requirements for nutrition and related data.</li> <li><strong>Be a Vital Team Player:</strong> Help your fellow team members shine by staying connected, sharing ideas, providing support, and collaborating.</li> <li><strong>Elevate the Narrative:</strong> Develop thought leadership content to support Syndigo marketing efforts.<strong>&nbsp;</strong></li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>WE SHOULD TALK IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU</strong></p> <ul> <li>1+ years of nutrition data experience in SaaS environment, 3+ years preferred&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Certification</strong>: Registered Dietitian with current CDR credentials<strong> </strong></li> <li><strong>Domain Expertise:</strong> You are confident in your nutrition knowledge, nutrition analysis, menu creation, and regulations that apply to this domain in the United States and know how to research new questions that arise.</li> <li><strong>Data Analysis:</strong> Strong attention to detail, experience analyzing large data sets, expertise in Microsoft Excel required, experience in other data analysis tools a bonus.</li> <li><strong>Collaborative Mindset:</strong> Ability to work cross-functionally and break down silos, to share expertise and build the best solution.</li> <li><strong>Communication Skills:</strong> Communicate clearly and effectively internally and with customers, in writing, and in speaking.</li> <li><strong>Self-Motivation:</strong> A proactive, solution-oriented attitude that drives you to deliver results independently and collaboratively.</li> <li><strong>Creative Problem-Solving:</strong> A desire to push the boundaries of what’s possible, using innovation and technical acumen to create tailored solutions that address specific business challenges.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Your individual compensation within the budgeted salary range is determined based on your skills, education, experience, and internal equity. This position is Bonus Eligible.</p> <p>For full-time U.S. based-employees, we offer competitive health insurance benefits, PTO and volunteer time off, employer-paid short- and long-term disability, parental and adoption leave, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Budgeted Salary Range is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$80,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$87,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.</p> <p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!&nbsp;</p> <p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!&nbsp;</p> <p><strong><span class="name_cell__Name-sc-h9ydex-0 hubWys field-name">GDPR/CCPA</span></strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.</p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description"><strong>Syndigo Job Applicant Privacy Notice</strong></p> <p class="body_text__BodyText-sc-wuvk3k-1 fyylJu" data-provides="question-description">At Syndigo, we care about your privacy. As you go through our recruitment process, we are committed to being transparent about how we process your personal data. To learn more about how Syndigo processes your personal data, go to our&nbsp;<a href="https://syndigo.com/legal/job-applicant-privacy-notice/" target="_blank">Job Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

title: Salesforce Developer
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. We cannot do all of this without our amazing employees who make the magic happen here at Syndigo. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><strong>Salesforce Developer </strong>(Work from Bangalore office)</p> <p><strong>Job Summary:</strong></p> <p>We are seeking a highly skilled Salesforce Developer / Administrator to own, enhance, and scale our Salesforce platform. This hybrid role combines declarative administration and Apex development expertise to deliver automation, integrations, and optimized user experiences across Sales, Service, and Operations.</p> <p>The ideal candidate thrives in both configuration and code — someone comfortable translating business requirements into elegant technical solutions that drive productivity and growth.</p> <p><strong>Duties/Responsibilities:</strong></p> <p><strong>Administration</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build and maintain automation via Flows, Validation Rules, Approval Processes, and Record-Triggered Flows.</li> <li>Maintain data integrity through imports, deduplication, and validation.</li> <li>Partner with Business Analysts and System Owners to implement new features and enhancements.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Development</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design and develop Apex Classes, Triggers, Batch Jobs, and Test Classes.</li> <li>Build and maintain Lightning Web Components (LWC) and Aura Components.</li> <li>Integrate Salesforce with external systems via REST/SOAP APIs, MuleSoft, Boomi, or other middleware.</li> <li>Implement CI/CD practices for metadata deployments (e.g., GitHub, Copado, Gearset).</li> <li>Participate in code reviews, documentation, and technical design sessions.</li> <li>Partner with architects and business leaders to shape scalable solutions aligned with company goals.</li> <li>Identify platform optimization opportunities, technical debt reduction, and best practices adoption.</li> <li>Support release management, testing, and change control processes.</li> <li>Stay current with Salesforce releases and emerging platform capabilities (e.g., Einstein, Flow Orchestration, Omni-Channel)</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Education and Experience:</strong></p> <p><strong>Required:</strong></p> <ul> <li>3–5 years of hands-on Salesforce experience as an Admin or Developer (preferably both).</li> <li>Proficiency in Apex, SOQL/SOSL, Lightning Web Components, and Flow automation.</li> <li>Strong understanding of Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and standard Salesforce data models.</li> <li>Salesforce Certified Administrator (ADM 201) and Platform Developer .</li> <li>Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Preferred:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Salesforce Platform App Builder or Advanced Admin certification.</li> <li>Experience with CPQ, Field Service Lightning, or Experience Cloud.</li> <li>Familiarity with Agile delivery, Jira, Git, CI/CD pipelines, and sandbox management.</li> <li>Understanding of security model, data architecture, and API integration platforms.</li> </ul> <p><strong>This job requires to be working twice a week from Bangalore office.</strong></p> <p>#LI-HYBRID</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong></h2> <p>To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new title: Sr Manager, Product Marketing
description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Syndigo powers the continual flow of data and content throughout the entire commerce ecosystem— accelerating delivery of accurate and compelling information that increases sales on every shelf. We are the recognized leader in software and services for the management of master data, product information, digital assets, and content syndication and analytics across industries including grocery, foodservice, hardlines, home improvement, oil &amp; gas, pet, health and beauty, automotive, apparel, and healthcare products.</p> <p>Syndigo serves the industry’s largest two-sided network, connecting more than 50,000 global users across 12,000+ global brands with more than 1,750 global retailers.</p> <p>Basically, we're the people that deliver the rich, accurate product content that helps consumers shop online with confidence, and helps brands and retailers operate efficient product supply chains. As we continue to grow, we’re always looking to identify talented individuals to join our team.</p></div><p><span class="NormalTextRun SCXW261734655 BCX8">As we expand our marketing team to maximize the opportunity in front of us, we are looking for an exceptional Sr. Manager, Product Marketing reporting to the Vice President of Product Marketing. We are seeking a self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and can balance strategic initiatives with hands-on execution.</span></p> <p><strong><span data-contrast="auto">HOW WE’LL BE WINNING TOGETHER DAY TO DAY</span></strong></p> <ul> <li><span data-contrast="none">Market and competitive intelligence: Continuously research Syndigo’s market, buyers, and competitors. title: Account Director, Auto, Travel & Lifestyle
locationName: New York, New York, United States
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is hiring a Director, Luxury &amp; Lifestyle – Auto, Travel &amp; Lifestyle</strong><strong> </strong><strong>to join our Luxury &amp; Lifestyle team. </strong>We are looking for an experienced, client-facing, enthusiastic digital media expert capable of creating advertising solutions such as custom, content and data driven digital programs for Auto, Travel and Lifestyle clients. Experience and existing relationships in these markets are a must.</p> <p>Business Insider is for people who are driven, optimistic and always looking forward. Our mission is to inspire action through thought-provoking stories. We tell our audience what they want and need to know to improve their lives and the world with storytelling that is accessible, smart, sometimes unexpected, and always helpful. You will bring high-level industry expertise, a deep list of client contacts and a collaborative and creative spirit.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>The Director, Luxury &amp; Lifestyle reports directly to the VP, Sales, Lifestyle &amp; Luxury and sits on the Sales Team.&nbsp; This position is based in either in Los Angeles or New York City HQ (depending upon the candidate’s experience and contact list), with an in-office presence of at least 3 days per week.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Serving as an “evangelist” for Business Insider internally and externally; clearly articulating the company’s unique value proposition&nbsp;</li> <li>Lead high-level relationships with key Auto, Travel and Lifestyle clients and agencies</li> <li>Develop custom client solutions utilizing Business Insider's entire suite of products including Branded Content, Display, Video, Programmatic, Podcasts, Data and Live/Virtual Events.</li> <li>Create, maintain, and sustain relationships with media agencies, creative agencies, and clients directly while hitting quarterly sales targets.</li> <li>Work across multiple client and agency partners, i.e. branded content, video, strategy across cross-functional comms planning cycles, ensuring that all stakeholders are in the loop.</li> <li>Serve as the internal voice of the client during planning and brainstorming</li> <li>Stay on top of cross-vertical industry trends, campaign performance, and competitive intelligence</li> <li>Serve a team lead for the Auto, Travel and Lifestyle (CPG, Entertainment, etc.) verticals which includes identifying industry trends, requesting relevant research + sharing with the team and acting as lead for the development of sales materials for both verticals.</li> <li>Play a key role in translating BI's editorial and commercial strengths into solutions aligned to Auto, Travel and Lifestyle media buyers</li> <li>Represent BI at industry events, partner meetings, and immersive presentations to drive business objectives and raise the profile of the BI brand.</li> <li>Help Business Insider win share of wallet in a competitive set that includes publishers like NYT, WSJ, Bloomberg, Vox, and others</li> <li>Identify organic growth opportunities and areas for upsell (e.g. new lines of business, additional budget holders, tentpole moments)</li> </ul> <p><strong>The ideal candidate has:</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>A Strong network. </strong>You have strong relationships with clients and agencies alike and a track record of collaborating effectively in mutually-beneficial ways.</li> <li>8+ years of <strong>Digital media expertise.</strong> The role requires a sophisticated understanding of both creative custom packages and data-driven audience programs, and experience and ability to sell these across various geographic areas. The ideal candidate must be able to ‘spark’ interest with clients in market by creating value on the fly, understanding and presenting creative ways to meet client digital marketing objectives.&nbsp;</li> <li>A solid understanding of programmatic, both tech and sales sides of the business, is preferred.</li> <li><strong>An insatiable curiosity</strong> combined with the ability to translate abstract concepts and ideas into actionable marketing solutions is essential.</li> <li>A strong creative mindset and passionate about storytelling, technology, media, and selling, winning new business and growing existing business.</li> <li>Deep understanding of the digital media space, how combinations of media platforms can bring value to clients and ability to position Business Insider’s products and ad solutions on their behalf, and close deals. As well as creating custom content solutions.&nbsp;</li> <li>All candidates must have at least a cursory knowledge of programmatic ad selling.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Salary &amp;&nbsp;</strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Base salary: $150,000 - $160,000 (dependent on skills, experience, and competencies)</li> <li>Additional bonus/commission&nbsp;</li> <li>Flexible PTO, 10 paid holidays, and 16 weeks of parental leave</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans</li> <li>Matched and vested 401k plan</li> <li>Access to resources for financial planning guidance, family planning services, mental health reachout and Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)</li> <li>Additional benefits include commuter benefits, phone reimbursement, gym membership discounts, and more&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment decisions, does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality or national origin, religion, disability, familial status, and military or veteran status. title: Data Graphics Fellow (January 2026)
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is hiring a data graphics fellow to join our Creative team to support our newsroom’s visuals.&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Business Insider is for people who are driven, optimistic and always looking forward. Our mission is to inspire action through thought-provoking stories. We tell our audience what they want and need to know to improve their lives and the world with storytelling that is accessible, smart, sometimes unexpected, and always helpful. Our team members embody and uphold Business Insider’s three core values: we are all one team, we are effective, and we strive to get better every day.</p> <p>The <a href="https://www.insider-inc.com/careers/fellowship-program">Business Insider Fellowship Program</a> is for early career journalists who want to spend six months learning from a newsroom full of passionate, dedicated journalists. Fellows are assigned to teams and become experts in digital storytelling. They produce real work that is distributed to our audience of millions, and by the end of six months, they are prepared for the next phase of their journalism careers. This role requires you to work for 40 hours a week and can be fully remote or based out of our New York City office.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Applications are due November 7.&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>The Role &amp; Team</strong></p> <p>You will be expected to juggle multiple projects at once, ranging from quick-hit news stories to months-long, ambitious interactives.&nbsp;</p> <p>Daily assignments include creating maps, charts, infographics, and tables in Datawrapper and Illustrator, as well as working on larger scale custom graphics in our graphics rig, which uses Svelte and d3. Projects could include creating <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/eighth-amendment-prohibit-protect-prisoners-cruel-and-unusual-punishment-gutted-2024-12">scrollytelly stories</a> and <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/how-data-centers-are-deepening-the-water-crisis-2025-6?utm_source=linkedin&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_campaign=business-author-post">experiences</a>, building custom <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/does-basic-income-work-families-monthly-program-2024-11?utm_source=facebook&amp;utm_medium=social&amp;utm_campaign=insider-art-headline-post-link&amp;fbclid=IwY2xjawNkqKhleHRuA2FlbQIxMABicmlkETFvNmU4SkY5VEwwSXBTaFhwAR66hPViF6xOugMz3QfKAf2LZOHVX28EhXzwumeyELZSLhiCgzSzy7-9JoC-cg_aem_sdsQW9V8E_bLt-AavU3nrQ&amp;brid=AzRXnIzb2OzxVfwKponMoQ">minisites</a> and pages, and working with<a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/united-states-car-models-interactive-guide-politics-color-brand-location-2024-10"> large datasets</a>.</p> <p>As a Data Graphics Fellow, you'll gain valuable experience collaborating with journalists and designers in a fast-paced and fun work environment. You will have the opportunity to pitch and develop your own ideas and your work will be published on a daily basis to our large audience.</p> <p>This fellow will report directly to our Data Visualization Director, and we expect New York-based fellows to come into the office at least twice per week.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Expert knowledge of Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop</li> <li>Experience with data visualization, especially map- and chart-making</li> <li>Experience working in charting tools like Datawrapper or Flourish</li> <li>Experience with JavaScript/d3, HTML, CSS/Sass, and Github</li> <li>Experience working with <a href="https://svelte.dev/">Svelte</a> or similar frameworks a plus</li> <li>Mac proficiency</li> <li>Attention to detail, strong typography and layout skills, thoughtful use of color</li> <li>Understanding of best practices for data visualizations</li> <li>A mobile-first mentality</li> <li>Knowledge of accessibility standards and practices</li> </ul> <p><strong>The ideal candidate has:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Passion for visual storytelling and data journalism&nbsp;</li> <li>A desire to tell unique stories using data and interactive graphics</li> <li>A love of all things data viz and thinks outside of the box of how we can display data</li> <li>The ability to work under a deadline and juggle multiple projects at a time</li> <li>Confidence as a designer and is comfortable pitching and defending their work</li> <li>The ability to learn quickly and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment</li> <li>Openness to receiving and giving feedback and critiques&nbsp;</li> <li>Excellent communication skills with teammates and Senior Editors</li> <li>A desire to expand and practice skills outside their expertise or comfort zone</li> </ul> <p><strong>Additionally, all of our editorial fellows should have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>A passion for digital storytelling and voracious reading habits</li> <li>Familiarity with digital and social media</li> <li>The ability to work quickly and collaboratively with a fast-paced team</li> <li>Proofreading and copyediting skills</li> <li>A love of Business Insider and our mission to serve readers with the information and inspiration they need in a way that’s accurate, fair, fast, and fun&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Salary &amp; Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Fellows are paid $20 per hour (overtime when needed and approved)</li> <li>PTO and paid holidays</li> <li>Eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits</li> </ul> <p><strong>Please apply with a resume and cover letter and specify why you're interested in working on this team.</strong> If you’d like some tips, check out our<a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/why-this-is-an-excellent-resume-2013-11"> best practices guide</a>.</p> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment decisions, does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality or national origin, religion, disability, familial status, and military or veteran status. title: Deputy Lifestyle Editor, Reviews
description: <p>Business Insider is looking for a <strong>Deputy Lifestyle Editor to join our Reviews team</strong>. We produce in-depth product reviews and buying guides from trusted experts across categories like tech, home, kitchen, style, and more. Our team tests hundreds of products each year, working with both in-house and freelance contributors to develop the most helpful and engaging shopping stories on the internet.&nbsp;</p> <p>As Deputy Editor, you’ll oversee the <strong>home and kitchen team</strong> (which includes our pets, travel, and seasonal gift guide coverage), leading content strategy, guiding editorial quality, and driving growth across these key categories. You’ll manage two senior editors, work with a talented roster of freelance writers, and help shape the editorial and business strategy for Reviews. This role also has an opportunity to contribute to special projects, not just by participating but by ideating and executing on the next big thing for our team.&nbsp;</p> <p>This is a leadership role that combines strategic thinking with management and hands-on editing. You’ll play a central role in ensuring Business Insider Reviews continues to help readers make confident, informed buying decisions, and that the team’s content meets the highest standards of journalistic rigor, originality, and reader service. This role can be remote or based out of our NYC office.&nbsp;</p> <h3><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Lead and mentor a team of two senior editors, supporting their editorial growth and excellence.</li> <li>Oversee editorial strategy and content planning for the home, kitchen, travel, gifts, and pets verticals.</li> <li>Manage quarterly and weekly planning to align team output with larger Reviews team goals and revenue targets.</li> <li>Edit and greenlight stories across assigned verticals, ensuring accuracy, clarity, and reader trust.</li> <li>Commission and update product reviews, buying guides, and evergreen stories in collaboration with staff and freelancers.</li> <li>Lead editorial shifts on tentpole shopping event days, including Prime Day, Black Friday, and Cyber Monday.</li> <li>Identify and execute special projects — from supported content opportunities to broad-scale efforts like launching new series.&nbsp;</li> <li>Collaborate with the Reviews leadership team on long-term planning, experimentation, and revenue-driving initiatives.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Desired Skills &amp; Experience</strong></h3> <ul> <li>7+ years of experience in digital media, ideally with a background in <strong>product reviews or commerce journalism </strong>on the topic of home, kitchen, or related areas.</li> <li>A strong network of expert freelancers and a deep understanding of how to help them shape and craft fully tested buying guides and reviews.&nbsp;</li> <li>A background in whole-package production, meaning good headline judgement, an eye for visuals, and experience editing/resizing photos and making graphics.</li> <li>Proven success managing editors, freelancers, and large-scale editorial projects.</li> <li>Exceptional editing and writing skills with an eye for clarity, reader service, and SEO best practices.</li> <li>Strong strategic instincts — able to plan, prioritize, and pivot in response to analytics and business needs.</li> <li>Experience using workflow tools (e.g., Airtable, Asana, or Trello) to manage complex content pipelines.</li> <li>Collaborative and solutions-oriented approach to leadership, with a track record of fostering inclusive, high-performing teams.</li> <li>Enthusiasm for Business Insider’s mission to help readers make smarter, more informed decisions through trustworthy journalism.</li> <li>Bonus: Experience managing Airtable workflows and interfaces</li> <li>Double bonus: Experience with social media, newsletters, and/or video.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <h3><strong>How to apply</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Submit your resume and cover letter&nbsp;</li> <li>Include at least 3-5 links to published work, including stories you’ve written and stories you’ve edited</li> </ul> <p><strong>Salary &amp; Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Base salary: $130,000 to $150,000 (dependent on relevant expertise, and industry network). This position is eligible for an annual performance based bonus.</li> <li>Unlimited PTO, 10 paid holidays, and 16 weeks of parental leave.</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans.</li> <li>Matched and vested 401k plan.</li> <li>Access to resources for financial planning guidance, family planning services, mental health reach-out, and Employee Assistance Programs (EAP).</li> <li>Additional benefits include commuter benefits, phone reimbursement, gym membership discounts, and more.</li> </ul> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment decisions, does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality or national origin, religion, disability, familial status, and military or veteran status. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented groups to apply.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p style="text-align: left;">Are you passionate about this opportunity, but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for? We still want to hear from you! Apply online and let us know why you would make a great addition to Business Insider.</p></div>

title: Media Manager, Archivist
locationName: New York, New York, United States
description: <p><br>We’re hiring an experienced archivist and media manager to design, improve, and run a scalable end-to-end video rights, clearances, and licensing program across our owned-and-operated and third-party distribution. You will ensure legal compliance and efficient delivery to web, app, FAST, and CTV while maintaining the full licensing lifecycle—contract intake, rights windows, restrictions, renewals, expirations, and audit trails—in partnership with Legal and Editorial.</p> <p>You will also establish additional video distribution and MAM workflows that expand our reach and raise our standards. This includes architecting ingest, metadata, QC, versioning, transcoding, and delivery pipelines; configuring and integrating our stack (Iconik for MAM, JW Player for OVP, plus CMS and NLEs); documenting playbooks and SLAs; training newsroom partners; and monitoring performance to drive continuous improvement. You’ll build these systems alongside an award-winning team of creative, ambitious video journalists.</p> <p><strong>What you’ll do</strong></p> <ul> <li>Asset intake and organization: establish ingest workflows and enforce file naming, directory, and versioning conventions<br><br></li> <li>Metadata and taxonomy: define and maintain metadata schemas, controlled vocabularies, and tagging QA; drive consistent usage across teams<br><br></li> <li>Search and retrieval: operate the DAM/MAM with emphasis on <strong>Iconik</strong>; also work with Bynder, Canto, CatDV, and tools like Frame.io; manage request SLAs and build saved searches and collections<br><br></li> <li>Video platform operations: manage video data within <strong>JW Player</strong> as the online video platform for publishing, playlists, captions, thumbnails, and performance reporting; collaborate with audience and revenue teams<br><br></li> <li>Rights and compliance: track licenses, usage windows, embargoes, and model or property releases; coordinate fair use reviews and takedowns with Legal<br><br></li> <li>Training and documentation: create quick start guides, run newsroom trainings, and maintain playbooks for breaking news ingestion and after-hours coverage<br><br></li> </ul> <p><strong>What you’ll bring</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years in media asset management, newsroom archiving, library science, or a similar content operations role</li> <li>Hands-on experience with Iconik or comparable MAMs (CatDV, Dalet, Bynder, Canto) and with <strong>JW Player</strong> or other OVPs</li> <li>Strong grasp of IPTC and XMP standards, editorial best practices, copyright and licensing, and privacy considerations</li> <li>Comfort with common file formats (RAW, ProRes, DNx, JPEG, PNG, WAV, MP3), transcoding basics, and checksum or fixity concepts<br>Proven ability to create taxonomies and controlled vocabularies with excellent attention to detail and change management skills</li> <li>Nice to have: basic scripting in Python or Bash, SQL or APIs, AWS or GCP storage tiers, FFmpeg, and modern tagging or vision tools<br><br></li> </ul> <p><strong>How success will be measured</strong></p> <ul> <li>Average retrieval time of X hours or less for archive requests; at least Y% of new assets fully tagged within 24 hours.</li> <li>Fewer duplicate assets and lower storage costs; no rights or embargo violations.</li> <li>Adoption of standards across desks and strong satisfaction scores from editorial partners.</li> </ul> <p>This role is based in New York and will require coming into our NYC office three times a week.</p> <p><strong>Salary &amp; Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Base salary: $80,000-$85,000 (dependent on relevant expertise).</li> <li>Unlimited PTO, 10 paid holidays, and 16 weeks of parental leave.</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans.</li> <li>Matched and vested 401k plan.</li> <li>Access to resources for financial planning guidance, family planning services, mental health reach-out, and Employee Assistance Programs (EAP).</li> <li>Additional benefits include commuter benefits, phone reimbursement, gym membership discounts, and more.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment decisions, does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality or national origin, religion, disability, familial status, and military or veteran status. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented groups to apply.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p style="text-align: left;">Are you passionate about this opportunity, but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for? We still want to hear from you! Apply online and let us know why you would make a great addition to Business Insider.</p></div>

title: Media Planning Strategist
locationName: New York, New York, United States
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is hiring a Media Planning Strategist</strong> based in the New York area to join the Revenue Strategy team and oversee media planning and pre-sales strategy for select sales verticals.</p> <p>Business Insider is for people who are driven, optimistic and always looking forward. Our mission is to inspire action through thought-provoking stories. We tell our audience what they want and need to know to improve their lives and the world with storytelling that is accessible, smart, sometimes unexpected, and always helpful. Our team members embody and uphold Business Insider’s three core values: we are all one team, we are effective, and we strive to get better every day.</p> <p><strong>The Role &amp; Team:</strong></p> <p>As a part of the Revenue Strategy Team, the Media Planning department works across all advertising campaigns, mainly during the pre-sales phase. The team plays a vital role in the end-to-end workflow and is responsible for RFP response, deal budgeting, deal level pricing/margin management, inventory forecasting, media plan creation, IO/deal approval management, and deal booking in order management systems.</p> <p>The media planning team plays a vital role in enforcing and tailoring pricing &amp; packaging guidelines created by the Pricing &amp; Yield team while providing real-time in-market client feedback for strategic and timely pricing and packaging adjustments.</p> <p>Media Planning Strategist will take clients’ KPIs and create efficient, high-quality, and winning proposals for enterprise-level clients (Direct &amp; Programmatic).&nbsp;</p> <p>The Strategist will utilize their extensive product knowledge to create strategic media plans that maximize revenue and profit across all monetizable platforms, including desktop, mobile, video, audio, events, and social.</p> <p>This individual will collaborate across Pricing, Packaging and Yield, Client Success, Marketing, Studios, and Operations Teams within the Revenue Organization. They will embrace diverse thought processes and working styles with compassion, empathy, and care. This individual will be solutions-oriented and unafraid to ask questions or challenge the status quo.</p> <p>The Media Planning Strategist will report to the Director of Media Planning and Pricing, who is based in New York. This position is based in the New York City HQ with an in-office presence of at least 3 days per week.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Support day-to-day RFP/RFI requests, revision requests, and general inquiries for Direct and Programmatic clients.</li> <li>Create marketable, actionable, and profitable media plans for Direct &amp; Programmatic clients while factoring in client budget, target audience, KPIs, additional RFP requirements, and internal business objectives.</li> <li>Advise cross-functional teams on proposal/product development and execution, using in-depth knowledge of product offerings, ad-serving, and data capabilities to shape RFP strategy.</li> <li>Manage proposal-level pricing/planning-related exceptions in partnership with Pricing, Packaging &amp; title: Senior Client Success Manager
locationName: New York, New York, United States
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is hiring a Sr. </strong><strong>Client Success Manager</strong><strong> to join our Revenue Operations Team to own the account management of direct and programmatic deals for some of our East Coast-based clients.</strong></p> <p>Business Insider is for people who are driven, optimistic and always looking forward. Our mission is to inspire action through thought-provoking stories. We tell our audience what they want and need to know to improve their lives and the world with storytelling that is accessible, smart, sometimes unexpected, and always helpful. Our team members embody and uphold Business Insider’s three core values: we are all one team, we are effective, and we get better every day.</p> <p><strong>The Role &amp; Team:</strong></p> <p>The Client Success team is responsible for ensuring a strategic and successful partnership with clients across our full digital product suite including branded content, display media, video, social, and other media/content tactics. The Client Success team works collaboratively to fulfill booked revenue, drive incremental revenue and client renewals. We are an inclusive team that values creativity, accountability, and diversity of ideas and opinions.</p> <p>The Sr. Client Success Manager will work directly with our clients and collaborate cross-functionally with our Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Finance teams to ensure our client partnerships are successful. The Sr. Client Success Manager will manage all aspects of their campaigns during the post-sale cycle, providing an end-to-end experience for our direct and programmatic advertising partners.</p> <p>The Sr. Client Success Manager will be partnership-oriented, bringing great communication and listening skills to the role. This person will have strong problem-solving skills and an ability to deep-dive into data to understand trends. This person will be comfortable communicating the story behind campaign performance, making actionable recommendations to internal and external partners. They are a team player who is excited about working in an inclusive environment and getting better every day.</p> <p>This role reports directly to the Associate Director of Client Success and sits on the Revenue Strategy team. This position is based in our New York City HQ with an in-office presence of at least 2 days per week.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Provide white-glove client service on direct and programmatic digital advertising campaigns; act as the primary contact for post-sale execution and performance.</li> <li>Work closely with sales and media planning counterparts in an assigned pod, providing regular feedback and communication on clients/campaigns and surfacing incremental/upsell opportunities.</li> <li>Become an expert on all sold campaign elements, from creating kick-off call decks, to leading kick-off calls with internal and external stakeholders, to becoming the lead point of contact post-sale.</li> <li>Work closely with the ad operations, media planning and project management teams to monitor creative implementation, media execution, delivery and performance; ensure campaign KPIs are optimized and achieved throughout the campaign life cycle.</li> <li>Analyze campaign performance metrics, providing real-time optimization recommendations, and creating mid-campaign insights to encourage upsell opportunities.</li> <li>Work with the ad operations team to troubleshoot any creative issues that impact tracking or reporting to ensure limited discrepancies.</li> <li>Stay on top of pacing issues and any potential revenue movement within our OMS to ensure accurate revenue forecasting for the leadership team; escalate issues as necessary.</li> <li>Lead the entire wrap report process, including strategic and thoughtful campaign recaps, learnings, recommendations, and performance insights.</li> </ul> <p><strong>The Ideal Candidate Has:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience in digital advertising, specifically experience with account management at a publisher or agency.</li> <li>Working knowledge and understanding of the programmatic advertising ecosystem.</li> <li>Working knowledge and understanding of data segmentation, nuances of cookie vs. cookieless targeting and data / content insights</li> <li>Experience being managed remotely and working with remote teams.</li> <li>Experience managing external partners and/or clients.</li> <li>Strong technical skills and experience with ad technology platforms, digital marketing platforms, social media platforms, and analytics tools (such as: Salesforce, Permutive, AdBook, Boostr, Operative, GAM, Google Analytics, Parse.ly, Pressboard, Facebook).</li> <li>Strong time management skills, attention to detail, organizational skills, multi-tasking abilities, presentation skills, written and verbal communication skills, problem-solving and negotiation skills.</li> <li>Thrives in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment; is flexible and adaptable; is a self-starter, collaborative and intrapreneurial.</li> <li>Proficient working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite &amp; Google Suite.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Salary &amp;&nbsp;</strong><strong>Benefits</strong><strong>:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Base salary: $95,000 - $105,000 (dependent on skills, experience, and competencies)</li> <li>Bonus available in addition to base salary</li> <li>Flexible PTO, 10 paid holidays, and 16 weeks of parental leave</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans</li> <li>Matched and vested 401k plan</li> <li>Access to resources for financial planning guidance, family planning services, mental health reachout and Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)</li> <li>Additional benefits include commuter benefits, phone reimbursement, gym membership discounts, and more&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment&nbsp; title: Senior Software Engineer
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is hiring a&nbsp;</strong><strong>Senior Software Engineer</strong><strong> to join our </strong><strong>Content Platform team.</strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Business Insider is for people who are driven, optimistic and always looking forward. Our mission is to inspire action through thought-provoking stories. We tell our audience what they want and need to know to improve their lives and the world with storytelling that is accessible, smart, sometimes unexpected, and always helpful. Our team members embody and uphold Business Insider’s three core values: we are all one team, we are effective, and we get better every day.</p> <p><strong>Role &amp; Team</strong></p> <p>The Senior Software Engineer will<strong> </strong>work closely with other engineers and our Product team to design and build world-class services and APIs that are reliable, scalable, and performant. If you are passionate about improving existing technologies and building brand new applications, have an innate curiosity for how things work, and enjoy collaborating with a diverse group of people, this is the opportunity for you.</p> <p>The Content Platform team is responsible for content publishing and delivery services supporting a diverse set of upstream and downstream clients (CMS and related editorial tools, web/mobile frontends, sitemaps, syndication, etc.). As an engineer on the team managing databases, APIs, and related technologies that propagate our content across the web, you will play a key role in supporting the growth of the company.</p> <p>The Content platform at Business Insider consists of multiple independent services written primarily in JavaScript/TypeScript (with some Golang), and our primary database is MongoDB. We use AWS as our public cloud. The team commonly uses Terraform, Lambda, SNS/SQS, Docker, and Kubernetes (EKS) for day to day work. In addition to publishing and delivery APIs, other platform responsibilities include: cache management, data syncing and denormalization, and various third-party integrations.</p> <p>The Senior Software Engineer reports directly to the Director of Cloud Engineering and sits on the Content Platform team. This role will be based in Belfast and offers an in office or work from home / hybrid opportunity.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Partnering with engineers to execute business requirements and technical improvements</li> <li>Being proactive and taking ownership of key systems and projects</li> <li>Breaking down complex problems into achievable, prioritized tasks</li> <li>Taking initiative on design challenges to build robust, performant systems</li> <li>Applying engineering best practices to ensure system correctness and resilience</li> <li>Mentoring junior engineers</li> </ul> <p><strong>The Ideal Candidate Has</strong></p> <ul> <li>Writing clean, maintainable, production-grade code in a modern programming language&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience in using JavaScript/Typescript on the server.</li> <li>Understanding system architecture and downstream effects of code changes</li> <li>Clear communication (both written and verbal)&nbsp;</li> <li>General knowledge of content databases (noSQL experience a bonus)</li> <li>Ability to implement unit, integration, and functional tests</li> <li>Experience in fullstack development</li> <li>Adaptable and willingness to try new tools, technologies, packages, etc.&nbsp;</li> <li>Team oriented mindset</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus points</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience working with web APIs</li> <li>Familiarity with CI/CD processes</li> <li>Experience working in Golang</li> <li>Familiarity with Agile development processes</li> <li>You have worked in prior experience in the&nbsp; media industry</li> </ul> <p><strong>Our engineering organisation values</strong></p> <ul> <li>Mentoring junior developers and building a collaborative culture</li> <li>Passionate engineers who love taking the initiative with a high level of ownership</li> <li>Producing high-quality code, following and improving best practices, and identifying solutions through constructive feedback and review</li> <li>Highlighting our team's work and giving back to the tech community through tech talks, writing docs, open-source projects, and blogging</li> </ul> <p><strong>Salary &amp; Benefits&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Market Leading Salary: (dependent on skills, experience, and competencies)</li> <li>Hybrid flexible working - our amazing City Centre office or your home, the choice is yours.*(Candidates must reside permanently in Northern Ireland)</li> <li>25 days annual leave + Bank Holidays</li> <li>Unrivalled culture and working environment with regular socials and company events</li> <li>Private Medical Insurance</li> <li>Health cash plan&nbsp;</li> <li>Life assurance&nbsp;</li> <li>Employee assistance programme</li> <li>Highly competitive family leave policies and access to our family benefits platform, Maven, offering support for employee preconception, pregnancy &amp; postpartum.</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p style="text-align: left;">Are you passionate about this opportunity, but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for?
