title: Social Media Fellow, Video Distribution (January 2026)
description: <div class="gmail-p-rich_text_section"> <div class="gmail-p-rich_text_section"> <p>Business Insider is hiring a social media fellow to distribute videos across various social networks and platforms. This is a full-time, six-month paid position, Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.&nbsp; ET.&nbsp;</p> <p>Social media fellows will manage and schedule posts across various social channels. They will also assist the distribution team in reaching its goals on platforms such as YouTube, Snapchat, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok. Fellows are responsible for distributing new videos on social channels and recirculating dozens of evergreen archive videos daily. They will help to distribute videos published during the day shift, including breaking news. They work with content from all verticals on the video team and also help organize and maintain our archives. Additionally, they track statistics and analyze data, working collaboratively to develop our social media strategies. The ideal candidate must be an independent worker. Social media fellows work closely not only with our distribution team but also with producers and editors. They should be comfortable working with teams across the company.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>This individual should possess excellent news judgment, as they will be expected to work quickly and accurately to publish urgent news stories, identify evergreen stories, manage our support requests, and assist with weekend scheduling.&nbsp; This position requires working in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously. Fellows should be able to pivot seamlessly from one task to the next. They should be self-sufficient and capable of making editorially sound judgment calls. They should be open to feedback from team members and demonstrate a willingness to apply and retain it.</p> <p>Our social media accounts are the face of our brands, and our social media team members play a crucial role in managing our expanding network. All our fellows should have:</p> <ul> <li>Familiarity with the Business Insider brands</li> <li>Experience with and a passion for digital storytelling and social media</li> <li>Experience in packaging stories for social media</li> <li>Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to multitask</li> <li>Proofreading and copyediting skills</li> <li>The ability to work quickly and collaboratively with a fast-paced team</li> <li>The ability to problem-solve independently</li> <li>Attention to detail</li> </ul> <p>Additionally, for the distribution team, we’re looking for someone with the following:</p> <ul> <li>Work experience with one or more social media platforms</li> <li>Experience working with breaking news</li> <li>Experience working with editorial teams and/or journalism outlets</li> <li>Knowledge of social video</li> <li>Experience with content management systems</li> <li>Experience with Photoshop</li> <li>Interest in data collection and analysis</li> <li>Confidence in working in a fast-paced environment and multitasking</li> </ul> </div> <div class="gmail-p-rich_text_section"> <p><strong>Additionally, all of our editorial fellows should have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>A passion for digital storytelling and voracious reading habits</li> <li>Familiarity with digital and social media</li> <li>The ability to work quickly and collaboratively with a fast-paced team</li> <li>Proofreading and copyediting skills</li> <li>A love of Business Insider and our mission to serve readers with the information and inspiration they need in a way that’s accurate, fair, fast, and fun&nbsp;</li> </ul> </div> <div class="gmail-p-rich_text_section"><strong>Salary &amp; Benefits:</strong></div> <ul class="gmail-p-rich_text_list gmail-p-rich_text_list__bullet"> <li>Fellows are paid $20 per hour (overtime when needed and approved)</li> <li>PTO and paid holidays</li> <li>Eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits on 91st day of employment</li> </ul> </div> <p><strong>Please apply with a resume and cover letter&nbsp;and specify why you're interested in working on this team.</strong>&nbsp;If you’d like some tips, check out our <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/why-this-is-an-excellent-resume-2013-11" target="_blank">best practices guide</a>.</p> <p>The Business Insider Fellowship Program is designed for early-career journalists seeking to grow their media careers. Fellows are assigned to teams and become experts in digital storytelling. They produce real work that is distributed to our audience of millions, and by the end of six months, they will have developed new skills and gained industry experience. For more information on the Business Insider Fellowship Program, see <a href="https://www.insider-inc.com/careers/fellowship-program">here</a>.</p> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment decisions, does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality or national origin, religion, disability, familial status, and military or veteran status. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented groups to apply.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p style="text-align: left;">Are you passionate about this opportunity, but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for? We still want to hear from you! Apply online and let us know why you would make a great addition to Business Insider.</p></div>

title: Vice President, Tech Sales
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is seeking a Vice President of Tech Sales to lead our most strategic advertising partnerships across the technology and telecommunications sector.</strong> This role is tailor-made for a seasoned digital media executive with deep, active relationships at Google, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and other top-tier tech and telco marketers.</p> <p>Business Insider is for people who are driven, optimistic and always looking forward. Our mission is to inspire action through thought-provoking stories. We tell our audience what they want and need to know to improve their lives and the world with storytelling that is accessible, smart, sometimes unexpected, and always helpful. Our team members embody and uphold Business Insider’s three core values: we are all one team, we are effective, and we get better every day.</p> <p>This is a rare opportunity to join Business Insider at a pivotal moment of growth, as we expand our influence and double down on our mission to be the most beloved and impactful business media brand in the world.</p> <p><strong>The Role &amp; Team:</strong></p> <p>The Vice President of Tech Sales reports directly to the Global Head of Sales and sits on the Ad Sales team. This position is based in San Franscisco.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Own the tech and telco category across Business Insider’s advertising business, building and scaling high-impact partnerships with the most important brands in tech and telco.</li> <li>Lead a high-performing team of five senior Account Directors across the U.S., setting a standard for creative selling, strategic thinking, and operational excellence.<br>Drive strategic growth by working closely with executive leadership to shape go-to-market strategy, set category priorities, and deliver against revenue goals.</li> <li>Be the face of BI in the tech industry evangelizing our platform, building client trust, and creating world-class programs that deliver real results.</li> <li>Develop and close custom advertising solutions that span branded content, display, video, programmatic, data, and live/virtual events.</li> <li>Serve as a player-coach, managing C-level relationships directly while empowering your team to do the same.</li> <li>Inspire collaboration across Marketing, Studio, Client Services, and Planning to deliver breakthrough programs and campaigns.</li> </ul> <p><strong>The Ideal Candidate Has:</strong></p> <ul> <li>A senior sales leader with 10+ years in digital media and a proven record of building major advertising partnerships in the tech space.</li> <li>Deeply connected in the industry with direct relationships at Google, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and their agency partners.</li> <li>A strategic seller who thrives on unlocking new revenue opportunities and can think creatively on the fly.</li> <li>A team-first leader who leads with integrity, lifts others up, and fosters a culture of performance, collaboration, and innovation.<br>An expert in digital platforms with a strong understanding of programmatic, branded content, audience solutions, and how they map to client goals.</li> <li>A compelling communicator who can translate insight into opportunity and ideas into action.</li> <li>Curious, motivated, and excited to build the next era of Business Insider’s success.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Salary &amp; Benefits:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Base salary: $220,000-$250,000</li> <li>Additonal bonus/commission&nbsp;</li> <li>Flexible PTO, 10 paid holidays, and 16 weeks of parental leave</li> <li>Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans</li> <li>Matched and vested 401k plan</li> <li>Access to resources for financial planning guidance, family planning services, mental health reachout and Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)</li> <li>Additional benefits include commuter benefits, phone reimbursement, gym membership discounts, and more.</li> </ul> <p>Business Insider is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and, when making employment&nbsp; decisions, does not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual orientation, age, nationality or national origin, religion, disability, familial status, and military or veteran status. We encourage members of traditionally underrepresented groups to apply.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p style="text-align: left;">Are you passionate about this opportunity, but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for? We still want to hear from you! Apply online and let us know why you would make a great addition to Business Insider.</p></div>

title: Weekend Editor, O&O
description: <p><strong>Business Insider is seeking an Editor in our UK newsroom to execute our audience strategy on the weekends during UK hours, and support on homepage curation, push alerts, and social channels during the week. This person will work on a Thursday-Monday schedule.</strong></p> <p><strong>The Role &amp; Team:</strong></p> <p>We’re looking for a Weekend Editor who is excited to help drive BI’s audience strategy on Saturdays and Sundays, and help manage our daily Owned and Operated (O&amp;O) operations during the week.</p> <p>As Weekend Editor, you are primarily responsible for closely monitoring, updating, and curating our homepage, push alerts, and social channels on the weekends to ensure that our core audience is seeing the stories that matter the most.&nbsp;</p> <p>We’re looking for a self-starter who is ready to pitch in for edits whenever necessary. You should also be prepared to jump into the news and write breaking stories yourself on occasion on a Saturday or Sunday.&nbsp;</p> <p>This person will be the sole UK editor on shift on the weekends and will work closely with the Editor-in-Chief during New York morning hours on a Saturday and Sunday.&nbsp;</p> <p>On weekdays, you will help manage homepage operations and curation, manage posting on social channels, edit and send our morning newsletters, team up with the US-based subscription team on marketing emails, and help manage UK app push alert operations. You will sub in as team leader whenever the Senior Editor is out. You will also proactively partner with the creative team on the homepage, app, and newsletter imagery. There will also be opportunities to edit a range of stories during the week - from scoops to breaking news to analysis.</p> <p>This role is varied, fast-paced, and will require you to coordinate with Business Insider's global newsroom. We operate in a hybrid environment, and this position includes in-person collaboration at our Old Street-based office. This role reports into the Senior Editor for O&amp;O.</p> <p><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Ensure our site and social channels have coverage of big stories on Saturdays and Sundays. That includes writing stubs and stories in breaking news situations, sending push alerts when relevant, and actively curating the homepage.</li> <li>Understand our core audience and suggest compelling headlines or assignments for our main platforms.</li> <li>Support the Senior Editor in managing daily O&amp;O operations and strategy: homepage curation, approving and sending push alerts, conducting headline testing, editing and sending our morning newsletters, and more.</li> <li>Inform the team about how to succeed on O&amp;O: Share insights and trends around loyal audience reading habits, and proactively spot stories from competitors.</li> <li>Partner with the subscriptions marketing team and O&amp;O leadership on email news alerts, monthly subscriber-focused emails, and other subscription-focused writing and curation.</li> </ul> <p><strong>The ideal candidate has:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Previous experience working as an editor or reporter on a fast-paced beat.</li> <li>Excellent news judgment and headline framing skills.</li> <li>Ability to work quickly and independently under pressure.</li> <li>Excellent editing and writing skills.</li> <li>Passion for collaboration, as well as top-notch communication skills, as the role requires working with teams operating across time zones.&nbsp;</li> <li>Meticulous attention to detail.</li> <li>A strong sense of what makes a great story.</li> <li>Experience using analytics to help inform coverage.</li> <li>Ability and willingness to pivot quickly and multi-task across platforms.</li> <li>A desire to work collaboratively with the team in the UK and wider global newsroom.</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p style="text-align: left;">Are you passionate about this opportunity, but worried that you don’t have 100% of the experience we’re looking for? We still want to hear from you! Apply online and let us know why you would make a great addition to Business Insider.</p></div>

title: DVM Student Externship/Preceptorship Program — Archer Veterinary Clinic (Sees Exotics)
description: <p><strong>We're making an investment in the next generation of veterinary doctors!</strong></p> <p>As part of the professional veterinary curriculum, colleges encourage off-campus educational experiences in practices outside of the teaching hospital. Practical experience in a well-run and contemporary practice can be a valuable component of your veterinary education, preparing you to deliver better care after graduation. Our program is dedicated to contributing to your practice-readiness and to help you hit the ground running after graduation.</p> <p><strong>Our program structure:</strong></p> <p>Our externships are flexible—they can range from two to eight weeks during the year, according to your college curriculum – but are typically two or three weeks in length. Your schedule will include days, evenings and weekends.&nbsp;</p> <p>Our externship rotations are designed to allow students, under veterinary supervision, to practice the problem-solving, technical and communication skills that they have acquired during their clinical preparation. Externs are given the opportunity to work alongside our veterinary team and are encouraged to participate in all aspects of patient care.&nbsp;A stipend of $250 per week will be provided.</p> <p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong></p> <p>Externs experience the typical caseload of a small animal practice. Under the supervision of your mentor doctor you will gather histories, perform physical examinations, develop diagnostic and therapeutic plans, scrub in to surgery, assist in the management of medical cases, provide wellness care, develop your client communication skills, polish your technical skills and produce appropriate medical records (SOAPs) within the time limits of daily practice.</p> <p><strong>Who we're looking for:</strong></p> <p>Extern students are expected to be enthusiastic and effective participants in our patient care activities, upholding the professional and ethical standards of our practice. Students participating in the externship program are suggested to review the Veterinary Practice Act in regard to the scope of duties that may be performed, and to be familiar with the type and degree of veterinary supervision that is required. These should be followed carefully in order to protect both yourself and our practice.</p> <p>As a veterinary student extern, we expect you to dress and behave in a professional manner and to meet the expectations that we have of all team members as outlined in our employee handbook.</p> <p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Be enrolled in an accredited DVM program.</li> <li>You are authorized to work in the United States.</li> <li>You must carry professional liability insurance. AVMA PLIT liability insurance is free for all student members of the AVMA. You may apply for this coverage on their <a href="http://www.avmaplit.com/products/student-liability/">website</a>. Please check to make sure your coverage is current and submit a certificate of coverage with your application.</li> </ul> <p><strong>About us:</strong></p> <p>As sponsors of the Veterinary Externship Program, we see ourselves to be part of your educational team, providing instruction, mentoring and evaluation of the students who participate. You will be assigned a mentor and work on the learning objectives as defined by your college program or to meet your specific goals. At the end of the externship your mentor will provide a written evaluation of your performance as required by your college program.</p> <p>We look forward to working with you!</p>

title: Account Director
description: <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Lead clients — and their teams — to achieve progress and impact. </strong>In this role, you’ll work in our London office to take our clients’ complex problems, break them down into solvable pieces, and match them with Blue State’s teams and expertise. You’ll serve as a close partner to key clients, instinctively understanding their business challenges and translating them into briefs that inspire our strategy and delivery teams. You’ll lead and facilitate smart conversations with a variety of organisations, challenging their thinking to ensure we deliver the best possible outcome. Candidates from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is the purpose-driven creative and tech agency for brands and causes looking to inspire people to take action and drive create real change. With clients including the UNHCR, Google, Amnesty International, UNICEF, Medicines Sans Frontiers (MSF) and Oxfam, Blue State cultivates and mobilises communities, raises money and influences policy, builds platforms, and transforms how organisations engage their most important people. Led by some of the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is an independent agency and has 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Drive leadership on accounts ensuring you have a clear view of clients’ objectives and organisational context</li> <li>Consult with clients on project needs and status, and develop trusted relationships with key client stakeholders</li> <li>Lead projects and wider accounts ensuring we’re adding value in work delivered while continually evolving the partnership</li> <li>Plan, schedule and estimate costs, managing the day-to-day running of creative and delivery teams - facilitating and leading productive teams and conversations</li> <li>Have a clear view on Blue State’s vision, working closely with new and existing organisations to help them understand the value we can add and potential opportunities to work together from first contact to contract</li> <li>Have a finger on the pulse of cutting-edge developments taking place in tech and digital organizing - inviting opinions from peers and sharing our point of view with clients</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team&nbsp;</strong></h2> <p>At Blue State, our accounts team is at the heart of everything we do. We relish the challenges that have never been solved. We are close partners with our clients, understanding their needs, worries and hopes and translating that into inspirational charges for our creative teams. We are intensely curious and love new digital platforms, tools and social networks. Our energy and our passion is contagious.</p> <h2><strong>What we offer</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Unlimited time-off (inclusive of sick, personal, and vacation days)</li> <li>$1,250 annually in professional development funds (local equivalent)</li> <li>Fully subsidised health and dental insurance for employees (subject to tax)</li> <li>Generous pension match via salary sacrifice</li> <li>Generous paid holiday schedule</li> <li>Parental leave policy for up to 32.5 week of coverage at full pay, inclusive of all genders and supporting a range of family structures</li> <li>Group Income Protection (GIP)</li> <li>Group Life Assurance (GLA)</li> <li>Optional holiday travel insurance</li> <li>Pre-tax season ticket loans</li> <li>Cycle to work (up to £2000)</li> <li>Remote work flexibility</li> </ul> <p>We approach in-office working with a hybrid model, with presence in our office required at two days per week.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>5+ years experience in client services, digital marketing, fundraising or a related area</li> <li>Experience in selling and leading digitally-driven campaigns designed to mobilise communities or drive behaviour change</li> <li>A track record of developing client relationships and growing accounts</li> <li>Excellent written and oral communication skills, team oriented mindset, attention to detail</li> <li>Teamwork and scrappiness required.</li> <li>Ability to adapt to new situations, think on your feet and communicate with those around you.&nbsp;</li> <li>A shared passion and curiosity for making change and redefining how business is done. This includes comfort with ambiguity, a restlessness that resists the status quo and a commitment to quality that ensures we’re always making progress</li> <li>Empathy, communication, respect - you’ll act as a role model and set the standard at Blue State</li> <li>Ability to be resourceful, inspired, and self-driven while jumping in to play different roles on a project</li> <li>Confidence to guide clients at a senior, C-suite level</li> </ul> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don’t think your current skill set checks every box, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.</p> <p>Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, including the use of AI tools throughout the hiring process, please contact us at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:recruiting@bluestate.co">recruiting@bluestate.co</a> with the <strong>subject line: Accommodation Request</strong> to get started.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Your privacy is important to us. &nbsp;You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our <a href="https://www.bluestate.co/privacy-policy-for-recruitment/">Privacy Policy for Recruitment</a>.&nbsp;</p></div>

title: Account Manager
description: <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Steering fundraising clients and projects to achieve greatness. </strong>Looking for a Account Manager experienced in delivering digital marketing projects, to help lead a large global UN account working in partnership with the strategy and creative team.&nbsp; Initially,&nbsp; the Account Manager would be responsible for managing the paid media and creative services in 4 key markets: Denmark, Italy, UK, Switzerland.</p> <p>The Account Manager will be responsible for building client relationships; service and grow the accounts. As they lead programmes and projects, they will manage resources within and outside Blue State to meet the objectives of clients, developing plans to make these objectives possible, setting (and exceeding) expectations.They will oversee the creative and strategic services we offer clients. They’ll lead meetings—both client-facing and internal—and produce follow-up documentations,&nbsp; project proposals including financials, and scopes for a variety of digital projects.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is the purpose-driven creative and tech agency for brands and causes looking to inspire people to take action and drive create real change. With clients including the UNHCR, Google, Amnesty International, UNICEF, Medicines Sans Frontiers (MSF) and Oxfam, Blue State cultivates and mobilises communities, raises money and influences policy, builds platforms, and transforms how organisations engage their most important people. Led by some of the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is an independent agency and has 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Drive leadership on accounts ensuring you have a clear view of clients’ objectives and organisational context</li> <li>Consult with clients on project needs and status, and develop trusted relationships with key client stakeholders</li> <li>Lead projects and wider accounts ensuring we’re adding value in work delivered while continually evolving the partnership</li> <li>Plan, schedule and estimate costs, managing the day-to-day running of creative and delivery teams - facilitating and leading productive teams and conversations</li> <li>Have a clear view on Blue State’s vision, working closely with new and existing organisations to help them understand the value we can add and potential opportunities to work together from first contact to contract</li> <li>Have a finger on the pulse of cutting-edge developments taking place in tech and digital organizing - inviting opinions from peers and sharing our point of view with clients</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team&nbsp;</strong></h2> <p>At Blue State, our accounts team is at the heart of everything we do. We relish the challenges that have never been solved. We are close partners with our clients, understanding their needs, worries and hopes and translating that into inspirational charges for our creative teams. We are intensely curious and love new digital platforms, tools and social networks. Our energy and our passion is contagious.</p> <h2><strong>What we offer</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Unlimited time-off (inclusive of sick, personal, and vacation days)</li> <li>$1,250 annually in professional development funds (local equivalent)</li> <li>Fully subsidised health and dental insurance for employees (subject to tax)</li> <li>Generous pension match via salary sacrifice</li> <li>Generous paid holiday schedule</li> <li>Parental leave policy for up to 32.5 week of coverage at full pay, inclusive of all genders and supporting a range of family structures</li> <li>Group Income Protection (GIP)</li> <li>Group Life Assurance (GLA)</li> <li>Optional holiday travel insurance</li> <li>Pre-tax season ticket loans</li> <li>Cycle to work (up to £2000)</li> <li>Remote work flexibility</li> </ul> <p>We approach in-office working with a hybrid model, with presence in our office required at two days per week.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>4-6 years of experience in Digital Account Management or Digital Fundraising&nbsp;</li> <li>Great understanding of digital marketing, particularly on paid media, fundraising, content, CRM, or data.&nbsp;</li> <li>Must be good with managing multiple projects at once</li> <li>Thrives in a fast moving environments and able to pivot in line with real world events / emergencies / changing requirements.</li> <li>Must have a passion and some level of experience with nonprofit/charity fundraising and marketing - ideally through paid digital advertising but general awareness of how fundraising and direct response campaigns work is desirable.</li> <li>Problem solving, proactive solution focussed mindset&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience managing and aligning multiple stakeholders; and facilitating meetings.&nbsp;</li> <li>Project Management Experience: being able to effectively brief teams and managing multiple projects at once from start to finish</li> <li>Strong communication skills (both internally and externally)&nbsp;</li> <li>Great presentation skills (both making decks and presenting to stakeholders)</li> <li>Highly organised and detail oriented</li> <li>Experience working with digital fundraising or marketing for nonprofits&nbsp;</li> <li>Understanding of digital agency processes (either having worked in a digital agency or having directly managed the relationship with the agency)&nbsp;</li> <li>Great collaborator with empathy, communication, respect as core values</li> <li>Able to navigate high level conversations, including difficult ones when needed</li> <li>Experience nurturing client relationships and upselling. Knowing when to challenge clients and spotting opportunities</li> </ul> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don’t think your current skill set checks every box, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.</p> <p>Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, including the use of AI tools throughout the hiring process, please contact us at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:recruiting@bluestate.co">recruiting@bluestate.co</a> with the <strong>subject line: Accommodation Request</strong> to get started.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Your privacy is important to us. &nbsp;You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our <a href="https://www.bluestate.co/privacy-policy-for-recruitment/">Privacy Policy for Recruitment</a>.&nbsp;</p></div>

title: Associate Director, Media Planning & Buying (Fundraising)
description: <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Execute innovative marketing strategy through a diverse channel mix, for leading NGOs, charities and brands.</strong> As an Associate Director in the Paid Media Team, you'll oversee the execution of digital advertising campaigns across clients ranging from leading UK and global charities and UN bodies, to global brands and their CSR programmes.</p> <p>You will know how to drive strong performance metrics for clients, whilst thinking holistically about the brand and how these metrics contribute to wider conversation about marketing budgets and long-term growth objectives. You will be a senior member of our media practice in London, supporting the Media Director in shaping processes and innovating our client channel mix to drive results.</p> <p>This may be the right role for you if you’re someone who is equally strategic, creative, and analytical. Switching seamlessly from a client presentation to writing an insightful analysis of campaign performance, and rolling up your sleeves to launch advertising campaigns in new platforms are no big deal for you. You’re used to spending most of your day speaking in acronyms — terms like CPA, DSP, VTR, and ROAS are a natural part of your vocabulary — and you know how to explain them to clients and colleagues.&nbsp;</p> <p>You will use your depth of experience to inform your work but also use your curiosity to keep ahead of the changing sector in order to ensure we’re innovating for our clients wherever possible.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is the purpose-driven creative and tech agency for brands and causes looking to inspire people to take action and drive create real change. With clients including the UNHCR, Google, Amnesty International, UNICEF, Medicines Sans Frontiers (MSF) and Oxfam, Blue State cultivates and mobilises communities, raises money and influences policy, builds platforms, and transforms how organisations engage their most important people. Led by some of the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is an independent agency with 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <ul> <li><strong>Translate clients’ strategic visions into media objectives and KPIs</strong> to accomplish a wide range of client objectives including direct response (lead gen and fundraising), awareness, persuasion, and advocacy.</li> <li><strong>Analyse ongoing and historical performance data </strong>to identify opportunities for improvement, make strategic recommendations, and generate reporting and insights to drive optimisation.</li> <li><strong>Have a strong POV on measurement, attribution, and conversion tracking, </strong>and apply that knowledge to strategic recommendations and ongoing campaign management.</li> <li><strong>Participate in (and frequently lead) client-facing interactions </strong>— you’ll be the subject-matter expert for the platforms you manage.</li> <li><strong>Plan, build, manage, and optimise </strong>media campaigns across multiple platforms, and oversee others in the team across multiple accounts to ensure media buying is efficient, effective and compliant.&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Work collaboratively with other internal or external teams,</strong> including media planners, strategists, account directors, designers, and analysts, to produce campaigns, creative ideas, audience and target recommendations, and experimental designs.</li> <li><strong>Be an internal and external thought leader and help keep us up to date with the latest digital media trends&nbsp;</strong>by maintaining relationships with media partners, and engaging in media R&amp;D projects, writing blog posts, and participating on panels.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team</strong></h2> <p>As part of the Media team, you’ll work closely with a cross-disciplinary group of Blue State employees on various projects. London is a small and close-knit team, where everyone has an opportunity to shape new approaches, grow and learn from their colleagues, and take advantage of a personal development fund to stretch their skills even further. You’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring charities, ambitious brands and passionate advocacy and social change campaigns.</p> <h2><strong>What we offer</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Unlimited time off (inclusive of sick, personal and vacation days)</li> <li>$1,250 annual in professional development funds (local equivalent)</li> <li>Fully subsidised health and dental insurance for employees (subject to tax)</li> <li>Generous pension match via salary sacrifice&nbsp;</li> <li>Generous paid holiday schedule&nbsp;</li> <li>Parental leave policy for up to 32.5 week of coverage at full pay, inclusive of all genders and supporting a range of family structures</li> <li>Group Income Protection (GIP)</li> <li>Group Life Assurance (GLA)</li> <li>Optional holiday travel insurance</li> <li>Pre-tax season ticket loans</li> <li>Cycle to work (up to £2000)</li> <li>Remote work flexibility</li> </ul> <p>We approach in-office working with a hybrid model, with presence in our office required at two days per week.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>6-8 years experience in a hands-on paid media planning and buying role using a mix of digital channels (Social, Search, Display, Video, Audio, etc)&nbsp;</li> <li>Demonstrated experience translating client business goals into cohesive media strategies and specific KPIs, and a record executing campaigns that delivered on those goals.</li> <li>Ability to effectively manage multiple clients and projects on time, within budget, and meet performance goals.</li> <li>High proficiency communicate with those around you.&nbsp;</li> <li>A shared passion and curiosity for delivering change. title: Business Development Director
description: <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Help us win new dream clients by collaborating with our industry-leading creative, strategy, and technical teams. </strong>We are seeking a Business Development Director to join our team and partner with office leadership to grow our business.<strong> </strong>In this role, you will have the rare opportunity to work with a client base that spans across corporate, nonprofit, and political sectors. If you want to be proud of your clients, then this might be the position for you.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is a purpose-driven agency. We partner with leading causes, brands, and campaigns and create real change. From Google and UNICEF to Amnesty International and Oxfam, we transform how brands and causes raise money, influence policy, build platforms, and grow communities of supporters. Led by the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is an independent agency and has 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Manage proposal and pitch process</li> <li>Sell Blue State offerings and services to brands, nonprofits, and advocacy organizations</li> <li>Develop and present new creative concepts to prospective clients in collaboration with experts from our creative, strategic, technical and account management teams</li> <li>Communicate Blue State's value proposition to prospective clients in a manner appropriate for the target audience of C Suite executive and/or nonprofit leadership</li> <li>Develop contracts and scopes of work in collaboration with internal teams to help set pricing, client goals, and program objectives</li> <li>Negotiate pricing and scope of work with prospect</li> <li>Build, manage and continually develop a sales pipeline to achieve new business targets</li> <li>Originate and develop new leads in targeted verticals through traditional and creative approaches to outbound sales</li> <li>Attend conferences, promote Blue State collateral, and collaborate with the marketing team to generate awareness of Blue State</li> <li>Qualify and manage inbound leads</li> <li>Regularly report to office leadership and executive leadership on pipeline development</li> <li>Manage pipeline through Salesforce</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team&nbsp;</strong></h2> <p>The Partnerships Team drives Blue State's growth. We are the face of Blue State to prospective clients. We help prospects see opportunities more clearly and we help Blue State understand the challenges our prospects face. We find solutions to complex business challenges. And we work with our colleagues to persuasively articulate creative, strategic, and technical ideas to executives and practitioners alike.</p> <h2><strong>What we offer</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Unlimited time-off (inclusive of sick, personal, and vacation days)</li> <li>$1,250 annually in professional development funds</li> <li>Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance</li> <li>Flexible and health savings accounts</li> <li>401K &amp; employer match</li> <li>Generous paid holiday schedule</li> <li>12-week fully-paid parental leave for all parents-to-be</li> <li>Short-term and long-term disability insurance</li> <li>Pre-tax commuter benefits</li> <li>Remote work flexibility</li> </ul> <p>We approach in-office working with a hybrid model. On-site presence is welcome for US staff who are within commuting distance of the NY or DC office. Managers retain discretion to require in-person attendance for folks on their discipline or client teams as necessary, including for those whose roles require them to be in person.</p> <p>The salary range for this position is $95,000-$120,000; compensation will be commensurate with experience.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>7+ years of experience in business development or account management within an agency, public relations, or communications firm, or directly comparable experience working inside a corporation or institution</li> <li>Extensive direct experience working within the nonprofit, or corporate vertical, either inside a relevant corporation or institution, or as a vendor or service provider</li> <li>Proven track record of managing and building relationships with new clients or the ability to retain and grow existing clients</li> <li>A proven track record of delivering consistent revenue growth</li> <li>History of consultative sales with large average deal size strongly preferred</li> <li>Exceptional communication skills and ability to write quickly</li> <li>Entrepreneurial, self-motivated mentality; driven at all times to meet and exceed goals</li> <li>Ability to work with all levels within the team and across the organization</li> <li>Excellent in-person presentation skills, relationship building and experience in contract negotiation</li> <li>Comfortable with high volume of client interaction both in person and through phone and email</li> <li>Impeccable ethical standards and professional presence</li> </ul> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don’t think your current skill set checks every box, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.</p> <p>Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, including the use of AI tools throughout the hiring process, please contact us at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:recruiting@bluestate.co">recruiting@bluestate.co</a> with the <strong>subject line: Accommodation Request</strong> to get started.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Your privacy is important to us. &nbsp;You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our <a href="https://www.bluestate.co/privacy-policy-for-recruitment/">Privacy Policy for Recruitment</a>.&nbsp;</p></div>

title: Business Development Manager
description: <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Help us land our dream clients — and yours. </strong>We are seeking a Business Development Manager to join our Partnerships team to provide support to our business development team and help us grow our business. The ideal candidate is an excellent project manager and writer and has demonstrated success supporting sales or account management at an agency, consulting, or communications firm.</p> <p>You will support the Partnerships team in the pursuit of new business opportunities and help develop and manage a sales pipeline. You will work across the agency and with cross-discipline teams to develop proposals, pitches, presentations, and new scopes of work. You will help draft and project manage these deliverables and support agency thought leadership internally and externally.</p> <p>This is a rare opportunity to work with a client base that spans nonprofit, advocacy, corporate, and political campaign sectors. If you want to be a part of driving real change in the progressive space, then this might be the position for you.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is a purpose-driven agency. We partner with leading causes, brands, and campaigns and create real change. From Google and UNICEF to Amnesty International and Oxfam, we transform how brands and causes raise money, influence policy, build platforms, and grow communities of supporters. Led by the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is an independent agency and has 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <p>Manage the sales process for proposal development, pitches, and outbound efforts:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Help the Partnerships team sell Blue State’s offerings and services to brands, nonprofits, advocacy organizations, and progressive political candidates and organizations&nbsp;</li> <li>Project manage and help draft memos, proposals, pitch decks, and related collateral in collaboration with creative, strategy, and technical teams, delivering first-rate materials that target an audience of industry leaders and C-Suite executives</li> <li>Provide logistical support and process management throughout the sales lifecycle — from the proposal and pitch process through contracting&nbsp;</li> <li>Lead qualifying calls and discussions with prospective clients in partnership with VPs and SVPs on the Partnerships team</li> <li>Effectively communicate and strategize with internal teams to help meet prospective clients’ goals and their organizational objectives throughout the sales process</li> </ul> <p>Help build, manage, and continually develop a sales pipeline to achieve new business targets:</p> <ul> <li>Work with senior Partnerships leaders to bring in new leads across targeted verticals through traditional and creative approaches to outbound sales</li> <li>Conduct research on Blue State leads, prospects, and clients, and clearly communicate findings to senior leadership</li> <li>Leverage SalesForce to help manage, track and operationalize the sales pipeline; pull reports and contribute to ongoing business analysis as needed</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team&nbsp;</strong></h2> <p>The Partnerships team drives Blue State’s growth and agency brand. We are the face of Blue State to prospective clients. We build new and deepen existing client relationships. We help prospects see opportunities more clearly, and we help Blue State understand the challenges our prospects face. We find solutions to complex business challenges. And we work with our colleagues to persuasively articulate creative, strategic, and technical solutions to executives and practitioners alike.<br></p> <h2><strong>What we offer</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Unlimited time-off (inclusive of sick, personal, and vacation days)</li> <li>$1,250 annually in professional development funds</li> <li>Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance</li> <li>Flexible and health savings accounts</li> <li>401K &amp; employer match</li> <li>Generous paid holiday schedule</li> <li>12-week fully-paid parental leave for all parents-to-be</li> <li>Short-term and long-term disability insurance</li> <li>Pre-tax commuter benefits</li> <li>Remote work flexibility</li> </ul> <p>We approach in-office working with a hybrid model. On-site presence is welcome for US staff who are within commuting distance of the NY or DC office. Managers retain discretion to require in-person attendance for folks on their discipline or client teams as necessary, including for those whose roles require them to be in person.</p> <p>The salary range for this position is $73,250- $80,000; compensation will be commensurate with experience.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Minimum of 3-5 years of professional experience, ideally in business development or account/project management within an agency, consulting, or communications firm, or directly comparable experience working within a corporation or institution. Experience working within the nonprofit, advocacy, or brand sectors, or as a vendor or service provider a plus</li> <li>Entrepreneurial, self-motivated mentality and ability to mult-task</li> <li>Excellent project management, communication, collaboration, problem-solving, and relationship-building skills</li> <li>Clear, concise, and engaging business writing skills</li> <li>Comfortable working collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-driven environment alongside colleagues with complementary skills and experience</li> <li>Comfortable juggling multiple projects with competing deadlines and varying levels of complexity and project requirements&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Comfortable with a high volume of agency team and client interaction, both in-person and through phone, email, and Zoom&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience with Google Workspace, SalesForce, and other CRMs are a plus</li> <li>Impeccable ethical standards and professionalism</li> </ul> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don’t think your current skill set checks every box, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.</p> <p>Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, including the use of AI tools throughout the hiring process, please contact us at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:recruiting@bluestate.co">recruiting@bluestate.co</a> with the <strong>subject line: Accommodation Request</strong> to get started.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Your privacy is important to us. &nbsp;You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our <a href="https://www.bluestate.co/privacy-policy-for-recruitment/">Privacy Policy for Recruitment</a>.&nbsp;</p></div>

title: Contract Media Buyer (Evergreen)
description: <p>Interested in joining Blue State's Media Team? Submit your application here to ensure you're first in line for future opportunities. Please note: this is an "evergreen" job post (i.e. not an active job post), but your expression of interest matters to us. While interviews aren't ongoing, we're excited to connect with talented individuals who share our commitment to Blue State's mission.</p> <p>If you came across this job via LinkedIn, please note that it is an evergreen role; Linked In does not differentiate, but we prefer to.</p> <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Execute game-changing advertising strategies that tie engagement to the bottom line. </strong>As a Media Strategist, you'll manage the execution of digital advertising campaigns across clients ranging from leading nonprofits to political and advocacy groups to major brands (and everything in between).</p> <p>This may be the right role for you if you’re someone who is equally strategic, creative, and analytical. Switching seamlessly from a client presentation, to writing an insightful analysis of campaign performance, and rolling up your sleeves to launch new creative are no big deal for you. You’re used to spending most of your day speaking in acronyms — terms like DSP, CPA, IVT, ROAS, and AVOC are major parts of your vocabulary — and you know how to explain them to clients and teammates.&nbsp;</p> <p>You will use your depth of paid media experience to inform your work but also tap into your digital curiosity and passion for innovation to bring new ideas and thinking to the team.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is a purpose-driven agency. We partner with leading causes, brands, and campaigns and create real change. From Google and UNICEF to Amnesty International and Oxfam, we transform how brands and causes raise money, influence policy, build platforms, and grow communities of supporters. Led by the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds, Blue State is an independent agency and has 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <ul> <li><strong>Build, manage, and optimize media campaigns across multiple platforms, </strong>primarily using Facebook Business Manager, Google and Bing Ads, Google Campaign Manager 360, and the Verizon Media DSP. (Other digital channel expertise is a plus.)&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Analyze ongoing and historical performance data </strong>to identify opportunities for improvement, make strategic recommendations, and generate reporting and insights to drive optimization.</li> <li><strong>Have a strong POV on measurement, attribution, and conversion tracking, </strong>and apply that knowledge to strategic recommendations and ongoing campaign management.</li> <li><strong>Participate in client-facing interactions </strong>— you’ll be the subject-matter expert for the platforms you manager</li> <li><strong>Work collaboratively with other internal or external teams,</strong> including media planners, strategists, account directors, designers, and analysts, to produce campaigns, creative ideas, audience and target recommendations, and experimental designs.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team&nbsp;</strong></h2> <p>As part of the Paid Media team, you’ll work closely with a cross-disciplinary group of Blue State employees who are passionate, geeky, and care about their clients and causes. Blue State fosters an environment where everyone has an opportunity to shape new approaches, grow and learn from their colleagues, and take advantage of a personal development fund to stretch their skills even further. You’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring charities, ambitious brands, and passionate advocacy and social change campaigns.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>2-4 years experience in a hands-on paid media buying role using a mix of digital channels (Social, Search, Display, Video, Native, OOH, etc) - with preference to experience in executing, managing, and reporting on media campaigns with a mix of objectives/goals.</li> <li>Ability to effectively manage multiple clients and projects on time, within budget, and meet performance goals.</li> <li>High proficiency with digital advertising platforms — you ultimately want to become a master of paid social, paid search, and/or programmatic trading — as well as Google Analytics and other measurement platforms</li> <li>Exceptional attention to detail, especially with regards to campaign setup and trafficking, QA, and reporting.</li> <li>Ability to adapt to new situations, solve problems on the fly, and communicate with those around you. Teamwork and scrappiness required.</li> <li>A testing evangelist - no result is ever a problem as long as we can learn and improve in future.</li> <li>Humble in victory, constructive in defeat. We champion and expect empathy, communication, collaboration, and respect.</li> </ul> <p>Hourly rate for this position is $70-$85; compensation will be commensurate with experience.</p> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don’t think your current skill set checks every box, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.</p> <p>Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, including the use of AI tools throughout the hiring process, please contact us at&nbsp;<a href="mailto:recruiting@bluestate.co">recruiting@bluestate.co</a> with the <strong>subject line: Accommodation Request</strong> to get started.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Your privacy is important to us. &nbsp;You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our <a href="https://www.bluestate.co/privacy-policy-for-recruitment/">Privacy Policy for Recruitment</a>.&nbsp;</p></div>

title: Contract Web Developer (Evergreen)
description: <p>Interested in joining Blue State’s Tech team? Submit an application so you can be considered when a role becomes available. Please note: this is an “evergreen” job post (i.e. not an active job post), but your expression of interest matters to us. While interviews aren’t ongoing, we’re excited to connect with talented individuals who share our commitment to Blue State’s mission.</p> <p>If you came across this job via LinkedIn, please note that it is an evergreen role; LinkedIn does not differentiate, but we prefer to.</p> <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p><strong>Build websites and products for good.</strong> We're looking for a Web Developer to join Blue State, a full-service agency at the forefront of digital campaigning. As a contractor on our Tech Team, you will work with platforms like WordPress, Contentful, Salesforce, Optimizely, and more to support our clients and partners in a myriad of ways. This role is perfect for a flexible web developer who is eager to help some of the most exciting progressive organizations and brands in the world.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is a purpose-driven agency. We partner with leading causes, brands, and campaigns and create real change. From Google and UNICEF to Amnesty International and Oxfam, we transform how brands and causes raise money, influence policy, build platforms, and grow communities of supporters. Conduct code review and document technical decisions as needed.</li> <li>Work with members of our product, design, analytics, content, and account teams to align on requirements and process.</li> <li>Communicate with project managers and stakeholders throughout the course of a project.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team&nbsp;</strong></h2> <p>The Tech Team consists of product managers, developers, tech leads, and martech specialists. We’re veterans of presidential campaigns, agencies, nonprofits, and the tech world who want our work to matter, are passionate about technology, and aim to continually improve the work we do. We collaborate very closely remotely and, optionally, from our offices in New York, DC, and London.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ul> <li>At least 3 years of experience building web pages using HTML, CSS, and modern web standards.</li> <li>WordPress development experience. Being able to build a WordPress theme and edit PHP is a requirement, while experience using Advanced Custom Fields and Timber and building Gutenberg components using React are all pluses.</li> <li>Front-end JavaScript experience. Neither Experience with UI frameworks such as React and Next.js, nor expertise in Node.js, are required, but either is a plus.</li> <li>Familiarity with CRM, CDP, or marketing&nbsp; platforms, such as SFMC, Engaging Networks, ActionKit, Action Network, or EveryAction/NGP, or a readiness to learn.</li> <li>Familiarity with fundraising platforms such as FundraiseUp, Classy, or Blackbaud, or a readiness to learn.</li> <li>Familiarity with optimization and personalization platforms such as Optimizely.</li> <li>Familiarity with Git and modern deployment and build tools and practices (i.e. devops).</li> <li>Appreciation of the nuances of front-end performance.</li> <li>Dedication to accessibility and experience working with designers to ensure that our experiences can be used by anyone, regardless of the assistive technology they may choose to use.</li> <li>The ability to interpret visual design comps and implement a designer’s vision, navigating challenges and trade-offs. An eye for typography, whitespace, and other details that occur at the intersection of design and code.</li> <li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to interpret requests from non-technical people.</li> <li>Enthusiasm and passion for progressive advocacy and community-building.</li> <li>Empathy, positivity, respect, and the ability to be a role model at Blue State.</li> </ul> <p>Hourly rate for this position is $75-$90; compensation will be commensurate with experience.</p> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. description: <p>Interested in joining Blue State's Creative Director team? Submit your application here to ensure you're first in line for future opportunities. Please note: this is an "evergreen" job post (i.e. not an active job post), but your expression of interest matters to us. While interviews aren't ongoing, we're excited to connect with talented individuals who share our commitment to Blue State's mission.&nbsp;</p> <p>If you came across this job via LinkedIn, please note that it is an evergreen role; Linked In does not differentiate, but we prefer to.</p> <h2><strong>What to know</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is looking for a creative leader who is ready to push the creative limits for some of the most important causes and campaigns. In this role, you will oversee a portfolio of work ranging from platform to brand strategy to communications, with a focus on fundraising and mobilization. You’ll be accountable for an effective and inclusive creative process that inspires the best ideas and work from the team. You’ll work closely with account directors, strategists, designers, writers, and analysts to ensure that we’re delivering innovative, beautiful and results-oriented work that exceeds our clients’ expectations.&nbsp;</p> <p>We’re more interested in the originality, purpose, and proven success of your concepts than we are in your awards list or sizzle reel.</p> <p>This person will report to the Executive Creative Director in New York.</p> <h2><strong>The company</strong></h2> <p>Blue State is a purpose-driven agency. We partner with leading causes, brands, and campaigns and create real change. From Google and UNICEF to Amnesty International and Oxfam, we transform how brands and causes raise money, influence policy, build platforms, and grow communities of supporters. Led by the most creative and analytical minds from the political, nonprofit, and brand worlds,Blue State is an independent agency with 150+ employees in the US and London.</p> <h2><strong>A day in the life</strong></h2> <ul> <li><strong>Lead and inspire:</strong> Working closely with your colleagues and clients, you’ll develop a vision for our clients’ success. You’ll guide the development and implementation of digital campaigns and platforms, from initial presentations through final delivery.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Foster a culture of excellence:</strong> Establish and evolve the creative process to leverage the team’s talents and ensure the quality of work is up to client/our standards. Attend internal critiques, and provide creative solutions to the team. Final signoff on design, copy, and UX work for assigned projects.</li> <li><strong>Foster a culture of inclusivity and creativity: </strong>You’ll lead structured and inspiring brainstorms, lift up others’ ideas, and foster collaboration with teammates to ensure well-rounded and strategically informed creative. Ensure the team feels appreciated and celebrated for deliverables and successes.</li> <li><strong>Push innovation and professional growth:</strong> Stay on top of developments in the field, industry, and culture. Help identify, hire, and retain designers, copywriters, and other creatives. Mentor members of the project team.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>The team</strong></h2> <p>You will be a part of our global creative director team working closely with cross-disciplinary teams on projects.</p> <h2><strong>What we offer</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Unlimited time-off (inclusive of sick, personal, and vacation days)</li> <li>$1,250 annually in professional development funds</li> <li>Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance</li> <li>Flexible and health savings accounts</li> <li>401K &amp; employer match</li> <li>Generous paid holiday schedule</li> <li>12-week fully-paid parental leave for all parents-to-be</li> <li>Short-term and long-term disability insurance</li> <li>Pre-tax commuter benefits</li> <li>Remote work flexibility</li> </ul> <p>We approach in-office working with a hybrid model. On-site presence is welcome for US staff who are within commuting distance of the NY or DC office. Managers retain discretion to require in-person attendance for folks on their discipline or client teams as necessary, including for those whose roles require them to be in person.</p> <p>The salary range for this position is $115,000 - $150,000; compensation will be commensurate with experience.</p> <h2><strong>Some things we're looking for</strong></h2> <ol> <li>4+ years in senior creative role, 8+ years of digital experience (in-house + agency experience preferred).&nbsp;</li> <li>Knowledge of grassroots fundraising, website strategy, supporter mobilization, customer engagement, and brand strategy (i.e. proposition, positioning, promise, territories, routes, etc.).&nbsp;</li> <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills. Ability to make stakeholders feel confident in the creative choices we are making and back up our creative choices.</li> <li>Effective at operating as creative oversight or creative lead and delivering clear and constructive feedback to project team members.</li> <li>Ability to balance innovation and creative investment with practical and feasible solutions.&nbsp;</li> <li>Ability to adapt to new situations, solve problems on the fly, and communicate with those around you. Teamwork and scrappiness required.</li> <li>A shared passion and curiosity for making change. This includes comfort with ambiguity, a restlessness that resists the status quo, and a commitment to quality that ensures we’re always making progress.</li> <li>Empathy, communication, respect, and the ability to set a positive example at Blue State.</li> </ol> <p>At Blue State, diversity is a necessity, not a nice-to-have. We encourage those from underrepresented communities — women, people of color, LGBTQIA+, immigrants, those with disabilities and people at all the intersections in between — to apply. Even if you don’t think your current skill set checks every box, but this role seems to align with your strengths, we want to hear from you.</p> <p>Blue State is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible application and interview process. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation for a disability, including the use of AI tools throughout the hiring process, please contact us at <a href="mailto:recruiting@bluestate.co">recruiting@bluestate.co</a> with the <strong>subject line: Accommodation Request</strong> to get started.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p>Your privacy is important to us. &nbsp;You can find out more information on how we handle your data for recruiting purposes in our <a href="https://www.bluestate.co/privacy-policy-for-recruitment/">Privacy Policy for Recruitment</a>.&nbsp;</p></div>
