title: Salesforce Administrator
description:
Salesforce AdministratorParisTechnology – Engineering /Full time /HybridApply for this job

Since 2012 Odaseva has helped global enterprises protect and secure their most valuable asset: data.Our platform and tools empower data-driven organizations to combat evolving threats, maintain operational integrity, and comply with data regulations. Our products include Backup and Restore, Archiving, Data Privacy solutions and much more.We’re a fast-growing scale-up with offices in San Francisco, Paris, Sydney, London, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, and more. We serve a global customer base including Fortune 500 companies, government organizations, and NGOs, reaching more than 100 million Salesforce users worldwide.At Odaseva, our values — Trust, Service, Commitment, Excellence, Kaizen, and One Team — define the environment we foster for our employees to thrive and succeed.About the Opportunity:We are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Salesforce Administrator to join our team in Paris. This is a crucial role for someone who is not just seeking a job, but an opportunity to make a measurable impact on our business operations. If you have a proven track record of success and are driven to create meaningful improvements, we want to hear from you.As a key member of our team, you will be a central business partner, working directly with Business Unit leaders and our developer team. Your mission will be to translate strategic needs into powerful solutions by building strong and robust no-code automations. You will also take ownership of improving the user experience of our Salesforce console and proactively monitor system alerts to ensure platform health and stability.

What You'll Do:Strategic Automation (No-Code): Partner with BU leaders to understand their processes and design, build, and maintain sophisticated, scalable automations exclusively using declarative tools, with a strong focus on Salesforce Flow.User Experience (UX) Enhancement: Act as the champion for our users by continuously improving the Salesforce Console experience. You will optimize page layouts, implement dynamic forms, and configure components to create a highly intuitive and productive workspace.Proactive System Monitoring: Take responsibility for monitoring system health by actively tracking and responding to alerts, including Flow error notifications, governor limit warnings, and security alerts, to ensure optimal performance and prevent issues before they impact users.Collaboration and Partnership: Work closely with the developer team to understand the technical landscape and ensure your declarative solutions work in harmony with existing code. Serve as the key liaison between business stakeholders and the technical teams.Platform Management & Governance: Handle core administrative functions, including user management, profiles, permissions, data integrity, and system maintenance, ensuring the platform remains secure and well-organized.

What You'll Bring:Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant field.Proven Experience: Several years of hands-on experience as a Salesforce Administrator, with a portfolio of projects where you can clearly demonstrate the business impact of your work (e.g., time saved through automation, improved data quality, increased user adoption).Declarative Mastery: Expert-level proficiency in Salesforce Flow is  essential. You must be able to build complex, efficient, and scalable automations without relying on code. In-depth knowledge of the Salesforce platform's declarative capabilities (e.g., validation rules, dynamic forms, Lightning App Builder).User-Centric Mindset: A strong passion for user experience and a proven ability to configure and optimize the Lightning Experience and Salesforce Console.An Impact-Oriented Drive: You are a strategic problem-solver who is motivated by results. You seek to understand the "why" behind each request and measure your success by the value you deliver.Excellent Communication Skills: You can confidently communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, building strong relationships and explaining complex solutions in a clear, understandable way.Proactive & Autonomous: You are a self-starter who can manage projects independently, prioritize effectively, and take initiative to improve processes.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
description:
Senior Salesforce DeveloperParisTechnology – Engineering /Full time /HybridApply for this job

Since 2012 Odaseva has helped global enterprises protect and secure their most valuable asset: data.Our platform and tools empower data-driven organizations to combat evolving threats, maintain operational integrity, and comply with data regulations. Our products include Backup and Restore, Archiving, Data Privacy solutions and much more.We’re a fast-growing scale-up with offices in San Francisco, Paris, Sydney, London, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, and more. We serve a global customer base including Fortune 500 companies, government organizations, and NGOs, reaching more than 100 million Salesforce users worldwide.At Odaseva, our values — Trust, Service, Commitment, Excellence, Kaizen, and One Team — define the environment we foster for our employees to thrive and succeed.Your RoleWe are seeking an experienced Senior Salesforce Developer to join our dedicated team. This role is ideal for a skilled developer with a strong record of delivering impactful solutions and a motivation to contribute to significant business outcomes. You will work in direct partnership with a product manager to architect, develop, and release high-performance features for our Salesforce platform.In this position, you will play a crucial role in the entire development lifecycle, from technical design to ensuring the quality and stability of our production environment. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is looking to apply their technical expertise to solve complex problems and see their work make a direct impact.

Your responsibilities will include:Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into well-designed, scalable technical solutions.Design, build, test, and deploy high-quality features and applications on the Salesforce platform using Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), and other relevant technologies.Uphold and advocate for development best practices, including code quality, test coverage, performance, and security.Act as a technical guide and mentor to other developers, fostering an environment of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.Take ownership of the quality of your deliverables through robust unit testing and by working closely with quality assurance partners.Monitor the health and performance of the production environment, identifying and resolving issues to ensure system reliability and a positive user experience.

You will bring:Master degree in Computer Science or other relevant field.10 years experience in full-stack software development.Extensive hands-on experience in a Salesforce development role, with a portfolio of successfully delivered projects.Deep proficiency with the Salesforce platform, including Apex, Visualforce, SOQL, and the Lightning Component Framework (especially LWC).A thorough understanding of Salesforce governor limits, data structures, and security best practices.Demonstrated experience with Salesforce integrations using REST and SOAP APIs.Familiarity with modern development practices, including Salesforce DX, version control (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a detail-oriented mindset.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within a team and with non-technical stakeholders.Salesforce Platform Developer I certification is required. Salesforce Platform Developer II certification is highly regarded.

title: Finance & Operations Analyst
description:
Finance & Operations AnalystNew York, New YorkFinance /Full-Time /On-siteApply for this job

Prizeout is a leading New York city based fintech company where innovation meets financial empowerment. We provide rewards and loyalty solutions to partners that revolutionize the way their customers engage and maximize their financial potential. We're seeking passionate individuals to drive our mission forward and transform the landscape of advertising and financial technology. We have built a team that values humility and innovation and we believe that embracing challenges makes us better. We hire people we trust, who will live these values and who are able to find a way to navigate through obstacles, embody an entrepreneurial spirit, and maintain a spirit of optimism. If that’s you, please read on and apply today!About This RolePrizeout is seeking a Finance & Operations Analyst to join our growing Finance team. If you're early in your finance career and eager to go beyond spreadsheets into real strategic and operational impact, this role is for you. You’ll work closely with our VP Strategic Finance & Revenue Operations across a wide range of initiatives—from managing the cash mechanics of our fintech products, supporting financial forecasting, analyzing sales performance, and helping shape materials for investors and the board. This isn’t a siloed finance role; it’s a chance to embed yourself in the core of how our business runs and scales.We’re looking for someone who’s analytical, curious, and excited to take on a cross-functional role that blends finance, operations, and strategy. You’ll gain insight into how decisions are made at every level, collaborate with teams company-wide, and have the opportunity to grow with a company that’s redefining how consumers engage with financial institutions.

What You'll Do:Take ownership of cashflow operations tied directly to product usage—overseeing the movement of hundreds of millions of dollars each year through reconciliation, cash sweeps, and real-time financial executionContribute to company-wide forecasting of revenue, expenses, and cash runway with sensitivity to business driversCollaborate on investor and board materials, helping craft data-driven narratives around company performance and strategyAnalyze sales pipeline and conversion data to identify growth opportunities and improve forecasting accuracyHelp drive monthly and quarterly business reviews, planning cycles, and performance deep divesSupport KPI development and performance tracking across sales teams, translating data into insights that drive revenue Partner on cross-functional initiatives across sales, operations, and finance to inform strategy and optimize executionHelp refine and scale internal financial systems and processes to support growth

What You'll Bring:Background in investment banking, corporate finance, private equity, or strategic finance, as shown by work experience, internship, or other training.Strong understanding of financial statements, especially cashflow and working capitalExposure to financial modeling and valuation frameworksExcellent Excel skills (SQL is a bonus)Strong communicator with an eye for detailInterest in operating within a startup environment—flexible, scrappy, and proactiveA strategic mindset and desire to work across finance and operationsBachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, or experience in related fieldThe expected salary range for this position is $80,000-$90,000, plus an equity component

$80,000 - $90,000 a year

WHAT IS PRIZEOUT?Prizeout is an advertising and financial technology company that helps put money back into people’s pockets. Through Prizeout’s technology, brand-funded offers are available to all partners, including financial institutions, gaming companies, gig economy startups, and more, giving them access to instant cashback from national and local brands when they shop with digital gift cards. The company was founded in 2019 and is headquartered in New York City.Prizeout is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Analytics Manager
description:
Analytics ManagerNew York, New YorkTechnology and Data /Full-Time /HybridApply for this job

What is PrizeoutPrizeout is a fast-growing fintech transforming how people interact with their money by turning everyday transactions into rewarding, value-driven moments. We sit at the intersection of payments, rewards, and loyalty, empowering financial institutions to build deeper connections with their users. Our platform analyzes rich transactional data to deliver personalized insights and maximize value with every purchase. The company was founded in 2019 and is headquartered in NYC.Why PrizeoutAt Prizeout, we’re redefining how people engage with their money through smarter, data-driven rewards. We’re looking for curious, analytical builders who love turning complex, messy data into meaningful insights that drive loyalty and better financial outcomes. We keep the user at the center of every decision and we value humility, curiosity, and ownership.About This RoleAs an Analytics Manager at Prizeout, you’ll partner closely with Product, Engineering, Merchant, and Financial Institution teams to bring clarity to ambiguous problems and turn data into strategic advantage. You’ll build analytical frameworks, uncover actionable insights, and develop tools that inform product decisions and business growth.This is a high-impact role for someone who can function both as a strategic thinker who coaches and elevates others as well as a hands-on analyst who can independently execute high-value projects. 

What You’ll DoLead analytical initiatives that deepen understanding of user, partner, and merchant behaviorBuild models, frameworks, and segmentation tools to surface insights hidden in rich transaction dataStandardize measurement, establish KPIs, and create scalable reporting foundationsMentor and guide a growing analytics team while remaining a strong individual contributorDevelop expertise in Prizeout’s marketplace mechanics, reward logic, and optimization algorithmsTransform raw data into dashboards, reporting suites, and narrative insights for leadershipPartner cross-functionally to evaluate product experiments, measure marketing performance, and support go-to-market strategiesWork cross-functionally to operationalize analytical outputs into core experiences

What We're Looking For3+ years in quantitative analytics, data science, or similar data-driven rolesExperience in data mining, cohort analysis, experimentation, and advanced quantitative methods (statistics, ML familiarity a plus)Proficiency in SQL, Python, BI tools (Tableau, Looker, or similar), and ExcelTrack record of independently managing complex analytical projects from discovery to deliveryStrong communicator with the ability to turn data into compelling narratives and influence decisionsPlayer-coach mindset: strong contributor and mentor, with demonstrated leadership potentialComfort navigating ambiguity, structuring open-ended problems, and creating clarity from noisePlease note: Must be able to work 2-3 days/week in our NYC office.Must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa at this time.The expected salary range for this position is $145,000-$165,000, plus an equity component.

description:

What is PrizeoutPrizeout is a fast-growing fintech transforming how people interact with their money by turning everyday transactions into rewarding, value-driven moments. We sit at the intersection of payments, rewards, and loyalty, empowering financial institutions to build deeper connections with their users. Our platform analyzes rich transactional data to deliver personalized insights and maximize value with every purchase. This is a high-impact role for someone who loves turning complex behavior into clarity and is motivated by improving real people’s everyday financial lives.

What You'll DoAnalyze the full Pay funnel from awareness, through activation, to long-term loyalty.Build frameworks and develop attribution models to understand what drives user acquisition and conversionQuantify key activation milestones (e.g., deposit health signals, card linking, first gift card purchase, streaks)Surface insights on shopping patterns, merchant experience quality, and cashback/offer behaviorWork cross-functionally to define KPIs, test hypotheses, and evaluate A/B experimentsPartner with data leadership to build meaningful reporting, dashboards, and retention/engagement benchmarksIdentify friction points in the Pay experience and recommend product, UX, or marketing optimizationsSupport GTM and partner teams with analytics to drive adoption, engagement, and growthTranslate complex findings into actionable narratives and recommendations for senior stakeholders

What We're Looking For3+ years in data analysis, product analytics, or quantitative roles (startup or fintech experience a plus)Experience with funnel analytics, cohort analysis, retention modeling, and A/B testingProficiency in SQL, Python, BI tools (Tableau/Looker), and ExcelAbility to organize ambiguity and clearly communicate the “so-what”Comfort working with transaction data, behavioral signals, and marketplace or consumer app metricsDesire to influence the product direction and growth strategy through deep user understandingPlease Note:Must be able to work 2-3 days/week in our NYC office.Must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa at this time.The expected salary range for this position is $115,000-$130,000, plus an equity component.

title: Account Manager
description:
Account ManagerCanada, RemoteCustomer Success /Full Time /RemoteApply for this job

About Lillio (formerly HiMama) and Our Mission:At Lillio (formerly HiMama), we are committed to serving the field as an authentic voice of the early childhood education (ECE) workforce, providing programs with all of the building blocks for high-quality early care and education and helping early educators focus on what matters most for children’s successful development and learning: relationships, play, creativity, and loving, nurturing caregiving. We are a social-purpose business and certified B Corporation with the goal of empowering early childhood educators through innovative, affordable tools that enable them to improve child outcomes, engage family members, and support continued professional growth for their staff. If you are excited about being part of an impact-driven business, focused on making a difference in the early childhood education industry, Lillio is the place for you.Lillio is a Series B, private-equity backed business and we're proud to be part of the Bain Double Impact portfolio. Lillio is recognized as an industry leader, most recently selected by Fortune in 2023 for their "Impact 20" list, which highlights organizations that have built their business models around world-changing ideas to solve social and environmental problems.

$65,000 - $70,000 a yearWe're Looking for….Passionate, ambitious, and confident Account Managers who want to challenge themselves in a fast-paced, high-growth work environment. Ideal candidates enjoy connecting with customers as much as they love the challenge of hitting individual and team targets. They get excited when presented with a new challenge and have strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Finally, they’re looking to make an impact on the world beyond dollars and cents - working with a social enterprise they’ll have the opportunity to improve outcomes for hundreds of thousands of children worldwide. As an Account Manager, you will be working directly to empower Early Childhood Educators and influence learning outcomes for children aged zero to five.The Revenue TeamThe revenue teams at Lillio are a high-energy, collaborative and ambitious team that is striving to drive accelerated growth of our business. We have a strong team mentality and a desire to work hard and win to support our customers. The AM team specifically is a high-energy, close-knit, and ambitious team that is striving to drive accelerated growth of our business! This includes influencing product and marketing decisions, problem solving, and a whole lot of persuasion. Every day is a new challenge and every team member has a lot of responsibility, but we work closely together to ensure everyone is kicking butt in their role.How You’ll Make an Impact:Client Relationship Management: Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned accounts, fostering strong, long-term relationships.Customer Support: Address customer inquiries, troubleshoot issues, and provide expert advice on best practices.Account Growth: Identify opportunities for upselling or expanding product offerings within existing accounts (with an emphasis on Billing and Payments customers). You will also be responsible for handling price negotiations and upcoming renewals Pipeline Management: Responsible for a portofilio of roughly 200 customers where you are booking and managing online demos. You will be responsible for prospecting, discovery, presentation, negotiating and closing opportunities with existing accountsHigh performance: Consistently meeting monthly, quarterly and annual individual and team targetsCollaboration: Work closely with sales, product, marketing and customer success teams to ensure a smooth and effective customer experience.Customer Advocacy: Collect customer feedback and advocate for their needs with the product team to drive continuous improvement.Reporting & Documentation: Maintain detailed records of customer interactions, progress, and feedback using CRM tools.What You Bring to the Table:Experience: 2+ years in account management, customer success, or a related field. Experience in the education or tech industry is a plus.Strong Sales Skills: Demonstrated ability to upsell and cross-sell, identify new business opportunities within existing accounts, and achieve sales targets.Negotiation Skills: Strong ability to negotiate contracts and terms with clients while maintaining positive relationships.Self-Motivated: Ability to work independently, manage a sales pipeline, and be proactive in identifying opportunities for account growth.Strong Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to build rapport and engage with customers effectively.Problem-Solving Abilities: Ability to think critically and solve problems quickly and efficiently, with a customer-first mentality.Customer-Focused: Passionate about providing an exceptional customer experience and committed to customer success.Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using CRM tools, SaaS products, and the ability to quickly learn new software platforms.Organizational Skills: Strong time management skills, with the ability to juggle multiple accounts and priorities simultaneously.Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent experience) Nice to Haves:Experience in Ed Tech sales or experience and/or knowledge of Early Childhood EducationExperience in SaaSExperience in payment processing sales Experience with our tech stackTech stack (optional):Salesforce, Salesloft, Google Suite, SlackCompensation: $65,000-$70,000 base; evaluation of the offer for the successful candidate will be based on relevant experience This role would be eligible to participate in the Employee Stock Option PlanDon’t have all the requirements but convinced you’ll be able to make an impact? We’d love to hear from you!  Please note that we place serious consideration to your application responses to all questions; only completed profiles will be considered for this role.   

Lillio Perks!Flexible working arrangements; we are a remote-first company Health benefits package includes medical, dental and vision401K matching, and HSA contribution for US employeesPaid time off, including vacation, personal and volunteer daysA subscription to the mindfulness and meditation platform, HeadspaceOpportunities for learning, mentorship and professional developmentOngoing team-wide and company-wide virtual social activities and success celebrations AccessibilityLillio is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. If you require accommodations at any step of the application or interview process, please indicate so under the "Accommodations Question" box on your application. Accommodations may include but are not limited to: alternative methods of communication, providing a detailed “what to expect”, or modified testing. Please note this list is not exhaustive and we are more than happy to discuss other accommodations as required.Commitment to DiversityDiversity, Inclusion and Belonging are central to Lillio's core values. Lillio aims to ensure we provide a safe environment for everyone to thrive while bringing their authentic selves to work. Our mission is to promote an inclusive work space for all employees through Education, Discussion, and Celebration of our differences. Embracing these differences while coming together with a common purpose is what makes our team extra special. Our focus on inclusion and belonging is activated in the day-to-day culture at Lillio through our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging (DIBS) committee, our bi-weekly DIBS discussions, DIBS Slack community, D&I training and education, volunteer days, donation matching, and more.Equal EmploymentLillio is an equal employment opportunity employer. $50,000 - $55,000 a yearWe’re looking for… Enthusiastic individuals with can-do attitudes who want to be a part of a fast-paced, work-hard, start-up environment. As an integral team member to Lillio's onboarding team, you will own the successful implementation of a customer implementing (and onboarding) our solutions. At Lillio we celebrate wins, make positive change in the world, and have fun with friends all at the same time, every day.You should enjoy interacting with customers over the phone and helping them learn how to use the product in a way that will align with the goals of their center. The Customer onboarding role will focus on providing support to our customers via scheduled meetings, adhoc calls, and email, by owning the implementation of Lillio's solutions. They will be responsible for exemplifying amazing customer service. Given the nature of our fast-paced environment, you will also be helping out in other aspects of the CS team. This includes influencing product and marketing decisions, problem-solving for customers, and being a team player amongst the team. Every day is a new challenge and every team member has a lot of responsibility, but we work closely together to ensure everyone is kicking butt in their role.Your CS LeaderLillio’s VP, of Customer Success is a people first leader who believes in unlocking individual's potential to build high performing teams. She is a leader who likes to set the stage with big-picture vision and empower the team to work through the plan of execution. She is KPI driven and has a high attention to detail to better understand team and customer trends, to best position everyone to be successful. She places a high value on curiosity, ownership and having a growth mindset with an intrinsic drive to improve. Managing customer relationships via phone and other channels, with a focus on getting the customer fully onboarded. Acting as a consultant to help child care Directors plan their implementation with their team and training of Lillio. Supporting, troubleshooting and solving customer problems, when needed. Assisting the support team in answering technical questions from our queue as needed Ensuring you are on track to meet and exceed team KPIs Ensuring the customer has an amazing Lillio experience!What You Bring to the Table:Post-secondary education (or equivalent work experience)Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a customer-facing roleTech-savvy with the ability to navigate apps and software is a mustExceptional verbal and written communication skillsAn ability to build relationships and connect with people quicklyCompassionate and patient demeanor with confidence and assertion to get things doneActive listening and problem-solving skillsNot afraid to pick up the phone or hop on a video chat and speak to peopleYou’re organized and able to manage a large volume of tasks independently An ability to de-escalate and manage difficult situations and conversationsAn ability to maintain high customer satisfaction through efficient task switchingComfortable working with numbers and explaining complex processes in simple termsPropensity to always want to learn and improve processesPassionate about a career that is more than a “job”Ambition to work hard in order to make an impact in the world

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Senior Product ManagerTorontoProduct, Design & Engineering /Full Time /RemoteApply for this job

About Lillio (formerly HiMama) and Our Mission:At Lillio (formerly HiMama), we are committed to serving the field as an authentic voice of the early childhood education (ECE) workforce, providing programs with all of the building blocks for high-quality early care and education and helping early educators focus on what matters most for children’s successful development and learning: relationships, play, creativity, and loving, nurturing caregiving. We are a social-purpose business with the goal of empowering early childhood educators through innovative, affordable tools that enable them to improve child outcomes, engage family members, and support continued professional growth for their staff. If you are excited about being part of an impact-driven business, focused on making a difference in the early childhood education industry, Lillio is the place for you.Lillio is a Series B, private-equity backed business and we're proud to be part of the Bain Double Impact portfolio. Lillio is recognized as an industry leader, most recently selected by Fortune in 2023 for their "Impact 20" list, which highlights organizations that have built their business models around world-changing ideas to solve social and environmental problems.We're a mission-minded company that provides a top-rated all-in-one software solution with a proven track record of partnering with early childcare programs across North America and globally.  At Lillio, we are committed to the childcare market and provide wraparound support for every one of the needs associated with creating and running a high-quality program for children and families.  We help administrators effectively manage their program, delight and engage families, develop their educators’ knowledge and skills, and deliver high-quality, research-based teaching and caregiving experiences. We’re looking for… A motivated and adaptable Senior Product Manager to take on senior role within our Product team. The ideal candidate will thrive in the dynamic environment of a scale-up SaaS company and be a key driver of executing on our roadmap, specifically in the area of payments, learning management system and/or B2B2C products . They will be excited about the opportunity to build with a supportive Director of Product, and be involved in the roadmap execution of a PE-backed scale-up. They will thrive in the role of mentor to junior teammates, and bring a focus on detail and data-backed decisions to their work.The Product Team you’ll be joiningThe Product team at Lillio is a small and high-performing agile team, committed to the product stewardship of our rapidly growing business. They are focused on stakeholder management across our Engineering, Educational Content and Design teams, and bring domain-specific expertise across the payments, childcare, and platform product areas - all while maintaining compliance with industry best practices as we grow our team. We are looking for an experienced, passionate Senior Product Manager to shape our product as we grow.Your Impact:As a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for discovery, solution-ing, and executing against a roadmap of features and functionality  that supports our core offerings and impacts happy customers all across North America, all of whom are deeply engaged in the care and development of young children: Teachers - For early childhood educators, Lillio delivers on a promise of positive early learning outcomes by focusing on the foundational tools for essential caregiving support, lesson planning, content creation, and curriculum delivery. It strengthens school-to-home connections, building positive relationships between the teacher and home caregivers.  And, it supports educators’  personal and professional growth. Administrators - For preschool owners/directors, Lillio is a back-office tool for setting up and successfully running a center or program, making administrative tasks such monitoring center activity, administrative reporting, collecting tuition payments, and communicating with parents easier so that Administrators can spend more time doing what they love. Families & Caregivers - For families, Lillio is a direct window into their child’s experience at school, fostering a critical connection to school life and activities. Lillio facilitates trust through highly engaging sharing and communication tools.  It does so an all-in-one app for parents to interact with every stage of their child’s journey through care, providing continuity of education and care and giving insights into their child’s development. You'll do well in this role if...You are an experienced Product Manager, who has a proven track record of delivering high quality products in the payments, education (or related) industries and who has demonstrated proficiency in the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to implementation. You have mastered the skills of leading through influence and can state your understanding of stakeholder management and communication from executive team to sales to engineering.  You will have a burgeoning understanding of, and deep curiosity for, product-led business growth, understanding that you are responsible for your product’s success in the marketplace and across the organization. We're Looking for a Senior Product Manager to:

Deliver product solutions that fit our mission and business goalsIdentify business opportunities and be able to frame and articulate the user problems within them Own and align the 6-12 month roadmap for your product stream Collaborate closely with designers and engineers to imagine the best solutions through research, discovery, ideation, etc. Guide the delivery of these solutions by working closely with the product team and stakeholders across the organization (experience working directly with Engineering teams and communicating value of decisions directly to Engineering)

Work within and facilitate our agile processes as part of a leadership triadKnow when and how to bring designers, engineers and other stakeholders together to create the best solutionsImplement programs and tools to coordinate necessary steps and stakeholders across the business, at all stages of product life cycleHave first-hand knowledge of how to tie product discovery and efficient delivery together to build best-in-class software

About Lillio (formerly HiMama) and Our Mission:At Lillio (formerly HiMama), we are committed to serving the field as an authentic voice of the early childhood education (ECE) workforce, providing programs with all of the building blocks for high-quality early care and education and helping early educators focus on what matters most for children’s successful development and learning: relationships, play, creativity, and loving, nurturing caregiving. We are a social-purpose business with the goal of empowering early childhood educators through innovative, affordable tools that enable them to improve child outcomes, engage family members, and support continued professional growth for their staff. If you are excited about being part of an impact-driven business, focused on making a difference in the early childhood education industry, Lillio is the place for you.Lillio is a Series B, private-equity backed business and we're proud to be part of the Bain Double Impact portfolio. Lillio is recognized as an industry leader, most recently selected by Fortune in 2023 for their "Impact 20" list, which highlights organizations that have built their business models around world-changing ideas to solve social and environmental problems.We’re looking for… A talented and motivated full stack engineer to join our dynamic engineering team. You care deeply not just about the security, performance, and maintainability of your code, but about our mission to elevate early childhood programs with innovative design and quality solutions. As a Senior Software Engineer you will play a lead role in designing, developing, and maintaining web applications using Ruby on Rails, React, and GraphQL. Lillio EngineeringAt Lillio, our Product & Engineering teams are a tight-knit unit. By using strong product creation methodologies and processes, and by working closely together, we imagine and create great products that immediately make an impact in the lives of millions of educators, parents, and young children. Tech Stack:AWS, PostgreSQL, HerokuRuby on Rails, GraphQL, React Native

title: Account Manager
description:
Account ManagerLondonCommercial – Commercial /Full-time /HybridApply for this job

We’re on a mission to revolutionise healthcare by empowering generalist clinicians to deliver specialist care to millions of people through 32Co’s platform.Imagine being able to go to your local healthcare professional, and get the quality of specialist healthcare normally reserved for Harley Street. 32Co is building the latest cutting-edge AI technology to make this a reality, starting in two multi-billion dollar markets.We’re already making our mark - with a product rating of 4.97 out of 5* and recently featured by Tech.eu, where our CEO, Sonia Szamocki, spoke about how 32Co is redefining what’s possible in dentistry and beyond. It’s a powerful example of how our technology is raising the standard of care, without raising barriers to access.Backed by Tier 1 investors from day one, Balderton Capital (investors behind Revolut, City Mapper, and Depop), we’re scaling at speed across the UK and beyond. With a proven model and strong traction, we’re just getting started and have ambitious plans to expand into other healthcare verticals - bringing the same level of innovation and accessibility to new areas of medicine.The RoleWe are looking for a proactive, client-focused Account Manager to manage and grow relationships across our existing customer accounts. The focus is on retention, education, and growth of existing accounts, helping customers get the most value from 32Co while contributing to the company’s growth.In this role, you’ll act as a trusted advisor and problem-solver, supporting a large portfolio of accounts (+100), so strong prioritisation is key. You’ll develop a deep understanding of your accounts’ needs, advocate for their experience internally, and drive retention, renewals, and growth opportunities.

What You'll Be DoingManage and grow a portfolio of 100+ existing customer accounts, acting as the primary point of contact and trusted advisor.Build strong relationships through education, support, and consistent value delivery, driving long-term satisfaction and loyalty.Identify opportunities for growth within your accounts and collaborate with commercial and clinical teams to deliver them.Develop a deep understanding of each customer’s goals, workflows, and challenges. Use insights and data to anticipate needs and provide strategic guidance.Monitor key account metrics, highlighting performance, risks, and growth opportunities to internal stakeholders.Partner cross-functionally with clinical, product, and operations teams to represent the customer’s perspective and influence continuous service improvement.Visit customer sites as needed to strengthen relationships, address challenges directly, and provide high-touch service.

What We’re Looking ForExperience working in a startup or similar environment - you have got stuck in, and done what needs to be done to hit targets, achieve outcomes, or just generally be highly successful. Demonstrated experience in people-facing roles - this does not have to have been in an Account Management role. A natural relationship-builder with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Proactive, curious, and solutions-oriented, with a drive to understand the “why” behind every customer goal or challenge. Highly organised and capable - you will need to be able to manage a large and complex set of ~100+ accounts while prioritising effectively. Comfortable working independently, and being accountable for targets and outcomes. Commercially savvy, able to balance excellent customer experience with broader business objectives. Experience in healthtech or healthcare is a plus but absolutely not required. Willing to travel regularly and confident meeting clients face-to-face. Able to commute to our London (Hoxton) office on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

Why join us See your work translate into real-world impact - you’ll have the chance to help change lives every day and meet the people whose care you’re improving. Competitive salary based on experience and uncapped commission potential, with regular performance reviews to ensure your compensation keeps pace with your impact. Build the Future of HealthTech; we’re tackling a multi-billion dollar challenge with real-world impact. Founded by an ex-Oxford doctor and former BCG consultant, with a proven track record of creating the world’s leading Haemophilia management app. Join a company seed-funded by top VCs with a multicultural, ambitious, high calibre team. Birthday day off - because no one should work on their birthday! Team perks, including regular team lunches, quarterly socials and an annual retreat. Flexible working arrangements, splitting time between home and our vibrant London office.

32Co is a leading UK-based healthtech startup, backed by top VCs and scaling fast. We’re transforming specialist-led healthcare by combining cutting-edge technology with a collaborative network of expert clinicians. Our mission is simple but ambitious: to make world-class specialist care accessible to everyone.As we scale, we’re looking for a Fulfilment Assistant to join our HQ team in Hoxton and help ensure every order leaves the building accurately, safely, and on time. This is a hands-on role at the heart of our operation, supporting the smooth running of our fulfilment process. You’ll work closely with our Logistics Lead to prepare, pack, and dispatch orders to dentists and patients, maintaining the high quality and reliability that 32Co is known for.This is an opportunity to be part of a fast-moving, ambitious company from the ground up. You’ll work in a friendly, collaborative team, gain experience in a leading VC-backed healthtech, and see first-hand how a high-performing operations team runs.

What you’ll doPrepare and pack orders with care and accuracy, maintaining our high quality standards.Support daily fulfilment tasks such as printing labels, checking inventory, and restocking.Manage incoming and outgoing deliveries, including logging items and updating systems.Keep storage and stock areas tidy and well organised.Flag any issues or delays quickly, so the team can stay on track.Contribute to a positive, supportive team culture.Work part-time, Monday to Friday mornings (some flexibility).

Who you areReliable, organised, and detail-oriented - you notice when something’s not quite right.Comfortable with physical tasks like lifting boxes (most are small and light, but we do receive some larger inbound deliveries).Positive, proactive, and happy to roll up your sleeves to get things done.Able to work efficiently both independently and as part of a small team.Experience in fulfilment or dispatch work is helpful but not essential - we’ll train you.Take pride in doing things properly, hungry to learn and improve.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
description:
Talent Acquisition SpecialistLondonPeople & Finance – People /Full-time /HybridApply for this job

At 32Co, our mission is bold: empower generalist clinicians to deliver specialist-level care to millions of people through our cutting-edge platform. Imagine being able to walk into your local clinic and receive the same quality of care you’d expect on Harley Street. That’s the future we’re building — starting with two multi-billion-dollar markets. To make this possible, we’re harnessing the latest advances in AI to power our platform, streamline specialist knowledge, and deliver it at scale.Backed from day one by Balderton Capital (the investors behind Revolut, Citymapper, and Depop), we’ve already proven our model, gained strong traction, and are scaling rapidly across the UK and beyond. And we’re just getting started — our ambition is to expand into multiple healthcare verticals, bringing innovation and accessibility to every corner of medicine. Now we’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist to help us scale a world-class team that can power the next phase of our growth and bring this vision to life.Overview:As a Talent Acquisition Specialist, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of 32Co by ensuring we hire the very best people. You’ll partner with hiring managers to design and run recruitment processes that attract, engage, and hire top-tier talent - all while delivering an outstanding candidate experience.You’ll be joining a small, agile Talent team of two, which means you’ll have real ownership, visibility, and the chance to directly shape how we scale. This is a high-impact role with visibility across the business, giving you the chance to directly influence the talent that powers our next phase of growth.What you’ll do: • Lead hiring processes across multiple departments. You will have the opportunity to manage multiple hiring processes across different departments. • Attract exceptional talent. We don’t rely on old-fashioned ways to source candidates, you’ll be in charge of finding creative ways to source both active and passive candidates for all areas of the business.• Collaboration is key. You will need to work closely with the heads of our departments to define role requirements and be proactive with hiring updates to key stakeholders.• Commit to an excellent candidate experience. Work to ensure a smooth and positive interview process for all candidates, from initial outreach through to extending a job offer. • Ensure data is accurate. Take pride in keeping our ATS accurate and up to date so we can use data for reporting and forecasting. • Champion our vision. You will likely be the first point of contact for a candidate and as an ambassador for the company, it’s important you are able to convey 32Co’s mission, vision and values in interviews.  Requirements:• Your enthusiasm and dedication for hiring is evident.  You will have had previous agency or internal recruitment experience with evidence you can run recruitment processes.• Juggling multiple roles? You’ve got this! You’re energised by high-volume recruitment and can deliver quality at speed in a scaling environment.• Tech hiring savvy. You know how to find and engage great technical talent, and you’re excited to hire in different areas too.  • Flexibility is your superpower. Change is inevitable but you’ll embrace and welcome change, easily adapting to or suggesting new ideas.  • Communication is your strength. You are an excellent communicator, both when it comes to written and spoken communication, and you excel when building new connections and speaking to candidates. • Organisation is crucial.  You are extremely organised, ensuring that recruitment processes are run smoothly, candidates are kept updated, and you ensure all reporting systems remain up to date.• Proactive by nature. You don’t just react but you are able to anticipate.  You’re always thinking forwards, ensuring you’re prioritising the right tasks and you love to continue to learn.  • Seeking a hybrid role. Our office is based in Hoxton and we commute in on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. Why join us: • See your work translate into real-world impact - you’ll have the chance to help change lives every day and meet the people whose care you’re improving.• Competitive salary based on experience• Build the Future of HealthTech; we’re tackling a multi-billion dollar challenge. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and optimise systems that handle high throughput and mission-critical workloads.

What you’ll be doing:Design, develop, and maintain backend services and APIs using Node.js (NestJS framework).Build and optimise scalable data models and queries in MongoDB.Architect and implement serverless applications leveraging AWS Lambda and the Serverless Framework.Integrate and manage asynchronous workflows using Amazon SQS.Ensure performance, security, and reliability of distributed systems.Collaborate with frontend developers, product managers, and DevOps teams to deliver end-to-end features.Participate in code reviews, mentor junior engineers, and contribute to technical discussions/decisions.

Who we are looking for:4-6 years of professional software development experience with Node.js.Strong experience with the NestJS framework for building scalable APIs.Strong experience with MongoDB (schema design, aggregation, optimisation).Proven knowledge of AWS Lambda and Serverless architecture.Experience working with Amazon SQS for messaging and event-driven workflows.Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Git, and DevOps workflows.Strong problem-solving, debugging, and system design skills.Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.

Nice to have:Experience with other AWS services (API Gateway, CloudWatch, IAM).Exposure to monitoring/logging tools (e.g., ELK, Prometheus, Datadog).

Why Join Us:Opportunity to work on a health technology product solving a multi-billion dollar problem.Be part of a collaborative and inclusive work environment with a culture of teamwork, innovation and creativity.Have access to the latest tools and technologies.Opportunity for professional growth and career advancement.Join a company seed-funded by top VCs with a multicultural, ambitious, high calibre team.

Preferred QualificationsExperience in marketplace, SaaS, or events industryExperience with sales engagement platforms (Hubspot, Gong, Clay, Rocket Reach)Track record of successful cross-functional collaboration

title: Business Developer - Partita Iva
description:
Business Developer - Partita IvaMilanoBusiness Development /HybridApply for this job

❤️‍🩹 Chi siamoElty di DaVinci Salute è una HealthTech scale-up in missione per rendere la salute delle persone più accessibile. Dal 2019, siamo una delle società nel panorama della digital health in più rapida crescita in Italia (x300%). La nostra visione per un nuovo sistema sanitario prevede:• Assistenza proattiva invece che reattiva, basata sull’analisi dei dati• Empowerment dei pazienti.🌱 Negli anni abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti a livello istituzionale dal Ministero dello Sviluppo Economico, dalla Regione Lombardia, e dal Comune di Milano e siamo stati premiati tra le principali startup HealthTech a livello europeo dall’Ambrosetti Forum.🚀 Nel Dicembre 2022 siamo entrati nel gruppo UnipolSai, che ci offre straordinarie opportunità e la forza necessaria per promuovere l'innovazione digitale nel settore sanitario italiano.Siamo alla ricerca di un Business Developer freelance motivato e orientato ai risultati, pronto a unirsi al nostro team!📍 Dove: Ibrido🕒 Collaborazione: Partita IVA – collaborazione continuativa🗂 Settore: Digital Health🎯 Il tuo ruolo:Sarai responsabile dello sviluppo del network di strutture sanitarie a livello nazionale. Il tuo obiettivo sarà individuare nuove realtà, proporre collaborazioni strategiche e costruire relazioni solide e durature con i referenti delle strutture.🚀 Attività principali:• Cold calling su un prospecting mirato per proporre convenzioni e collaborazioni a livello nazionale/regionale• Sviluppare nuove opportunità commerciali e partnership strategiche nel settore del digital health• Comprendere il mercato del digital health, per individuare lo scenario competitivo• Mantenimento di relazioni solide con i partner già in portfolio• Monitoraggio e aggiornamento costante del CRM• Collaborare con il team marketing e prodotto per ottimizzare l'offerta• Gestire il ciclo completo di vendita: prospecting, contatto, trattativa, chiusura, onboarding👤 Il candidato ideale:• Esperienza pregressa come Business Developer o ruolo simile (minimo 4 anni)• Partita IVA attiva• Spiccate doti comunicative e di negoziazione: esprimi con chiarezza le idee e adatti lo stile in base all’interlocutore• Autonomia operativa e orientamento al risultato• Non hai paura del telefono: cold calling e contatto diretto sono il tuo pane quotidiano• Orientato al risultato, ma anche capace di costruire rapporti umani e duraturi• Conosci il mercato sanitario o hai voglia di impararlo in fretta• Non ha paura dei cambiamenti e gestisci positivamente le evoluzioni di una scale-up• Costituisce titolo preferenziale il possesso di un portafoglio clienti attivo, composto da strutture sanitarie operanti nel settore privato, con cui si intrattengono già relazioni consolidate✅ Offriamo:• Collaborazione con realtà dinamica e in crescita• Ambiente giovane e stimolante• Contratto P.IVA full time (fisso + variabile a risultato)

💙 I nostri principi• Radical transparency• Manager-less• Idea-meritocracy• Entrepreneurship• Cultura Async e Meeting-lessUnisciti a noi per fare la differenza nel mondo della sanità digitale!@Elty, celebriamo la diversità a beneficio dei nostri dipendenti, dei nostri prodotti e della nostra community!🔖 Per maggiori info dai un’occhiata al nostro sito web (https://elty.it/), la nostra pagina Linkedin, o scarica la nostra app disponibile su Play Store e Apple Store. Esplora l'universo Elty attraverso il nostro blog (https://medium.com/elty-davinci-salute), qui potrai immergerti nella nostra cultura aziendale e scoprire cosa significa essere parte di questa realtà!Elty è un marchio registrato di DaVinci Healthcare Srl.

title: AI Engineer - P.IVA
description:
AI Engineer - P.IVAMilano o RemotoEngineering /Remote /RemoteApply for this job

We are a HealthTech scale-up on a mission to reinvent primary care access in Italy ❤️We digitalize and improve the Italian healthcare system, impacting on the one hand the productivity and happiness of family physicians with digital tools they love, and on the other hand facilitating access to healthcare for the citizen according to a logic of phy-digital integration 👩💻Thanks to the innovativeness of our action we have received awards at all institutional levels, from the Ministry of Economic Development, Lombardy Region, City of Milan and nominated by several VCs among the main HealthTech startups at European level. Active since 2019 we are a team with an average age of 30 years and in a hypergrowth phase going from 20 to 100 people in a few months 🌱🎯Your missionSiamo una health-tech startup in forte crescita specializzata nella digitalizzazione della sanità che raccoglie la sfida di rendere l’accesso alla prevenzione ed alle cure più agevole per tutti gli italiani.Se sei una persona brillante, hai voglia di metterti in gioco e ritieni che valori come il talento, la curiosità e la passione facciano parte del tuo DNA, allora il nostro team fa per te!Candidati per fare la differenza!Siamo alla ricerca di un/a AI Engineer da inserire all’interno del nostro team altamente innovativo che opera nel mondo healthcare. Collaborazione solo con P.IVA.Profilo e caratteristiche• TypeScript/JavaScript avanzato• Node.js/Bun• Esperienza con API di LLM (OpenAI, Anthropic, ecc.)• Conoscenza protocollo MCPNice to have:• VueJS• Hugging Face Transformers• Vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate)• Docker• Esperienza con RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation)• NestJS• LangChain.jsChe cosa offriamo• Lavoro da remoto o nella nostra sede di Milano al Talent Garden di Isola• Orari flessibili• Esperienza stimolante in un’azienda dinamica• Formazione continua• Ambiente piacevole dove il team genera valore per le nostre aziende clienti e dove avrai modo di sentirti parte della famiglia• Scrum Agile working methodsApplication Process1. Invia candidatura2. Il tuo CV passerà da una fase di screening inziale3. ti proponiamo un take home project4. colloquio con HR5. colloquio finale con CTO

€150 - €320 a day

🚀 About UsAs of 2019, DaVinci health is one of the fastest growing HealthTech startups in Italy. Our vision for a new healthcare system:● From reactive to proactive care● Evidence-based care based on data analytics● Patient empowermentIn 2 years we have been awarded 7 times by the Ministry of Economic Development, Milano startup 2020, Regione Lombardia and finally by Ambrosetti Forum as one of the 3 EU startups with the strongest social impact working to make the world a better place (cit. Shimon Peres Heritage Award @ Ambrosetti Forum).💙 Our principles● Radical transparency (any info is available to everyone except in very rare cases)● Manager-less (there are no bosses but senior coaches)● Idea-meritocracy (what matters is the value and rational of ideas, not hierarchy)● Entrepreneurship (we are all entrepreneurs with a full sense of responsibility in what we do)● Async and Meeting-less culture (we operate asynchronously minimizing calls to when strictly necessary)Join our dream for a new way of working based on transparency, freedom, results, accountability and trust.A more inclusive and benevolent world that helps people and the organization grow.@Davinci, we not only embrace diversity but celebrate it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community!

Come Operations Intern, entrerai a far parte di un ambiente dinamico e trasversale, supportando il Team in aree strategiche come Finance, People, Legal e R&D. Sarai al centro delle attività operative, partecipando attivamente a progetti concreti che ti permetteranno di acquisire competenze preziose e spendibili per il tuo futuro professionale.Le tue attività includeranno:• Supportare la gestione dei flussi operativi per rendicontazione e analisi finanziaria, imparando strumenti e logiche del mondo Finance• Collaborare con l’area People fornendo assistenza operativa su attività legate alle persone e all’organizzazione aziendale• Contribuire a predisporre la documentazione per i progetti di Ricerca & Sviluppo• Offrire supporto nelle attività di ottenimento delle certificazioni ISO, in paricolare la 9001 e la 27001• Lavorare a stretto contatto con diversi team per ottimizzare processi aziendali con un approccio pratico e orientato al problem solving• Assumere un ruolo attivo e trasversale in tutte le attività del Team OperationsProfilo e Caratteristiche:• Un percorso accademico in corso o completato in Economia, Management o Ingegneria gestionale• Approccio analitico, organizzato e orientato ai dettagli, con ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office• Capacità di gestire il tempo e le priorità in modo efficace, con una mentalità proattiva e flessibile• Attitudine al lavoro in team e ottime capacità comunicative in italiano e inglese• Predisposizione a lavorare in modo autonomo e con una mentalità imprenditorialeChe cosa offriamo• Internship di 6 mesi, con rimborso spese e buoni pasto• Impatti concreti: contribuisci direttamente all’innovazione del sistema sanitario italiano• Opportunità di crescita: in una Scale-Up, la tua crescita professionale avviene a una velocità 10x rispetto a un'azienda tradizionale• Flessibilità e work-life balance: possibilità di smart working e orario flessibile nella nostra sede a Milano (Talent Garden Isola)
